loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. 

Judith requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en: Rhea is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhea is 33 years old and two of her children  are in school. For 14 years, Rhea has run a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food  stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and married with three children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 44 years old and three of her children are in school. Teresa has been running a food vending business in the Philippines for three years. Teresa requested a 8000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, etc. for her food vending business. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Andi. Andi lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about a five- hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Andi lives there with his wife and his only child. Andi owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile air time credits to his community. He learned about Ruma from one of Ruma’s sales executives who came to his stall and he decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology.  

As the business grows, Andi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Andi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Andi is the one who is standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase his daily revenue by selling mobile airtime credits to his community

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una carismática, tierna y muy pujante mujer de 57 años de edad, es separada de su esposo y desde el año 2014 inicio un negocio de confección de línea propia y terceros, su experiencia la obtuvo trabajando en empleos similares donde recibía un bajo sueldo y decidió emprenderse para buscar mayor calidad de vida.
Ella es madre de 4 hijos y es una de las razones fuertes por las que busco una manera para trabajar desde casa, ahora sueña, trabaja por ser una mejor empresaria, por auto superación, sin olvidar la necesidad y un principio fundamental de  humildad.
Ella quiere constituir una enorme empresa para comprar una vivienda propia y dejarles en un futuro una buena herencia a sus hijos pues no sabe cuándo pueda ella faltar, entonces aprovechara en vida para trabajar en post de ellos.
La confección a terceros es con lo que ha podido sostener a su familia y ahora busca un apoyo financiero para complementar estos recursos que obtiene, confeccionando su línea propia, es por ello que con el auxilio financiero desea comprar telas, broches, adornos para confeccionar sus pijamas, ropa interior y sus blusas.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a charismatic, tender and very vigorous 57 year old. She is separated from her husband and since 2004 has had her business sewing her own line of clothing and working for third parties. She gained her experience working in similar work at low wages and decided to go out on her own looking for a higher quality of living. She is the mother of 4 children and it is a strong reason that she looked for a way to work from her house.

Now she dreams of working to become a better entrepreneur to excel by herself without forgetting the need and important principal of humility. She wants to build a large business in order to buy her own house and leave a good inheritance for her children in the future as one never knows when they might fail. So she is taking advantage of her life to work for them.

Sewing for third parties is how she has been able to support her family and now she is looking for financial support to compliment the resources she has and make her own line of clothing. For this reason she wants economic help to buy fabric, broaches and trim to sew her pajamas, underwear and blouses.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make pajamas, underwear and blouses as she wants to make her own line of clothing.

loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Thành works in agriculture raising poultry.

Thành is 24 years old and married with one child.
He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thành faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thành hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Loreta has been engaged in making and selling icing candies within the community. She is 51 years old and has four children. Two of her children are still studying. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to sustain their needs and finance their education. She aspires to improve her business but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP20,000.00 to buy petraco (confectioners sugar), eggs, sticks, wires and crepe papers she needs in making the icing candies. 

Through patience and hard work, Loreta believes that she will further improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy petraco (confectioners sugar), eggs, sticks, wires and crepe paper.

loans.name: Shubie

texts.en:
Shubie has been engaged in a tailoring business for five years. She is 50 years of age, married, and had three children. Two of her children are still attending school while her eldest child is already working. 

Shubie would like to take out a loan of PHP15,000 to be used in buying stocks of garments, zippers and threads. She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan amount. In this way, she could fulfill all her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy garments, zippers and threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en: Jena, 33, is married to a motorcycle driver and they're blessed with two children. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business together with her husband in their town and earns a net income of PHP 450 daily. She and her husband work hard for the better future of their children. That's why their net income usually goes to the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds for their transportation business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that the business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 38, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to July, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Liezel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Liezel is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to buy groceries and other supplies she needs to expand her product inventory.

Liezel aims to build a bigger space to store all of her products. She wishes to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other supplies to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.en:
Ladislao engages in the buying and selling of coconut. He is a 52-year-old married man with three grown children, residing in Talibon, Bohol.  

He also sells copra (coconut meat that is being dried). In order to continue this livelihood activity, he decided to take out a loan.

He has requested a loan to buy more coconut. This will help Ladislao produce and sell more copra. His income will grow and he will begin to handle his business more successfully. 

With this, he could start expanding his business and set aside some savings for future use. He hopes that he will become productive in handling his business for creating a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more coconut.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is a hard-working microentrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines. She and her family manage their household while operating a general merchandise business. She is working hard to continually provide income to meet everyday expenses. 

Liwayway buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it at a small profit. Products she offered are household appliances. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more appliances like electric fans to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liwayway dreams to be able to give her family a good life in the future. She also looks forward for an expansion of her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances like electric fans.

loans.name: Mergina

texts.en:
Mergina is a married, 35-year-old mother of five children, four in school.

Mergina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mergina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mergina has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Mergina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irvan

texts.en:
Mr Irvan, married with 3 children lives on the edge of the metropolitan area of Bandung, that has over 8 million people.  
Most people here rely on ground water for their drinking water. Because of the high population density and the lack of sewers all ground water is infected with fecal bacteria that makes people sick. That is why Irvan decided to start selling Nazava Water Filters that enable people to filter their well, rain or tap water so it becomes safe to drink without the need of boiling and without needing electricity. 

Irvan has a big network and learned trading from his father. Irvan has been active as a Water Filter re-seller for less than a year but he has shown to be a highly effective salesman. Irvan's filter business has shown exceptional growth.
The first loan helped Irvan to start his business. Now he is working with one employee and three sub-agents. This loan will help him further expand his business. This loan will provide safe drinking water to about 200 families or 1,000 people.

loans.use: to boost access to safe drinking water in West Java, Indonesia

loans.name: Lenet

texts.en:
Lenet is 27 years old and married with two children, one in school. Lenet works very hard to provide for her family.

Lenet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries.

Lenet has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lenet would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Deden

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Deden. Deden lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  

Deden is a young guy who had a great desire to learn about how to start up a business. He knew Ruma from one of Ruma’s sales executives that came to his house. His community sees him as a friendly, hardworking and kind mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Deden needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so they can easily contact their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Deden’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Deden is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Mrs Anik, has a family of four and lives in a village in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most populous island. In Indonesia you cannot drink water from the tap so people rely on buying or boiling water before you can drink it. 

Mrs Anik learned about an alternative method of treating water when the marketing team from Nazava water filters organized a safe water education session in her neighborhood. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs Anik who is also the head of her quarter seized the opportunity and became the sales agent of Nazava in her street. 

This loan will allow Mrs Anik to sell about 20 filters on credit to her neighbors; providing about 100 people with safe drinking water.

loans.use: to provide her neighborhood with safe drinking water

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa has a retail business, selling dry food.

Thoa is 43 years old and married with four children.
Thoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thoa has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thoa has been involved in this business forsix years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Thoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 57-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte, and a mother of two grown up children. She is engaged in coconut wine selling. Coconut wine can also be fermented into vinegar. 

Violeta also earns a living through a rice farming business. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell. She believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 400 kilograms of chickens to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 41 years old and married. She has six children and four of them are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gemma has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Eva has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Eva would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emilce Amparo

texts.es:
Emilce, con 35 años de edad, es madre de una hija y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 13 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, la actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de generar un empleo directo y además podrá prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Emilce con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
35-year old Emilce has a daughter, and she and her husband are also responsible for the household. For thirteen years she has run her own business, a beauty salon, which she began as another way of generating income that would allow her to watch over the wellbeing of her family.

Emilce works alone every day from 8 am to 8 pm. She learned about hairdressing etc. by taking classes in a beauty academy, and gradually acquired more knowledge and perfected her skills. As a result she is well known in the area for the quality of her service.

Now Emilce is seeking a loan to help her buy different utensils and supplies at wholesale prices (hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, conditioner etc.) Then she will be in a position to generate employment as well as providing a better service to her clients. In turn this will lead to improved sales and income.

Through perseverance and foresight, Emilce wishes to grow her beauty salon. She will be able to provide job opportunities for mothers who are heads of families. This will result in a better standard of living not only for her family but also for other people.

loans.use: buy hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, conditioner etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a vehicle so he can offer his services at his customers' homes

loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Thành works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for five years.

Thành is 38 years old and is married with two children. He supports two dependents with his business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Thành hopes for his children to do well in school, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Ngô Quyền - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

Nhung is 56 years old and is married with two children. Nhung is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 - Ngô Quyền - Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Mrs. Siti has a family of three and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Siti heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Siti who is also a leader of her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This loan will allow Mrs. Siti to sell about 20 filters on credit to her neighbors making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to provide her community with clean drinking water

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, aged 38, is married and they are blessed with four children. She has managed a livestock business, in particular, raising ducks in their village, for almost eight years. The photo of Analyn was taken at the back of their house, near their farm where her ducks are situated. In this business, she earns a net income of PHP 500 daily, spending this income on their children's school allowances. 

Due to the lack of capital to run her business, Analyn would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase a supply of duck feed for her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of duck feed for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 35, is married with two children aged 10 and three. She earns a living by means of fishing which she has been doing for almost 10 years.  She catches and sells crabs, fish, other seafood and shells. 

To be able to sustain her livelihood, Josephine has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials such as crab nets, with this being a big help for her family. By improving her catch, she will be able to sell more crabs and provide her children with nutritious diets.

Josephine is hoping that she can expand her fishing business to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as crab nets

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is thankful for the 20,000 PHP loan that he was previously granted which he used to purchase scrap materials for his business. His earnings were a big help to fund his children's schooling and meet their personal, household and business expenditures.

Jimmy would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more scrap and recyclable materials. His earnings from his junk shop business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Jimmy hopes to maintain and grow his business to give his family a better life. He prays always to have a loving and harmonious family. Each week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap and recyclable materials

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991 and is married with one child. He is an agrarian man and, with his wife, plants cereals and potatoes. Dilshod also keeps livestock and sells them in a domestic market.

It is hard in Tajikistan to do business in rural areas, as there are many competitors working in agriculture. Dilshod is a capable man who supports his family and tries to work hard to cover family expenditure and needs. He needs to do his business better because his family's expenditure is growing day by day. Dilshod is planning to buy cattle to expand his business. He awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Actualmente, Ivania cursa su último cuatrimestre de la licenciatura en psicología. Ella confiesa que en la adolescencia se dio cuenta que su vocación era esa, pues le era muy fácil escuchar y aconsejar a sus amistades. Por ello decidió dedicarse a la psicología pues, además, de ofrecerle mejores oportunidades de empleo, la satisface y la hace crecer como ser humano, al poder ayudar a sus  pacientes.

Ivania solicita un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de graduación, lo que le ayudará a obtener su título lo más rápido posible y en consiguiente podrá  conseguir mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Entre las metas de ella está: poder ser docente en alguna universidad del país.
texts.en:
Currently, Ivania is studying in her last quarter semester for the bachelors’ degree in Psychology. She confesses that she realized in her adolescence that it would be her vocation, as it was very easy for her to listen to, and advise her friends.  That is why she decided to devote herself to Psychology, as in addition to offering her better employment opportunities, it satisfies her; and being able to help her patients makes her grow as a human being.

Ivania is requesting a loan to cover the costs of her graduation, which will help her to obtain her degree as quickly as possible, and thus be able to get better employment opportunities.  Her goals include being a teacher in one of the country’s universities.

loans.use: to cover the costs of graduation.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines which she has done for the past 10 years. 

Susan has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Her name is Consolacion, 57, and she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating the business through the help of her grown up children. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday needs.

Lydia has been a mineral water distributor for eight years already. She buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers, and sell it per container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. She also earns additional income by selling Vita-Plus natural juice. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product. She is positive for a good return on her investment and she is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her for it will surely help cover her family's daily sustenance.

Consolacion aims to have a bigger place to expand her business. She prays for good health and a loving family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several gallons of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, is aged 56, married to a farmer and they're blessed with three children. Conchita has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient funds in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Msekele Group

texts.en:
Beauty is 33 years old. She has three children and looks after one orphan. She used to be a house wife and obtaining loans helped her to start up a new business. She now sells tomatoes and she depends on this business for her daily needs and for the provision of her children’s welfare.

She started this business in order to be economically empowered and independent. She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more tomatoes and onions.

She plans on sending her children to a better school. The loans have helped her to become independent and she is now able to provide school requirements to her children.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat has a big family. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is single and a student at university. She graduated with excellent marks at school and entered the university, where she studies foreign languages.

Her father is an entrepreneur, and her mother sews women’s traditional dresses. Her parents are not able to pay her tuition fee recently.

Muhabat is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay the tuition fee for her studies. She hopes to get knowledge and be a professional in her major.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities such as sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, condiments, beverages, and toiletries. She is a 28-year-old married woman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Jacqueline has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, rice, and assorted goods. These will attract more customers to shop and purchase. Her income will improve, and she will start to balance her finances.

With the additional income, she is determined to manage her sari-sari store successfully for the improvement of her status of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, and assorted goods.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 29-year-old married man with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells produce such as maize and at the same time has a motorcycle transport business that makes him more income. He is faced with the challenges of limited capital and bad roads which are almost impassable during the rainy season, thus registering income reductions. Besides that, he hopes to educate his child to higher levels of learning. 

Ismail has asked for a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mahsudahan

texts.ru: Махсудахан 52 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. С 1993 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы. Доход Махсудахан всего до 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Махсудахан является одной из 3 участников группы "Жумакан". В будущем Махсудахан хочет увеличивать поголовье скота и накопить на обучение внуков.
texts.en: Mahsudahan is 52, married, and a mother of 3 children.  Since 1993, she's been a crop and livestock farmer.  Currently, she has two cows on her farm.  Mahsudahan's income is roughly 25,000 som per month.  She's requested a loan of 80,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy additional livestock.  Mahsudahan is one of three members of the Zhumakan group.  In the future, Mahsudahan wants to increase the size of her herd and save money for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: purchase some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder es un hombre de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos varones de 7, 5 y 1 año y 2 hijas mujeres de 6 y 2 años, y trabaja como agricultor. 
Él es buen padre, generoso, paciente, emprendedor, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘Chapare’ que es la región con mayor cantidad de parques y reservas naturales, donde se encuentran lugares para los aventureros; navegando los rápidos del río Espíritu Santo por rafting o kayak, experimentando la gravedad del espacio realizando rappel y cannopy, o descubriendo lugares alejados de trekking.
Wilder es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la disfruta junto a su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos; mos 3 mayores estudian en la escuela, los 2 menores aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben llegar al rio que queda a 10 minutos de distancia caminando. Su trabajo es la agricultura, su sectores más relevantes son el cultivo de la banana, palmito, piña, cítricos y coca, actividad que realiza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada hasta que se acaba la luz del día, “el sembradío se debe cortar todos los días porque la selva crece a diario y estropea la plantación…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que vende toda su cosecha a compradores mayoristas que se ocupan de distribuirla a diferentes mercados y comercios de la ciudad, la desventaja es que su esposa cuida a los niños y no puede ayudar todo el tiempo. Su sueño es darle a su familia el servicio de agua potable en su hogar, él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia no tenga que caminar hasta el rio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica al cultivo de la tierra.
Es por esos motivos que Wilder solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia no tenga que caminar hasta el rio a conseguir agua.
texts.en:
Wilder is 21 years old, and he lives with his partner. He has three sons, ages seven, five, and one; and two daughters, ages six and two. He works as a farmer. 

He is a good father, generous, patient, enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard working. He carries out his work in the “Chapare”, which is the region with the greatest number of parks and nature preserves, and where there are places for adventures, such as navigating the rapids of the Espíritu Santo River in a raft or kayak; experiencing gravity and space on a rappelling and canopy tour; or discovering remote hiking areas. 

Wilder has tanned skin, brown eyes, short black hair, a short stature, and a slight build. His mother tongue is Quechua, which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish with the general public and for his work. He enjoys his life with his partner, who works in farming, and with their children.  The three eldest are studying in school and the two youngest are not yet school-age. They live in their own house, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and electricity. To get water they must go to the river, which is a ten-minutes’ walk distance.

His work is farming, and his most important crops are banana, hearts of palm, pineapple, citrus fruit, and coca.  He works from the very early dawn hours until the daylight fades. He says, “The field must be cut every day because the jungle sprouts up daily and ruins the plantings…”  The advantage of his work is that he sells his whole harvest to wholesale buyers that take care of distributing it to different markets and shops in the city, and the disadvantage is that his wife takes care of the children and cannot help all the time.

His dream is to give his family potable water service in their home. He wants to install the potable water connection in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, so that his family won’t have to walk to the river. 

This is his first loan with the institution in the six years that he has been cultivating the land. This is why Wilder is requesting a loan for the installation of potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room: so that his family won’t have to walk to the river to get water.

loans.use: to install a potable water connection in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, so that his family won't have to walk to the river to get water.

loans.name: Snir Nathali

texts.es:
Snir es una madre de 26 años de edad, emprendedora y dinámica. 

Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de yogurt, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que le colabora en las mañanas mientras ella cuida a sus hijos, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 3 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de una moto que le permita distribuir sus productos de una manera más ágil y cómoda, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer sus alimentos de una mejor manera, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Snir, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Snir is a 26-year-old mother, enterprising and dynamic

With the aim of generating income to contribute to the family income, she decided to start her own business selling yogurt. She counts on the support from her husband who collaborates with her in the mornings while she takes care of her children. Like that she has been able to pay for family and personal expenses during the 3 years her business has been in operation.

The loan she is asking for will be intended for the purchase of a motorcycle that will allow her to deliver her products in a more agile and comfortable manner. This will permit her to continue with her work and to offer her foods in a better way, making way for an improvement in sales and for that matter, the income she receives.

Snir, with her spirit of overcoming and her projection towards the attainment of her objectives, plans the goal of growing her business, to have the capacity to serve a larger quantity of customers, that way improving the profitability of the establishment, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver her product

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to buy materials needed for her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Filipinos love to decorate their homes; mothers would change curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets from time to time. Aside from sewing, Juanita also sells Tupperware for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives and the community where she lives. She earns a minimum of 800 a day. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Juanita hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a bright future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her sewing business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He has a secondhand clothes-selling business and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase more clothes such as shirts and trousers for sale. He hopes this will help him pay school fees for his children. He will also use the income to pay back the loan.

This is his fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be self reliant and be able to employ people as a way of improving the economy in our nation.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale and use the income to pay school fees for his children and pay back the loan.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and canned goods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Marilyn dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Sergio Omar

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre de 63 años de edad, muy trabajador, constante, perseverante, generador de empleo. Inicio en el año 2000 un restaurante y con el pasar de los años lo ha ido constituyendo y hoy en día cuenta con 5 trabajadores y espera seguir por la senda del progreso.
Detrás de su gran sonrisa se oculta un dolor puesto que su esposa falleció, pero fueron sus hijos y sus familiares los que le dieron una enorme fortaleza moral y los usa como pilares para fortalecerse cada día más. 
Su sueño es poder constituir un enorme restaurante y no tener varias sucursales, buenos ingresos, pues planea dejarlo como herencia a sus hijos que es lo que su esposa hubiera querido.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones a su negocio, el monto lo justifica en el tamaño y en el tipo de adecuaciones, algunas por piso de porcelana que es lo que estipula la normal para este tipo de negocios.
texts.en:
Sergio is a 63-year-old man who is very hardworking, consistent, persevering, and a generator of employment. He started a restaurant in the year 2000, and he has been establishing it over the years. Now days, he has five workers, and he hopes to continue on the path of progress.

Behind his great smile he hides a pain, because his wife died, but his children and relatives gave him tremendous moral strength, and he uses them as pillars to become stronger every day.

His dream is to be able to establish a huge restaurant without various branches, and with a good income, as he plans to leave it as an inheritance for his children. That is what his wife would have wanted.

He wants to request a loan in order to make some improvements to his business, and the amount is justified by the size and type of improvements, such as a tile floor, which is standard for this type of business.

loans.use: to make improvements to his business, such as laying a tile floor, and painting.

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernando es un hombre de 56 años de edad que se dedica a atender una tienda de abarrotes 9 horas todos los días de la semana, inicio empíricamente como una necesidad de generar recursos ya que no contaba con un empleo y por fortuna y bendiciones este hombre ha ido creciendo y equilibrando su economía.
Es un hombre separado de su esposa pero muy consciente de que tiene una hija y un hijo adolescentes que tiene que apoyar y mandarle recursos para que puedan seguir con sus estudios universitarios, pues para esto creo al empresa para darle todo lo que pueda a ellos.
Se ha proyectado poder generar empleo, le brinda trabajo a uno de sus hijos pro tiempos para que gane capital y el mismo de auxilie en transporte y cosas para la universidad, desea convertir su negocio en un autoservicio más grande y seguirá trabajando con el apoyo de Interactuar y ahora que se entera del maravilloso proyecto Kiva.
Solicita un préstamo para aumentar su inventario, en granos, refrescos y abarrotes que son los productos de mayor rotación en su tienda. Con dicho préstamo aspira a mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, formalizar de mejor manera su negocio y le queda un gran compromiso de cumplir cada uno de ellos para no defraudar a las personas que puedan o no apoyar su iniciativa.
texts.en:
Hernando is a 56-year-old man who makes a living tending a grocery store 9 hours every day of the week. It started experimentally as a necessity to generate resource since he did not have a job and by luck and blessings this man has been growing and stabilizing his income. 

He is a man separated from his wife, but very conscious that he has an adolescent daughter and son who he has to support and give resources so that they can continue with their university studies. So for this reason he created the business to give all that he can to them.

He had planned on being able to generate jobs. He offers work to one of his sons at times so that he can earn capital and he can assist himself in transportation and things for university. He wants to convert his business into a bigger self-service and he will continue working with the help of Interactuar and now that he discovered the marvelous Kiva project.

He is asking for a loan to increase his inventory, in grains, drinks, and groceries that are the products with the highest rotation in his store. With said loan he aspires to improve his sales, increase his client base, increase his usefulness, formalize his business in a better manner and he is left with a great agreement to achieve each of them to not disappoint the people who can or not support his initiative.

loans.use: to stock his business with foodstuff (grains, drinks, and groceries)

loans.name: Lamec

texts.en:
Lamec is 39 years old. He is married with one child. He sells household goods, a business he has done for five years now, and it is profitable. 

Lamec has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase kitchen utensils, water buckets and plastic basins. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to educate his children.  


His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in his business and improve the living standards of his family, and also buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils, water buckets and plastic basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase the supply of milk, to earn more income to be able to meet life and family demands.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children aged seven years old, and Gladys is five years old. 
He has had a quarrying business for seven years, and is currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya. This is his second loan, after successfully repaying his previous loan. He will be using the loan to buy quarrying facilities, animal feeds, sprinkler, pesticides, and fertilizer. 
 
He hopes to use the anticipated profit to cater for his family's basic needs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable quarry business and open hardware too, expand his farming business and enjoy an improved life with his family.

loans.use: to buy quarrying facillities, animal feeds, sprinkler, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en: Merelyn is aged 28 and married to a duck raiser. They're blessed with one child. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, detergent soap, food seasonings, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, detergent soap, food seasonings, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 37 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a motorcycle transport business for five years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle and serve more customers, as well as make more income. He hopes this will help him educate his children and provide for his family's needs. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are buying more motorcycles and being successful.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Sophanny's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sophanny is 24 years old and a mother of a kid. For her living, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is Sophanny's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads the group of two to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es: José, tiene 42 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de San Marcos Ocotepeque. Lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la producción de granos básicos y café. La producción de café es su fuente mayor de ingresos y la vende despulpado y lavado en la misma zona. Está solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Considera que esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la producción. El tiene como meta seguir cultivando café para consolidar un patrimonio.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, single, has three children and lives with them in the municipality of San Marcos Ocotepeque. For 15 years, he has made a living producing basic grains and coffee. Coffee production is his main source of income and he sells it pulped and washed in the same area.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for labor. He thinks that this investment will help him to improve production. He has as a goal to continue cultivating coffee in order to consolidate wealth.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for labor to help his coffee farm.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is 41 years old and a resident of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She overcomes her family’s hardship via growing rice on a six hectare area. This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 49, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children. For the last 12 years, Sophal and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava as the main sources of the family’s income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 80,000 KHR per day from the current business.
 
Sophal has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Saroeng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Saroeng is aged 29 years and widowed. She has two children to take care of. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 10 years and sometimes she works for others for a fee to better feed her children. The current business earns her about 90,000 KHR per day.

Saroeng has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her livings. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy gasoline and pay for labor. She hopes to grow healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland, buy gasoline and pay for labor.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey province, Thmor Pouk district

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Phat is 53 years old and married with three children. To support her family, she has been farming rice for 12 years and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. From the current business, she can earn about 31,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the group loan for Phat’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a third cycle client. The first loan has helped her better support her family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy a hand tractor to support her rice farming. She hopes to produce more rice crops from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor to support her rice farming.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: Mukaddas is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is married and has three children. She has fifteen years experience in sewing traditional women's dress, pillows and blankets. She has regular satisfied customers. Mukaddas is a very patient, honest and gentle woman and her neighbors and customers respect her. She wants to buy new sewing machine, because what she uses now is an old one. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine. Mukaddas hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, aged 51, is a teacher by profession. She is married and has been blessed with four children. 

She has owned and managed a noodle stall in her town for almost three years, and earns a net income of 1,000 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds for her business she has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase needed materials for her noodle vending business. 

She hopes that her business will continue to improve, expand, and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase needed materials for her noodle vending business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more hogs and feeds needed in her business. She is glad that her earnings enabled her to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her piggery, she also earns from her food stall. She is now starting to have her three-story apartment constructed.

Alicia would now like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan to pay for the labor and purchase materials to complete building her apartment to rent out. She is thanking God for a good return on her food stall and piggery business and the financial help that will be given to her. 

Alicia dreams that construction of her three-story apartment will be completed soon and will attract good tenants. She aims to give her children a college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor to construct a three-story apartment to rent out.

loans.name: Zhumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 57 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Много лет она занимается животноводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет 4 коровы. Доход Жумакан в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Жумакан является одной из 3 участников группы "Жумакан". В будущем она хочет увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Zhumakan is 57 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years. Today, her farm contains 4 cows. Zhumakan's average income is 20,000 som (KGS) per month. She requested a loan in the amount 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock. Zhumakan is one of the 3 members of the Jumakan group. In the future, she wants to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. С 2008 года она занимается животноводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет 6 коров. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Доход Нурзат в среднем от 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Нурзат является одной из 3 участников группы "Жумакан". В будущем она хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Nurzat is 27 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2008. Today, her farm contains 6 cows. her husband helps her with the business. Nurzat's average income is up to 20,000 som (KGS) per month. She requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Nurzat is one of the 3 members of the Jumakan group. In the future, she wants to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine engages in a food-vending business. She makes and sells puto (rice cake). Aside from that, she engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed as supplemental income. She is 29 years old and a married woman with three children ages 13, 12 and 3 years old, respectively.

She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and ingredients like cake flour, baking powder, cheese and eggs. These ingredients will be used in preparing rice cakes. These will also help increase the yield of her farm, and her income will be augmented. Thus, she can provide her children with nutritious meals.

Josephine hopes that she would expand both of her businesses to provide for the needs of her growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and ingredients like cake flour, baking powder, cheese and eggs

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is 47 years old, and he lives alone in the village Zovaber of Gegharkunik region. During many years till today he has been engaged in farming and agriculture on his cute farm. In addition to the care of his farm cattle (a cow, sheep and lambs), he also manages potato cultivation as the main source of income for him. He manages to have potatoes of a good sort and of a very high quality, and he sells them wholesale to his already regular customers, who are resellers from the city. 

Artashes needs this loan for his agricultural activities. This loan of 500,000 Armenian drams will be used for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel in order to properly organize the sowing of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel in order to properly organize the sowing of potatoes

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу 61 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на сегодняшний день Рысбубу на пенсии и занимается полеводством и животноводством, в хозяйстве есть корова и 20 овец, а на 2,50 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Бизнес начала с 10,000 сом (KGS) в далеком 1990 году. Благодаря ее непосильному труду Рысбубу достигла хороших успехов, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 5 овец. Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности.
texts.en: Rysbubu is 61 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. Rysbubu is currently retired and involved in farming and animal husbandry. Her farm contains a cow, 20 sheep and 2.50 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale. She started the business with 10,000 som (KGS) in the distant 1990.Thanks to her backbreaking work, Rysbubu achieved good results, and her monthly profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows and 5 sheep. Rysbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows and five sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor for workers in his cocoa gardens

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
Rany, 27, is married with two children. She is residing in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. To support the big family, she has been growing cassava for 15 years. To supplement the income, she also works for others for a fee. 

Rany has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Susanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Susanto. Susanto lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java. It is a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his own son. Susanto owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. Susanto is a friendly and hardworking agent and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Susanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Susanto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Susanto is the one who is standing in front of his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 72 years old. He is married to Joyce who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with seven children who are all adults

He has had a farming business for 30 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 55,000. He has borrowed KES. 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his sixth loan, after successfully repaying his previous loan. 

And he will be using this loan to purchase milking buckets and milking oil, repair milking crush, and buy seedlings and fertilizer. He hopes the anticipated profit will help him to cater to the family's basic needs. His hope and dream for the future is to have a stable farming business,

loans.use: to purchase milking buckets and milking oil, repair milking crush, and buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 30 years old and lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Arayik is not married and he lives with his parents and sister. Arayik mentions that no one in his family is employed and they are engaged in farming and agriculture. Over the last years, Arayik’s father is a little bit unhealthy and all the hard work is Arayik's responsibility. On his farm he has a lot of cattle (cows, calves, heifers, sheep and chickens) and the care of it Arayik does properly and already very skillfully. His farm products are meat, milk, cheese, curd, macun (national dairy-product) and eggs, and he sells all these with the help of his mother at the city’s wholesale market. Land cultivation he also manages alone; on his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, peppers and greens and the harvesting and sale of it he organizes with the help of her sister. So all together, helping each other, they try to provide their family with a better living condition. Arayik wants to develop his farm and make it richer with cattle.

Arayik asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy two calves and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a retail shop for five years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase flour, sugar, rice and milk to sell to get more income and hopes this will help him to educate his children and buy a plot of land. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are be successful in his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice and milk to sell to get more income and he hopes this will help him educate his children and also to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy human drugs to sell

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.ru: Ташбубу успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем,кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 15 овец. Ташбубу арендует 1,0 Га земли, где выращивает арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ташбубу вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закупку семян, удобрений и подготовку земли к полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Ташбубу планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития ее дела.
texts.en: Tashbubu successfully paid off her first loan and she is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone who gave her financial support.  Her farm now has 15 sheep and she also rents a 1-hectare plot of land, on which she grows watermelons for resale.  Her monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to develop her business further, Tashbubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank again for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer and to prepare the land for the sowing.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and watermelon seeds in order to grow organic products

loans.name: Zurabu

texts.ru: Зурабу, 42 года, замужем,есть 3 детей. У Зурабу средне-специальное образование, уже 15 лет в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 6 овец, на 1,34 Га выращивает картофель и клевер для реализации. Зурабу известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и хочет приобрести участок для строительства дома.
texts.en: Zurabu is 42 years old and she is married with three children.  She has a specialized high school education and for 15 years, she has been engaged in farming work, which is the main source of income for her family.  She has seven cows and six sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.34-hectare plot of land, on which she grows potatoes and clover for resale.  Zurabu is known as a principled, honest, organized and reliable person.  Today, her business brings her a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to develop her business further, Zurabu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business and she wants to get a plot of land, on which she can build a home.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она по-прежнему торгует в собственном магазине продуктами питания и продуктами для дома, есть товар на сумму 450,000 сом (KGS). Ее  ежемесячная прибыль составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товара в обороте, что позволит ей развить ее деятельность, увеличить прибыль.
texts.en: Ryskul successfully paid off her first loan and used it for the intended purpose.  She is grateful to the Kiva fund and everyone who gave her financial support.  She still works in her own store selling groceries and items for the home - the goods in her shop are worth 450,000 som (KGS).  Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS).  Ryskul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank again for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to expand her assortment of goods on offer so that she may expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products in her shop

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Siempre trabajadora, atenta y muy pulida es la señora María quien se desempeña como confeccionista a terceros, la cual desempeña esta actividad desde el año 2011, que aprendió gracias a unas clases. Gracias a los servicios de desarrollo empresarial de la corporación Interactuar esta mujer ha podido desarrollar mejor su idea de negocio ya que no está a la deriva y tiene claro en los puntos que debe trabajar para lograr primeramente una sostenibilidad de negocio y luego pensar en invertir para cumplir otros proyectos como lo son iniciar su propia línea de confección.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar una compra inteligente, desea comprar insumos y una maquina propia.
Esto apoyara e incentivara moralmente a esta empresaria ya que no tendrá que pedir prestado y podrá realizar el trabajo desde su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is always a hard worker, attentive and well polished. She works as a third party sewing contractor, work which she has done since 2011. She learned thanks to some classes.

Thanks to the business development services of the Interactuar corporation, this woman has been able to better develop her business plan now that she is no longer adrift. She knows clearly which points she should work on to first achieve business sustainability and to then think about investing to complete other projects, like starting her own clothing line. 

Maria wants to request a loan to make an intelligent purchase. She wishes to buy supplies and her own machine.

This will support and morally encourage this businesswoman since she would not have to borrow and she will be able to do the work from home.

loans.use: to buy her own machine and supplies. (she is starting in the world of garments)

loans.name: Geancarlo

texts.es:
Geancarlo es un joven de 20 años de edad, de Colombia. Es soltero y muy emprendedor. 

Geancarlo es el un proveedor de ingresos para su familia. En 2013, abrió una barbería. Para ayudarle a continuar operando su negocio, que está solicitando un préstamo de socio KIVA.

Se utilizará el préstamo para comprar un mueble, un tv plasma y un aviso para su negocio, lo cual necesita para seguir operando. 

Se espera un incremento en sus ingresos, ya que se está expandiendo su trabajo, y que espera que su negocio crezca. 

Él sueña con ser capaz de alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Geancarlo is a 20 year old youth from Colombia. He is single and very entrepreneurial. Geancarlo is the wage earner for his family. In 2013 he opened a barbershop. He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to help him continue operating his business.

He will use the loan to buy furniture, a plasma tv and a business ad, which he needs to continue operating. He expects increased income since he is expanding his work and hopes his business grows. 

He dreams of being capable of achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy furniture, a plasma tv and a business ad.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 32 años de edad y vive con su esposa, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old and lives with his wife. He has a shop for metal structures and makes doors, balconies and bars, among others. He has been doing this work for more than 5 years and has a lot of experience which helps him to improve his work every day. 

He already has many customers who seek him for the quality of his work and his affordable prices but above all, because he always does the work to the customers preference. 

He requests a loan from Integral that will allow him to purchase iron, metal, tools, etc. In this way he can have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
