Liliana es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 23 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 11 meses comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como jeans, camisas, camisetas, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 7 horas.

Liliana tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Liliana is an enterprising and dynamic young woman. She is 23 years old and is a student and an independent merchant. 11 months ago she started to sell merchandise to her relatives, friends and colleagues from university in order to generate income to support her household and pay her tuition fees. 

The loan that she is asking for is to help her strengthen her business as she will invest in purchasing merchandise at wholesale such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts among other items. This will provide her clients with a better service and more variety which will increase her businesses' profits. 

She works alone for seven hours every day. 

Liliana has the clear purpose of taking her business forward as she wants to make it successful and therefore ensure that her family has a better quality of life. She knows that through Kiva lenders and Corporación Interactuar she can achieve all this and more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts among other items.

loans.name: Heiner

texts.es:
Heiner tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, sus pobladores son personas amables que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de crianza y venta de cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para la construcción de más corrales donde pueda criar a sus cerdos así como para la compra de alimento para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para mejorar su negocio y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ganancias que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Heiner is 30 years old and has a partner and two children. He lives with his family in the Nueva Arica district, a rural area in the Chiclayo province in Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast. Here, life is peaceful; the locals are friendly and mainly make a living in farming, trade and raising animals.

Heiner himself works raising and selling pigs at his business, which is located in his own home. Heiner has had this business for more than two years and has regular customers who provide him with good personal and professional references. This loan will be used to build more pens to raise Heiner’s pigs and to buy feed for his animals. This investment will help Heiner to improve his business and tend to his local customers’ needs. This will allow him to earn a higher income, and thus improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to build more pens to raise his pigs and to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Sonia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad dedicada al comercio, crianza de animales y agricultura, que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, pollos, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como cerdos, patos, gallinas, cuyes, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ventas y le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old and has a partner. She lives in a privately owned house with her partner and two children in a rural area of Cayaltí, where the people work in farming, trade and raising animals. Cayaltí is in the Chiclayo province of Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast.

Sonia makes a living raising and selling farmyard animals, including hens, chickens, ducks, and turkey. She has been doing this work for ten years and has good personal and professional references from her neighbours.

Sonia will use this loan to buy more animals, such as pigs, ducks, hens, and guinea pigs in order to increase stock at her business. This loan will allow Sonia to expand her business and satisfy her customers’ needs; this will then be reflected in higher sales and will allow her to earn a higher income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as pigs, ducks, hens, and guinea pigs in order to increase stock at her business.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de 46 años de edad,  es originaria de Managua, madre soltera con  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, e independiente económicamente, blanca se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus familiares. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la  elaboración y venta de tortillas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene dieciséis años de tener el negocio, su rutina de trabajo es de unas diez horas diarias elaborando y vendiendo sus tortillas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra un quintal de maíz, bolsas, leña, gas, cal etc.  Blanca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old. She is from Managua and is a single mother with four adult children. She is economically independent and can be described as hardworking, responsible, eager to improve. She enjoys spending her free time with her relatives. 

She demonstrates her eagerness to get ahead through her business of making and selling tortillas. She has been doing this for sixteen years and her business is located in her house. She works for ten hours every day making and selling tortillas. 

The loan will be invested into the business and will be used to buy work materials such as a quintal of corn, bags, firewood, gas, lime etc. in order to make and sell tortillas. Blanca is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer people with limited resources and people from poor countries like Nicaragua as this support allows these people to obtain decent jobs.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as a quintal of corn, bags, firewood, gas, lime etc. in order to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo de 59 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 11 años se dedica a la albañilería, por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre gustan de sus productos. Eduardo desea terminar un cuarto de su vivienda que como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra a medio construir ya que sus ahorros no fueron suficientes para terminar la mejora, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir un cuarto de su vivienda, sabiendo que no necesitara invertir en mano de obra, pues e mismo realizara la obra.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 59, is a hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife and two children, ages 17 and 12.  He has been working for 11 years as a bricklayer and, thanks to his vast experience, has many customers who like his work. 

Eduardo wants to finish one of the rooms in his house which, as seen in the photo, is only half built because he did not have enough savings to finish it.  Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish the room.  He knows he does not have to pay labor costs because he can do it himself.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish a room in his house.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Rigoberto, tiene 31 años de edad, convive con su compañera de hogar, su actividad principal es la caficultura, actividad que le generan muy buenos recursos, cuenta con más de 3 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica ya que para este año espera una muy buena producción. 
Don Rigoberto está  solicitando financiamiento para la compra de abono ya que por los momentos no cuentan con los recursos suficientes para abonar sus cultivos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Rigoberto su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica en el futuro, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así sentir el apoyo que prisma de Honduras y Kiva le estarían brindando.

                                                                                   
                                                                     Trojes, Honduras Febrero 2015
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 31 years old and lives with his life partner. His main work is in coffee farming from which he has a good income. He has been doing this for three years and this year he is expecting good levels of production.

Rigoberto is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer because at the moment he does not have enough money to fertilise his coffee plants. This will allow him to improve his income and cover his family's expenses and financial commitments. 

Rigoberto dreams of improving his living conditions and having more stable finances in the future. The support that he would receive from the loan would help him realise these dreams and therefore experience the support that Prisma Honduras and KIVA are providing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es: Jose de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia junto con su esposa, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mas madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He owns a workshop in which he makes and sells a variety of furniture. He has been doing this for many years and many people prefer his work because of its good quality and good value. With what he earns from his work, he manages to pay off some of his household expenses. He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in his business and to buy more wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and other items. With these items he would be able to attract more clients and therefore achieve his objective of improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and other items

loans.name: Margarita Rosa

texts.es:
Ella es Margarita una mujer de 30 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 4 y 3, se desempeña en un su hogar con los servicios de cibercafé donde añadido vende productos de papelería y está buscando alternativas para comprar una fotocopiadora para complementar y completar su negocio.
Junto con su esposo se han trazado varios sueños, ella quiere tener un local propio, y juntar recursos para comprar una vivienda y viajar por el mundo que es su gran sueño.
Ella en este momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que quiere invertir en varias cosas, una de ellas es para la reparación y mantenimiento de sus computadores, otra quiere comprar un portátil, y el resto del capital lo quiere invertir en la compra de una impresora la cual podemos ver en la foto.
Tu aporte sería muy importante en las intenciones de progreso de la señora Margarita que con pasos cortos pero firmes quiere consolidar un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
This is Margarita, a 30-year-old woman who is the mother of two children, ages four and three.  Out of her home she runs an Internet Cafe where she also sells stationery products.  She is looking for ways to buy a photocopy machine to complement and complete her business.

She and her husband have planned to carry out several dreams.  She wants to have her own shop and save money to buy a house, as well as travel around the world.

For the time being she is requesting a loan for several purposes.  She wants to repair and maintain her computers and buy a lap-top.  The rest of the loan will be used to buy the printer shown in the photo.  Your contribution to Margarita's progress is very important.  She is making short but firm steps toward consolidating a profitable business.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer and a printer (seen in the photo).

loans.name: Beky Marley

texts.es:
Beky, a sus 33 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio almacén de ropa; allí trabaja todos los días durante 11 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es la falta de capital para su negocio. 

Beky manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Beky, 33, is the mother of two children who she is raising with much effort and dedication.

For quite some time she has worked as an independent merchant in her own clothing store.  She works 11 hours every day and has been able to generate an income to cover family expenses.

She says her interest in the loan is to buy a variety of wholesale clothing including blouses, jeans, women's pants, etc. to have enough stock on hand to satisfy customer demand.  With variety to offer she can improve sales and increase her income.  It will also help her overcome her greatest challenge in the business: not having enough capital.

Beky says her greatest goal is to improve the conditions of her home and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wholesale clothing, including blouses, jeans and pants.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Lina ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que abrió su restaurante hace 2 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos e ingredientes como harina, maíz, carne, pollo, aliños, entre otros.

Con estos ingredientes podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo.
Su principal dificultad es el Alto costo de los insumos.

Apoya a Lina con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
With a smile and a big heart, Lina has been well-received in her neighborhood since opening a restaurant two years ago.  With great effort and a goal in mind, she wants to get ahead and improve her family's living conditions.

The loan is to buy supplies and ingredients like flour, corn, meat, chicken, dressings, and other items.  She will use the ingredients to continue cooking and preparing the delicious food she serves.  Her main challenge is the high cost of supplies.

Please support Lina's business and help make her life a better one through your loan!

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients like flour, corn, meat, chicken, dressings, and other items.

loans.name: Neris Orlando

texts.es:
Neris de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado debido a que  tenía que ayudar a su padre con los cultivos, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los  oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos que están pequeños, vive en casa de sus suegros pero solo su pareja y sus hijos dependen de él.

Neris se dedica a vender pan y pizza en una motocicleta, él le ayuda con la venta a otra persona, ya tiene dos años en este trabajo al cual decidió dedicarse pues los ingresos de las cosechas no alcanzaban para mantener el hogar, por lo tanto realiza ambas actividades.

Este joven necesita el crédito para comprar 5 bolsas de harina, una  mesa, espátula, bandejas, y otros utensilios para iniciar su propio negocio de elaboración de pan.

Sus planes son tener una buena panadería y poder distribuir sus productos a otros negocios, además planea ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan obtener una carrera y así puedan desarrollarse mejor en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Neris, 25, only has a fifth grade education because he had to help his father with the crops.  He has a partner and she takes care of the domestic tasks. They have three small children and live with his parents-in-law, but only his partner and the children depend on him.

Neris sells bread and pizza from a motorcycle.  Another person helps him in the sales work which he has been involved in for two years.  He decided to go into business because the crop activity was not enough to support the household, so he does both jobs.

This young man is in need of a loan to buy five bags of flour, a table, a spatula, trays and other utensils to start his own bread baking business.

He plans to have a good bakery and distribute his products to other businesses.  He also plans to help his children get an education and earn a degree so they can do better in society.

loans.use: To buy five bags of flour, a table, a spatula, trays and other utensils to start his own bread baking business.

loans.name: Motea'

texts.en:
Motea’ is 26 years old. He lives in Nablus city with his wife and child. He has a restaurant for traditional food. He has opened the restaurant two years ago in a popular area. The customers like his meals and he treats them gently. He has very good experience, as he's worked for three years before he opened this restaurant.

Motea’ applied for this loan to purchase a display refrigerator and make simple decorations. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. His dream is to expand his business and desires to use part of the profits on his children’s education in the future. 

Motea’ is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator and make simple decorations.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 27 years old and lives with his family. He has a poultry farm for selling chicken meat. He started his business in 2012 but it still needs a lot of improvement, so he applied for this youth loan to buy a large quantity of chicken, feed and a new chicken plucking machine. It will help him improve his financial conditions and will lead to being able to support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

Hassan is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a huge quantity of chicken, feed and a new chicken plucking machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 39-year-old mother from Kisumu, married and has five children.

She has had a retail shop for six years and generates a monthly income of KES 5,000. Alice has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase fresh eggs, sugar and milk to resell to her customers. 

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh eggs, sugar and milk to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando con un amigo en un taller donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Jorge al ver que su trabajo estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Trabaja solo durante 10 horas todos los días.

Jorge se encuentra soltero y es padre de 1 hijo pequeño, a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Jorge ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Jorge aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Jorge aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Jorge has been a carpenter for a large part of his life and he started in this trade from a very early age when he worked with a friend in a workshop and learnt how to do it.

Upon realising that his wage was very poor, Jorge decided to set up his own carpentry workshop where, thanks to the quality of his work, he has been able to obtain many clients.

He works alone for 10 hours every day. 

Jorge is single and father to one small child for whom he has always wanted to offer a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress. 

Because he has not had enough capital, he has had to turn down some orders from his customers as he has not been able to buy the necessary raw materials.

With the aim of improving his living conditions, Jorge hopes that a loan will allow him to buy raw materials such as wood, glue and nails among other items in order to accept the numerous orders from his clients. 

Jorge hopes that the loan will allow him to accept and make these orders without affecting his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, glue and nails among other items.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
This charming woman’s name is Arus, and she lives with her big family in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Arus has higher pedagogical education and many years of work experience in this field. For many years, Arus managed to work both as a journalist at the local TV channel and also as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature at the school. She is a little bit strict, but is a very clever and patient pedagogue. Thanks to her intellect and many years of experience, she is already the director of the same school where she worked as a teacher for many years. 

Arus has a group of pupils, to whom at her house she gives paid private courses of her subject, preparing them for the entrance exams. For these activities she needs this loan amount. With the loan of 600,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) she wants to buy professional literature. She will also buy a table and chair for the room where she works with pupils, to make the workplace more comfortable both for her and for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy professional literature and a table and chair for the room where she works with pupils

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kratie Province’s Prey Prorsob district, Sophal, 49, has three dependent children in total. All of them are still in school. 

Sophal raises pigs while her husband works as a paid worker to make a living. Together, they can earn about 38,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. Sophal has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy piglets for raising

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
Veasna, aged 43, lives in a rural village of the Chhloung district and has one kid. She and her husband have been growing corn and rice. She has been in this business for 25 years. The current business earns her about 33,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. 

This is the micro loan for Thuon’s group of two members who are both female, and she is the second cycled client. The past two loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve financial burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now requesting a loan, Veasna, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her business. She hopes to grow more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her business

loans.name: Touer's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie Province, Touer is aged 41 years and married. She has two children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and catching fish for 23 years. The current business earns her family about 33,700 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Touer has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already, and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and to pay for her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Oynabat

texts.en:
Oynabat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is married and has three children. 

She started to do business since 2012 trading women's and kid’s clothes and nutrition products in a small store. She wants to help her husband with the household and run a business. Her husband is an agrarian and merciful to Oynabat for her support. 

She is planning to buy nutrition products and kid's clothes for sale. She needs to widen her business to gain additional income. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy kid’s clothes and nutrition products for her store. Oynabat hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy kid’s clothes and nutrition products

loans.name: Wafika

texts.en:
Wafika is a 45-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and four children. One of them is working, and the others still attend school. Wafika and her husband cooperate together and wish to bring added income and enhance their way of living. 

She started her own business by opening an internet café in 2012. Today, she looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase computer accessories. Definitely, this will boost her work and smooth her business operations. Her future dreams are to be able to take bigger projects little by little.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of brewing Waragi, a local drink in his village, and at the same time he is a farmer growing tomatoes and maize. 

He is faced with hardships of limited capital, which delays his business plans of expansion to new areas. He has future prospects of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

He has asked for a loan to brew Waragi, a local drink in his village, to sell.

loans.use: to brew Waragi, a local drink in his village, to sell.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es:
Danilo es una persona del campo, se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, actividad que le permitió ser independiente y buscar algo diferente para su familia, inicio dicha actividad en el año 2014 por preocupación por el futuro de sus dos hijos que tienen 4 y 9 años de edad, puesto que antes era empleado pero su sueldo básico solo alcanzaba para lo básico y no quería conformarse con llevar una vida común.
Ahora con su negocio esta persona está floreciendo, progresando, dando una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Danilo quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y alimento de engorde para sus animales, este préstamo aportara a su avance, proyección y cumplimiento de las metas de 2015 que son consolidarse como un fuerte y próspero vendedor  en el mercado.
texts.en:
Danilo is a man of the countryside. He works breeding chickens and pigs, an activity which allowed him to be independent and look for something different for his family. He started that occupation in the year 2014, because he was worried about the future of his two sons who are 4 and 9 years old. He used to be an employee, but his salary was only enough to buy the basics, and he did not want to settle with a common life. 
Now, with his business, he is flourishing, progressing, giving a better quality of life to his family. Danilo wants to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs, chickens, and fattening feed for his animals. This loan will help him in the advancement, progression, and meeting of his goals for 2015, which are to become established as a strong and prosperous salesman in the market.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens, and also buy animal fattening feed.

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es:
Mauricio es un hombre trabajador, leal, ordenado y responsable. A la edad de 57 años, es propietario de una tienda de abarrotes y a la vez trabaja por su cuenta, para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y ofrecerle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. Todo comenzó hace mas de 9 años, cuando su esposa le propuso poner una tienda con unas remesas que su hermano le mandó, negocio que al poco tiempo se convirtio en sólido y próspero. 
Por ello, solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su tienda de abarrotes, y comprar diversos productos como: granos básicos, aceite, huevos, salsas de tomates, gaseosas, etc. Con lo que podrá cubrir la creciente demanda de sus clientes, a la vez, generará mayores ingresos económicos. Además, él espera poder ahorrar para trasladar su negocio a un lugar propio, pues en la actualidad, debe pagar arrendamiento.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a hard-working, loyal, organized and responsible man. Aged 57, he owns a grocery store and is self-employed. He does this so that he can cover the household costs and give his children better opportunities.

It all began over nine years ago, when his spouse suggested opening a store with some money sent from their brother. The business did not take long to grow strong and prosperous.

So now, he is requesting a loan to invest in his grocery store, to buy various products such as dry beans and grains, oil, eggs, tomato sauces and sodas. This will allow him to meet his customers' growing demands, and at the same time, earn a larger income. 

He also hopes that he can start saving up to move his store to his own location, as currently he has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy various products such as dry beans and grains, oil, eggs, tomato sauces and sodas

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en:
This cheerful and active woman’s name is Alvina and she lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her beloved husband with whom she manages all the work on their cute farm. Here she has two cows, five sheep, four lambs and ten chickens. She says that from her farm’s milk she makes the tastiest cheese and butter, for which many years she has her regular customers. Her husband helps her in potato cultivation and they also sell them from their house. 

She greatly wants to make his farm larger, and with this loan he hopes to buy one more cow and animal fodder for her farm cattle. She wants to thank you beforehand for financial support which she greatly hopes to receive.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación de señalizaciones vehiculares para camino.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajador, su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área periubana caracterizada por agrupar a productores manufactureros en todas las áreas y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de repartir esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente  aproximadamente 21-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Miguel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de carteles y señalizaciones para la circulación vehicular. Él se ocupa de la fabricación de señales de tránsito, como Reglamentarias; CEDA EL PASO, PARE, NO ENTRAR, PROHIBIDO ESTACIONAR, etc., Advertencia, como; CURVA A LA DERECHA, ROMPEMUELLES A 100 MTS, ALTURA MAXIMA, etc., e Informativas; PRIMEROS AUXILIOS, TELEFONO, ESTACIÓN DE SERVICIO, HOSPEDAJE, etc. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente durante toda la semana, sus clientes son empresas constructoras, complejos deportivos, hoteles grandes y otros. “inicié mi negocio con la fabricación de letreros, busqué constantemente mi mercado hasta que por medio de amistades me especialicé en señales de tránsito…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el rubro, la desventaja es que cuenta con un taller pequeño. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y contar con clientes continuos, el dese realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo, como; planchas metálicas, tubos de acero, pintura y otros, para continuar con su actividad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la fabricación de señales de tránsito para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 22-year-old man, single, without children, and his business is the production of automobile traffic signs for roads.
He is entrepreneurial, independent, dedicated, responsible, and very hard-working. He does his activity in the zone ‘plan 3000,’ a Peruvian area characterized by grouping manufacturing producers in every area, and wholesale retail distributors who are in charge of distributing those products in the different markets of the city. It has a topical and warm climate, very damp, with a room temperature of 21-32 degrees Centigrades during the whole year.
Miguel is brown skinned, has short black hair, brown eyes, medium height, medium physical shape. His mother tongue is Guarani, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish because of general culture and because of this business. He lives in his parents’ house, which they own, and is made of brick and cement with a calamine roof, and has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. His business is the production of signs for automobile circulation. He does sign manufacturing such as Rules: YIELD, STOP, DON’T ENTER, PARKING FORBIDDEN, etc., Warning: CURVE AHEAD, SPEED BUMP AT 100 MTS, MAXIMUM HEIGHT, etc., and Informative: FIRST AID, TELEPHONE, SERVICE STATION, LODGING, etc. He does this occupation independently throughout the week. His clients are building companies, sport complexes, big hotels, and others. “I started my business producing signs, I constantly looked for my market until, through friends, I specialized in traffic signs,” he says. The advantage of his business is that he has a lot of experience in the area, the disadvantage is that he has a small workshop. His dream is to expand his workshop and count with loyal clients. He wants to purchase working materials, such as metallic sheets, steel tubes, paints, and other, to continue with his occupation. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that he has had this occupation.
It is for these reasons that Miguel asks for a loan, for the purchase of working materials for the production of traffic signs to continue with his business.

loans.use: to purchase work materials for the production of traffic signs to continue with his business.

loans.name: Monica Nayibe

texts.es:
Monica, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hija de 2 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de La Dorada, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de un masajeador y productos de cosmetología.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Monica a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Monica, in her tireless search for a better life and more economic stability for her two year old daughter, started a hair and nail salon, offering her services at home in the municipality of La Dorada, an area where the residents highly value drive and energy.

She works every day with varying schedules, she is always busy offering someone her services as her good work is very sought after. She is requesting a loan to buy a massager and cosmetics products.

Nowadays she is happy because of the work she is doing, and because she is able to enjoy a more stable job.

With a loan, you can help Monica to continue with her life project!

loans.use: to buy a massager and cosmetics products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As her way of generating income, Maria has engaged in cooking and selling street foods in her community for almost a year now. She is 35 years of age and blessed with children. Her husband is Remegio and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To increase her sales, Maria would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will buy additional raw products like pork and chicken, and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, seasonings and other materials needed in her food stall business

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, es una mujer muy luchadora, por falta de recursos económicos no fue a la escuela; está  casada y su esposo vive en Estados Unidos, tiene una hija que actualmente está estudiando noveno grado.

Ana, tiene una tienda y lo ha administrado desde hace 4 años, fue su madre quien la motivo a que invirtiera en un negocio, con lo poco que su esposo le enviaba; fue así como ella opto por colocar una tienda en su casa.- Antes, únicamente se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar, su hija después de salir de clase le ayuda a atender a los clientes.

Ella solicita el crédito para invertir más en su tienda, específicamente comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, detergente, entre otros. De esta manera asegurara sus ingresos, porque ofrecerá más variedad de productos, que sus clientes solicitan.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y comercializar en grande; así como también darle la oportunidad a su hija que siga estudiando, para que se gradúe de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is a very determined woman. Due to her family's financial situation, she could not go to school. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. She has a daughter currently studying ninth grade.

Ana owns a store which she has managed for 4 years now. After school, her daughter helps her serving the customers. It was her mother who encouraged her to start a business with the little money her husband sent her. That is why she decided to open a store in her house. Before that, she used to stay home and tend the house.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in her store, she will use it to buy rice, beans, sugar, soap and detergent among other items. This way she will ensure her income, since she will be able to offer a wider range of products to meet her customer's needs.

She wishes to expand her business to sell in bulk, but also to give her daughter the opportunity to go on studying so that she can go to college and get a degree.

loans.use: to stock her store, specifically to buy rice, beans, sugar, soap and detergent among other items

loans.name: Roum's Group

texts.en:
Roum, 28, is married with four children residing in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Kamrieng district, Cambodia. She has four children; one is in school while the other three are too young for school. For the past ten years, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 60,000KHR per day.

Roum has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the previous loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase rice production to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 61-year-old married father of two children. He opened a cafe three years ago to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his beloved family. Ahmad is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to improve his cafe and attract more customers. 

Thus, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with drinks and candies requested by customers. Ahmad hopes to develop his business more in the future to increase his income and to remain capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with drinks and candies requested by customers

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 35-year-old single lady who has had a grocery shop for thirteen years. She is a hard worker who has a good reputation among those in her region, as she succeeded in gaining loyal customers throughout the years.

Ayda is an ambitious and sacrificing lady. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new requested products, as she wants to help her brother in finishing his house.

Ayda wishes her brother a better life, and she hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new requested products, and help her brother in finishing his house

loans.name: Mohniso

texts.en:
Mohniso is married and has five children.  She was born  in a remote district where she currently lives. She is a sewer who sews traditional women's dresses and attracts satisfied clients. Mohniso and her husband, who is an emigrant, are keeping their family together. They like to support each other in their difficulties and prosperity.  

Mohniso is a person who is hard-working, capable, generous, gentle and hospitable. She likes her sewing activity and plans to buy a sewing machine for her business. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine so she can work more actively. Mohniso hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Some years ago, Shahida started her business of tailoring to run her household's activities. Shahida is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has received much appreciation from her community. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Shahida has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors to stitch up more dresses on time. This will boost her earnings: she wishes to spend her increased income providing her family members with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Muneer

texts.en:
Muneer, aged 45, is a married woman who deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Muneer makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Muneer needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. As she is very experienced and has good contacts in the market, with this loan, Muneer will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1981 in a village. She is divorced and has two children.

She is a business woman and trades at a domestic market selling kids clothes. Her goods are good quality and attract a lot of customers. Marhabo has permanent, satisfied clients all around.

She wants to widen her business and buy a new collection of kids clothes and additional goods like textiles. Marhabo awaits Kiva lenders mercy and asks for a loan to help realize her plans. She needs to be supported, because she alone is responsible for the growth of her children. It is hard for her to keep her family, so that is why she is doing a business.

loans.use: to buy kids clothes and textiles

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de carpintería donde elabora una variedad de muebles posee 20 años de experiencia en esa actividad, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos todo por mayor y asi seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sabino, 56, lives in his own house with his wife.  He has a furniture shop where he makes a variety of furniture.  With twenty years of experience in this business, he has a lot of customers because of his good work and good prices.  He's able to pay some of his household expenses with his earnings.

Sabino's asking Integral for a loan to invest in his business with a wholesale purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other supplies.  That way he can keep working, earn more profit, and have greater financial stability.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other supplies

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.en:
Zeboniso is divorced and has three children. It is not easy for her to raise her children and she tries to work hard to feed her family. Zeboniso was born in a small town in a remote district. She is a businesswoman who trades at the domestic market selling clothes. Basically, Zeboniso sells women's clothes and, in her business, she attracts satisfied permanent clients. She is a person who is responsible, honest, hard-working, bright and kind. 

Zeboniso is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a collection of clothes to sell. She is hoping to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon describes himself to be creative and humble. He has operated a dairy farm for 4 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Zablon will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. His business goal is to have more cows within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will maintain the business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a Kiva borrower who has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. For the past 3 years, she has operated a retail business selling clothes. Carolyne's business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

Carolyne will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be able to import clothes to sell within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business. Carolyne's previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. A previous loan was repaid successfully. He will plough back the anticipated profits to his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as trustworthy and reliable. 

She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and goats. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay is aged 50 years and married with four dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, earning a living through growing rubber and working for others for a fee. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR39,000 per day from the current business.

This is Lay’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Lay, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for growing her rubber trees. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing her rubber trees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
This pretty and charming lady is 22 years old and she lives with her parents and brother in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. Shoghik graduated from Yerevan State University, the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. From 2013 til today she works in her native village school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She is a very patient, clever, and kind teacher, who the pupils respect very much. She mentions that during her lessons, the pupils are very attentive and interested, so during the year they manage to have high scores and good results. Shoghik’s parents are farmers and her brother is a constructor. 

Shoghik hopes to receive this loan since she wants to buy a computer and methodological literature for her pedagogical activities and self-development.

loans.use: to buy a computer and methodological literature for her pedagogical activities and self-development

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard, with his big family, lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. From his very young age til today he used to do different constructional works in the city and in his village but, as he likes to say, he is skilled in constructional work but a master in farming and agriculture. 

With his son he takes care of a rather big farm; here he has cows, calves, heifers, pigs, sheep and a lot of chickens. Like many farmers he also mentions that the main profit is from the sale of meat (mutton, beef and pork) and also potatoes that he cultivates on his plot of land. 

On his land he also planted apple, apricot and mulberry trees, and he sells this harvest with his wife at the city’s wholesale market. His wife also sells their farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and eggs. Edvard now is very busy with his potato cultivation activities.

This loan he needs, as it is time for sowing and he plans to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land, with hopes that he will manage to have a perfect harvest of potato in the month of September.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk with his wife, two children and retired mother live in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Manuk never did any work other than farming and through that til today he earns his family's living. He takes care of cows, calves, bulls, a pig, piglets and chickens on his farm, and thanks to the cattle he sells meat and milk, plus eggs to his villagers and neighbors. His land is also source of income for his family, as he planted on it potatoes, which he sells to re-sellers. 

Manuk works all day long and hardly meets the ends. It is very hard for him to also pay the tuition fee for his son, who studies at the State Agricultural Institute in the paid division. It is especially hard for him after the winter months, during which the costs are more than the income from farming.


He will be so happy if he manages to receive this loan of 240,000 Armenian drams to pay his son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She is 40 years old and is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City. She has been operating a 7-Eleven franchise for six years now, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs. She and her partner had to work hard with the determination of having a better income.

7-Eleven has been one of the fastest growing convenience store chains in the Philippines. In almost all major streets or corner of any city you’ll find this store. Their products and services include a variety of grocery items, fast foods, mobile phone items, bills payments, and much more. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 20,000 PHP in sales a week.

To improve sales, Mary Jane would like to apply for a loan to purchase more items needed to continue the operation of her store. With an amount of 25,000 PHP (Philippine pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, fast foods, mobile phone items and many others. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to open a new branch. She hopes for her family to be always healthy, happy and loving. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, fast foods, mobile phone items and many more because she will expand her business

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en:
Thavry, 51, lives with her husband in a village of Kratie province’s Prey Prorsob district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cashews. To supplement the income, she also sells desserts in front of her house. 

Thavry is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cashews to grow. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more cashews for growing

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), is running a business selling animals in her community. It allows her to meet her household expenditures. 

She dreams of expanding her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, biscuits, peanuts and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, peanuts, and biscuits. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweets, peanuts, biscuits.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a transport business. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as fuel price fluctuation. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to maintain and service his tuk tuk. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper. He will use the anticipated profits to meet family needs.

loans.use: to maintain and service his tuk tuk.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She has had retail business for eight years and it has been profitable. She will be using the loan to purchase more stock of maize flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. She hopes this will help her generate income, which she will use to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the current business and be able to provide food for the family and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk and cooking oil for sell and increase her income to educate her children.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to own a mini supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good family. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more chicks. Her business goal is to have a large scale farm within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells building materials such as sand, ballast, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are house builders. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sand, stones, and ballast. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sand, stones and ballast.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a large-scale business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, a 30-year-old married woman, has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Abida makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, Abida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Abida  wishes to use part of her revenues to provide a good quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 49 years old, is a married woman. 

She deals in selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 36 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants  to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Элмира и доходам от кредита, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы и 20 овец, 2 козы. На земельном наделе мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Элмира планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на проведение в доме отопления.
texts.en: Elmira successfully repaid her loan. She is grateful to Kiva and all those who helped her with the financing. Thanks to Elmira's hard work and the earnings from the loan, she currently has two cows, two goats, and twenty sheep. She also grows beans on a 2.0 hectare plot of land and earns around 12,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Elmira has again applied for a loan with Bai Tushum Bank, this time in the amount of 105,000 som (KGS) to buy twenty sheep to fatten and sell. Elmira plans to expand her business and save money to install home heating.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale in order to save money to install a heating system in her house

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en: Vitore wants to invest in a transportation vehicle for her husband who not only works as a cook in a nearby restaurant, but also has been transporting workers as well for some other company.

loans.use: to invest in a transportation vehicle for her husband, as the old vehicle has broken down

loans.name: Eulises Fernando

texts.es:
Eulises es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 36 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano, yuca y tomate, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 4 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Eulises manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Eulises Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Eulises is a humble and hard-working farmer.  He is 36.  In childhood he learned all the work of a farm thanks to his father's lessons.  At the moment he has banana, yucca, and tomato crops whose harvests he gathers and sells in the market of the town where he lives.  This generates enough resources to bring home daily sustenance and to settle the basic needs of his wife and four children.

He was motivated to ask for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of wholesale agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides, and fertilizer. This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and to improve the productivity of the next harvest, which will benefit the income that he receives per sale.  Eulises says that his largest desire is to continue fighting to generate stable finances and to offer his family better living conditions and wellbeing.

Eulises' crops can be maintained and he can succeed in life with your help.

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. 

Along with her husband, Azra has been doing a business of animal purchasing and selling for many years. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Now, Azra has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan  to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Zaib Unn Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib Unn Nisa is 25 years old. She is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and resale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana  is a 30-year-old married woman. 

Rehana is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Rehana ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Rehana  has requested 45,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers thus providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras salcochadas su negocio esta en la afueras de la unidad de salud que esta cerca de su casa, posee muchos clientes por la zona donde está ubicada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solevantar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de verduras por mayor (papas, zanahorias, güisquiles, yuca, pipianes, etc.) y asi poder seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta is 42 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She works selling cooked vegetables. Her business is located outside the health center that is close to her house. She has a lot of customers because of the area where she is located. With her earnings, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables at wholesale prices (potatoes, carrots, pear squash, cassava, squash, etc.) to be able to continue with her sales; and to have together with her husband, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale prices (potatoes, carrots, pear squash, cassava, squash, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration activity.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de chinelas y ropa para todas las edades.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’, caracterizado por ser el de producción de la ciudad, donde microempresarios de áreas, como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, reproducen productos extranjeros para que se comercialicen en los principales mercados locales, es el barrio más poblado del lugar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-32 grados centígrados.
Rosa es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus familiares, tienen una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de chinelas y ropa para todas las edades, las prendas que más oferta son; chinelas de todos colores y números, poleras manga corta, pantalones cortos, bermudas y otros, la mayor parte de su mercadería es ropa de verano porque en el lugar el clima es cálido casi todo el año. “aquí hace mucho calor y la ropa que se usa es mayormente corta y de verano, las ventas son buenas y constantes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se comercia rápidamente, la desventaja es la moda que cambia los diseños de la ropa. Su sueño es abrir sucursales y vender por mayor, ella desea refaccionar el techo de su negocio para evitar las filtraciones de agua y arruinar la mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la refacción del techo de su negocio para evitar que el agua arruine la mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 50-year-old woman who is single with no children. She has a business selling flip-flops and clothing for all ages. 

She is enterprising, independent, constant, patient, responsible and hard-working. She carries out her business in the ‘plan 3000’ area, which is characterized by being the production area of the city, where micro-entrepreneurs in areas such as sewing, design and artisan products reproduce foreign products so that they can be sold in the main local markets. It is the most populous district in the place, and the climate is warm and tropical with a temperature that varies between 21 and 32 degrees centigrade. 

Rosa has a dark complexion, is of short stature, has long black hair which she ties up, brown eyes and a medium body type. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family.
