She speaks Spanish at a general knowledge level and to run her business. She carries out her life in the company of her family, who have their own house built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity and a sewer system. 

She has a business selling flip-flops and clothes for all ages. The clothing items that she offers the most are: flip-flops in all colors and sizes, short-sleeved t-shirts, short trousers, Bermuda shorts and other items. Most of her merchandise is summer clothing because the climate is warm nearly all year round. 

Rosa says: "Here it is very hot and the clothing that is used is mostly short summer clothing. Sales are good and constant…”.  The advantage of her business is that the clothes are sold quickly. The disadvantage is that fashion changes clothing designs. Her dream is to open branches and sell wholesale. 

She wants to repair the roof of her business to prevent water leaks from ruining her merchandise, which is why she is asking for a loan. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years that she has been developing this business.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her business to prevent water from ruining her merchandise

loans.name: Urozoi

texts.en:
Urozoi is a bright and cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a sewer and sews traditional women's dresses. She serves clients at home. She has six years' experience of doing business. She is communicable and gentle with clients and knows her duty well. 

Her home where she lives is not comfortable enough to live in. She is patient and hopes to have better conditions for living. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells firewood. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. His business goal is to be a large-scale supplier within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a convenient place, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in the seasons. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will support her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman, and she has four children. 

Lucy operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are hotels. 

Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of chickens. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

Lucy's business goal is to be successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her life.

loans.use: buy more stock of chicken

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be capable. 

Grace operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, and she has one child. 

Mary operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. 

Mary will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a big dressmaking business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus nietos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 62 years old. She lives in her own house with her grandchildren. She has worked for many years preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has many customers. With what she earns, she is able to pay for some household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in quintals and lime powder to continue making tortillas, and in this way have a better income so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in quintals and lime powder.

loans.name: Faranavela

texts.fr:
Faranavela est une femme dynamique de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec ses 2 filles encore en bas âge. Elle fait un élevage de poules pondeuses et se charge également de la livraison.

Cela fait 3 ans qu’elle est partenaire chez Vahatra. Les différents prêts qu’elle a obtenu lui ont permis d’agrandir son élevage ainsi que de renforcer son capital. Grâce à ce prêt, elle pense donc continuer d’étendre son activité en achetant un nombre plus important de poules ainsi que de la provende qui leur garantit une alimentation adaptée et équilibrée.

L’avenir de ses enfants est une priorité pour cette jeune mère de famille et elle espère, à terme, pouvoir leur construire une maison.
texts.en:
Faranavela is an energetic 27-year old woman. She is married and lives  with her two young daughters. She breeds laying hens and also takes care of delivery to customers. She has been partnering with Vahatra for three years. Her prior loan have allowed her to expand her poultry business and bolster her capital. 

Thanks to this new loan, she plans to t continue developing her business by buying a large number of hens as well as balanced nutritional feed for them.
For this young mother, her children’s future is what matters most. She hopes, with time, to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and feed meal.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 47 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 50-year-old married Lebanese woman who ives with her husband and two children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. Due to bad circumstances, she decided to support her husband, a farmer, and works days and nights to be able to manage her expenses and business operations. 

She has owned a small mini-market since 2007 and asks for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase food for the mini-market.  She will be able to increase her revenue and improve her way of living. She looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase food.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 41-year-old hardworking man with 6 children who lives in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of distilling waragi for a local brew in his village, and earns additional income  selling maize and cassava. 

He has limited capital which prevents him from expanding his business into new areas. However, he has future hopes to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy maize and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy  maize and casava to sell.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 49-year-old Lebanese single woman who lives with her parents.

She started her own business and opened a clothing shop in 2005. She is a talented person and sells different clothing designs for women and children. She is has a good reputation and is well-known in her region. 

Zeinab requests a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to buy new summer clothes for her business, renovate her shop, and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy new summer clothing for her business.

loans.name: Le Jourdain 2.1 Group

texts.en:
Antoinette is a member of the community bank group Le Jourdain 2.1 in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. Antoinette has over 20 years of experience in selling some of the core food stables for Congolese families, such as manioc (cassava), cakes, and salted fish. Along with her subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs, Antoinette is planning to invest significantly in her business to grow and expand for the future. 

Having been with HOPE Congo for two years, she now plans to use this loan to purchase fresh products to add to her already wide variety of food sales. Antoinette has dreams of one day becoming a significant figure in the business world in Brazzaville by opening a freezer service which she hopes will provide her with enough revenue to build a house for her and her adopted, orphan son.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and meat for her food stand.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. Her business is located in an area with good rainfall and her primary customers are locals.

Grace describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have at least five cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an adorable family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Abaida

texts.en:
Abaida , is a 39-year-old married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, adds embroidery patterns, and  sells to the people of her locality.  She offers a great product selection and earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

Abaida  has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and  thread to meet customers’ demand consistently and to increase her net income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and thread.

loans.name: Le Jourdain 2.2 Group

texts.en:
Doris is a  member and leader of the community bank Le Jourdain 2.2, who has operated a used clothing store for 7 years. He and  11 other members of his group requests loans.

 Doris will use the loan to purchase bulk quantities of used clothing to add to his already vibrant business. Some of his keys to business success include encouraging repeat customers and a careful purchasing. 

He has a 6-year-old child and 1 niece under his care.  Doris wishes to expand his second hand clothing store and to provide the best education possible to his young family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of used clothing for his second hand clothing store.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Нури 43 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Нури среднее образование, с 1997 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова и 3 бычка. На 7,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает кукурузу, ячмень и клевер. Нури известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нури обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нури планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена построить дом для ее семьи.
texts.en: Nuri is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. Since 1997 she has been farming to earn her family's primary source of income. She currently owns a cow and three calves. On seven acres of rented land she grows corn, barley, and clover. Nuri is well known as a principled, honest, respectable, and reliable person. Today her work earns a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Nuri is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to put toward buying calves for fattening and resale. She plans to use income from use of the loan to develop her business and also intends to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan  is 57 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of five children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Hanifan  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 53 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  31 год назад она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нуржамал имеется 3 коровы, 25 овец и 3 лошади. На 4,5 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну и ячмень. Бизнес в месяц приносит около 16,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых коров. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Nurzhamal is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Thirty-one years ago she used 8,000 som (KGS) to start a business raising animals and farming. Today Nurzhamal owns three cows, 25 sheep, and three horses. She grows barley and alfalfa on 4.5 hectares of rented land. The business earns around 16,800 som (KGS) monthly. In order to further develop her business, Nurzhamal requested a 150,000 som (KGS) loan from Bai Tushum Bank for purchase of purebred cows. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her herd.

loans.use: to buy purebred cows in order to expand her herd.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Hannah describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved an living standard. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ghinwa

texts.en:
Ghinwa is a 28-year-old married mother with three children. She decided seven years ago to start working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband to meet the needs and expenses of their family.

Ghinwa is a hard worker and ambitious woman who succeeded with her professional skills and gained loyal customers. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open her own beauty salon. This loan will help her build a better future with a good business, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon.

loans.name: Shagufata

texts.en:
Shagufata  is a 29-years-old married woman. She is a very talented seamstress with a good reputation in her community. She has a tailoring business to help with household expenses and works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She  requests 40,000 PKR  to purchase spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors to make more dresses, increase her earnings,  and provide a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors.

loans.name: Gabriel Tenorio

texts.es:
Gabriel desde hace 30 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.

Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.
Tiene que enfrentar la fuerte Competencia en el sector agropecuario


El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Gabriel has worked in agriculture for 30 years.  He gets up every day to work and take care of his land, where he grows mainly bananas.  He learned on the job and little by little has perfected his techniques and ability in this line of work.  He also works as a day laborer to earn additional income.

Now he's proud of what he has been able to build with his effort.  He's grateful to the Interactuar company and to Kiva lenders for their opportunities to make progress.  He has to confront strong competition in the farming sector.

He's requesting a loan to invest in soil amendments, irrigation, and pesticide.  That way he can keep his land in optimal condition for his crops.

Gabriel's biggest dream is to have his own house where he and his wife can enjoy old age.

loans.use: to invest in soil amendments, irrigation, and pesticide to keep his land in optimal condition for his crops

loans.name: Azmia

texts.en:
Azmia is a 59-year-old married woman who has sold birds for many years. She and her husband purchase baby birds from the market, raise them, and then sell them in the local market. Azmia feeds and cares for the birds and her husband sells them in market. They earn enough through their business to meet the day to day expenses of their family and 4 children. 

They want to increase their earnings and educate their children. Azmia requests 45,000 PKR to purchase a variety of birds in order to expand their business and ultimately their sales. 

They are confident that after the expansion of their business their dreams would come true ultimately.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of birds.

loans.name: Mereme

texts.en:
Mereme is a 46-year-old villager and a mother of two now, since her 14-year-old daughter past away last year after suffering from a serious illness. 

“This past winter, my house’s roofing was damaged completely, and we covered one room where we decided to stay, with cardboard and some straws, in an attempt to prevent the cold and rain and snow. Yet to no avail; it was unbelievably cold here, and we must repair the roofing immediately,” she said.  

Her family’s source of income is agriculture/livestock. They have two dairy cows and six sheep and own 4,500 square meters of agricultural land where they have planted grapevines. They make the traditional alcoholic drink locally called raki, and they sell it to restaurants and bars in the nearby city. They also sell homemade cottage cheese and butter, grapes and baby animals.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of their house since now it's covered with cardboard and straws

loans.name: Leonel Fernando

texts.es:
Leonel es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo plátano; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Caicedo.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de plátano.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel is a farmer, humble and hardworking with the drive that distinguishes men and women in the field.

He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind. From a young age he learned the trades of the field such as cultivating crops and raising animals, so much so that today he has his own plantain farm with food that he sells in the marketplace in the town of Caicedo.

He aims to increase his crops and improve those that he already has. It is for this that he came to the help of a loan with Corporación Interactuar to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and plantain seeds.

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person, in addition to increasing his income and continuing to provide sustenance in his home.

Leonel just wants to be able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and plantain seeds.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen and her husband have successfully built their business selling blankets and bedspreads with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. They have a good number of customers and earn a good income. 

They used a previously Kiva loan to expand their business. Nasreen is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for  45,000 PKR to purchase a variety of blankets and bedspreads. This will enable them to increase their sale to more cities and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of blankets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 39-year-old woman mother with 5 children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband is a professional rickshaw driver. 

His rickshaw has not worked properly and her husband is unable to earn an income. Her husband wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible but does not have the  money. Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 48-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for seven years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Sajida's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories like pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Sajida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband in purchasing these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials like iron sheets, cement and wood to sell so she can use the income to educate her children and pay back the loan

loans.name: David Roberto

texts.es: David de 44 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: David, 44, lives alone is his own house. He owns a shop located in his place of residence. He began the business seven years ago with his own capital. He has many customers for his good prices and variety of products. He earns the income he needs to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to purchase more soups, eggs, grains, soft drinks, candy, baked goods, and more so that he can have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soups, eggs, grains, and more to stock his store

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, they attend school. 

She has worked from home as a seamstress since 2000 and helps to meet everyday needs. She is well-known in her region and has a good reputation. Nohad requests a second loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new tailoring machine. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 37 year old hardworking lady with 6 children who lives in Fort Portal Uganda. She grows a type of banana called Kisubi that she sells in her village. She also grows sorghum. These 2 businesses  have helped her to buy land. She does not have the money to expand her plantation. She is working very hard to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Annet will use the loan to construct her house.

loans.use: to construct her house.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio desde hace 50 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y cría de animales, diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de frutas.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.
Tiene que enfrentar la gran dificultad de la falta de capital para trabajar.


El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Julio, 50, earns his living in agriculture and animal husbandry. He rises daily to work in his fields in which he grows mostly fruit crops. He learned this activity through observation and gradually has refined his techniques and skills in the field. 

He generates an additional alternative income through his work as a laborer. Today, he is proud of what he has built with his efforts and he is very grateful to Interacturar and Kiva lenders for the opportunities they provide to help people progress.

He has to face the great difficulty of the lack of capital for work. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, irrigation, and pesticides to keep his land in good condition for his crops. His dream is to own a home and be there to enjoy his old age with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, irrigation, and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the store and to improve his housing.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has 2 young children and wants to buy fodder for her animals. The income for the family of eight comes from selling raw milk and $93 pension of en elderly parent who lives with them. Kindly note that this family is extremely poor; they fall just below the poverty level. 

The following was submitted by the interviewer: "When i walked in their house, i could not believe it that someone could actually live under such conditions; filth, lack of sanitation, no electricity, lack of adequate food and nutrition...it was so very heart-breaking that I literally burst in tears and couldn't stop. The little one seen in the picture, went to the chicken nest and tried to treat me to two fresh eggs. I couldn't put the two together, extreme poverty and generosity. Sometimes, the staff of VFA  makes donations to such families, such as food and clothing, yet, there are way too many families living like this in rural Albania, unfortunately.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es:
Ariel es un hombre de 30 años de edad fuerte, trabajador, humilde y servicial lleva trabajando en su finca gran parte de su vida y todos sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a su familia que realizan actividades similares. 

Padre de un hijo menor de edad el cual quiere educar con las buenas costumbres del campo pero tratando de que pueda acceder a una buena educación y no le toque un trabajo tan pesado para sobrevivir pues no cualquier persona ejerce esta profesión. 

Su sueños más latentes son Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y Sostenibilidad del negocio


Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos, semillas y cerdos buscando mejorar y aumentar su producción pues es ambicioso y piensa es darles a sus hijos todas las herramientas para forjar un excelente futuro
texts.en:
Ariel, 30, is strong, hardworking, humble, and helpful. He has been working on his farm for much of his life. He learned all his knowledge thanks to his family who all perform similar activities. 

He is the father of a minor child who he wants to teach the customs of the farm life while trying to access a good education for his child so that the child will not have to do such hard labor to survive required from anyone working in farming professions.

His dreams are to improve their housing conditions and the sustainability of his business.

He is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, irrigation, seeds, and pigs. He is looking to improve and increase production because he is ambitious and wants to give his children all the tools they need to build an excellent future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, irrigation, seeds, and pigs for his farm

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad, este humilde hombre se encuentra muy satisfecho por el primer crédito, porque  gracias a ello logro mejorar su vivienda, ahora su casa ya cuenta con piso, su familia y él se encuentra en mejores condiciones.
Miguel pensando siempre en la prosperidad, ahora ha deseado comprar una cuerda de terreno para cultivo de café y banano, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar el terreno, es por eso que solicita un préstamo de Q 5,500  para cumplir su mayor anhelo.
El gran sueño de Miguel es poder construir una galera para sus cajas de abejas que tiene.
texts.en: Miguel is a 62 year old father of a family. He is a humble man who remains very satisfied with his first loan. Thanks to it he managed to make improvements on his house. Now his house has a floor and he and his family live in better conditions. Miguel is always thinking of becoming prosperous and now he wants to buy a plot of land to grow coffee and bananas. But one problem he has is that he doesn't have enough capital to buy the land. So he is requesting a loan of 5,500 GTO to fulfill his greatest wish. Miguel's dream is to build a gallery for the bee hives that he has.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to cultivate coffee and bananas.

loans.name: Firdoos

texts.en: Firdoos is a 45-year-old married woman who has sold  stitching supplies for 3 years to support her husband. She offers different laces, ribbon, thread, and buttons in different colors. She is known for providing good material to her customers. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet  the family's expenses. She needs to contribute to the family income to meet household expenses and  educate her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of thread in different colors. It will improve her earning and enable her to better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 52-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has run a  tailoring shop in the local market for 3 years and is responsible for meeting  the needs of the entire family.

Naseem's husband needs to buy fabric, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories but does not have the finances.  Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase these tailoring accessories so that he can increase his income.

Naseem is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children. Her husband has worked in the public sector for many years and is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Sajida provides sewing services and earns the income.

She needs needles, thread, fabric, machine oil and other supplies for her business, but does not have the money to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase accessories and  increase monthly sales.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 34-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for three years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Robina's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories like pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband in purchasing these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring accessories to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Amal1 Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Amal1 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zeinab is a 30-year-old married lady who has been working as a tutor for three years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay the expenses of her necessary dental treatments.

Zeinab is the lady pictured on the left. With respect to the other group members, Samia is the lady standing in the middle, and Hind is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her necessary dental treatments

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 36-year-old married father of three children. He has been working as an electrician in a company for twenty-two years to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Hassan is a hard worker and a sacrificing father who is trying his best to satisfy his family's needs, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.

Hassan hopes to open his own electronics shop in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 5 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en el que prepara y vende arepas en su casa. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar maquina de moler, pesa, cortadora, e insumos como harina y maíz.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la competencia pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman of experience, knowledge and patience. She is the mother of 5 children and has worked almost all her life bringing them up.

She has a small business where she makes and sells arepas (corn pancakes) at her house. She works from 5 am until 3 pm each day in order to have her product ready and fresh for her clients who in the majority are neighbors in the area where she lives.

She wants to capitalize her business and have a good supply of ingredients and an inventory of products. So she is requesting a loan to buy a milling machine, weights, a cutter and supplies like wheat and corn.

One of her principal difficulties in the competition but she is confident that with the help of the Interactuar Corporation and the good hearts of the lenders at Kiva that she can move her business forward.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine, weights, a cutter and supplies like wheat and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and they provide the family with extra financial support. She has worked as a tailor for 10 years and is very talented. She’s well known in her area. 

She will use the loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new tailoring machine and supplies. She is very optimistic and ambitious and wishes to own a tailoring factory.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and be able to meet the increasing demand for milk supply and make more income to educate her children and also buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 32-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for three years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Kousar's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories like pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Kousar has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic waste from neighbors and resell it to recycling companies for the production of sachet water

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 46-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a house wife and her husband has run a photography business for five years.  Her husband is  responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nasira's husband needs to buy a camera, lighting equipment, and other supplies but does not have the money. Nasira has planned to help her husband by requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will be used to buy equipment  and earn additional income by providing better services.

Nasira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase a photography business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 44-year-old married father of three children who has been working as a janitor for ten years to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Due to the increasing living costs, his salary is not enough anymore. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. 

Said hopes to open his own business in the future to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом 29 лет. Она и мать. Гуландом понимающая и верная жена. Она понимает, как мужу тяжело обеспечить семью в одиночке. Она хочет ему помочь. На районе ей тяжело найти работу и она научилась шить, чтобы брать заказы на шитье одежды на дому. Гуландом научилась шить и теперь ей необходимо купить швейную машинку. Швейная машинка стоит дорого, но это необходимая покупка, без которой ей не удастся начать деятельность. Она накопила денег, но все равно не хватает и Гуландом обратилась за кредитом с надеждой на поддержку.
texts.en: Gulandom is 29.  She is a mother, and an understanding, faithful wife.  She understands how hard it is for her husband to provide for their family all on his own.  She wants to help him.  It's hard to find work in her area, and she learned how to sew to be able to take orders for clothing out of her home.  Gulandom learned how to sew, and now she needs to buy a sewing machine.  A sewing machine costs a lot, but it's a necessary purchase, and she won't be able to start her business without one.  She's accrued some savings, but doesn't have enough money all the same, and Gulandom has requested a loan with hopes of receiving support.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and start a new business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac, 27, is married to Grace, and they have been blessed with two children. He has been practicing tea farming on a large scale, and it has been profitable. He will use this loan to buy a dairy cow in order to sell milk, and he hopes this will enable him to increase his income so as to improve his family's living standards. He also plans to use the generated profits to provide quality education to his children and expand his farming activities by buying farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. His future hope is to improve his farming methods and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for her restaurant and fabric to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to supply more milk to his customers, generating more income so as to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to sell more milk and make more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.name: Uwiduhaye

texts.en:
Uwiduhaye is 35 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of one and eight years. Two of them go to school. 

Uwiduhaye sells shoes, and he has been doing business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sincere (1) Group

texts.en: Arel is a member of the community bank group Sincere (1) in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. He leads a group of four other micro-entrepreneurs. Arel has been a client of Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, for nearly five years, and he has requested his seventh loan with HOPE. His business focuses on selling two main products: clothing and music CDs. With his loan, he is planning to buy some blue jeans, dress shirts, and polo shirts to add to his inventory. With four children between three and twelve years old and with an additional family member under his roof, Arel hopes that with future business success he will be able to ensure the quality education of his family.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, blue jeans, and dress shirts to resell.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is a 42-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 20 years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Sabiha's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories like pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy above these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Sabiha has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband in purchasing these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Sabiha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en: Venantie is 54 years old. She is married with four children aged between 17 and 28 years. They all go to school. She sells shoes and she has been in this business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes and bed covers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 76 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  76  a été formé par 5 personnes dont 4 femmes et un homme qui sont membres d’un même réseau : Association pour le Développement des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout (ADFCP) de cette localité qui se trouve à environ 10 km de la ville principale. Ils s’activent dans différentes activités.  Ils se réunissent chaque fin du mois pour organiser des tontines et discuter de la situation du réseau. 
La présidente, Madame Marème, s’active dans le commerce de produits cosmétique depuis plus de 05 ans. Avec ce crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va acheter des laits de corps, des savons de beauté, des parfums. Il faut noter que Marème participe aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle commence la journée à 9h pour la terminer à 21h
Elle aimerait augmenter son pouvoir d’achat si son fond de roulement peut augmenter et cela avec l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 76 group is made up of five people, four women and one man, who are are members in the larger Association pour le Développement des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout (ADFCP), which is located about 10 kilometers from the main town. The group members do different types of work. They meet at the end of each month to organize the savings group and discuss the status of the group.

The president of the group, Marème, has worked selling cosmetics for more than five years. With this loan, she is going to buy lotion, beauty soaps, and perfume. She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 9 p.m.

It should be noted that Marème helps to support her family's daily expenses.

She would like to increase her buying power, which she can do if she increases her cash flow with the help of UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as lotion, beauty soaps, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to be able to supply more milk, enabling her to improve her family's living standards as well as buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 57-year-old mother from Vihiga, a region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married, has two children, and supports seven people in their family.

She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more frying pans, kettles and utensils so as to serve many customers. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more frying pans and cooking utensils so as to serve many customers

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old. She is married with five children aged between 8 and 17 years.  They all go to school.

She sells clothes and she has been doing this in a business for the past 12 years. With the loan, Vestine would like to buy more bed covers to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers to sell

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix de 29 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa trabaja  en una escuela fuera del pueblo, tiene una hija de 8 meses de edad, y nadie más depende de él.

Félix trabajaba en la agricultura, pero luego decidió ser motorista, ahorró para comprar su propio carro y así es como ahora hace viajes y halando materiales de construcción.


Él solicita el crédito para invertir en un proyecto de construcción en su casa ya que sus ingresos no le permiten cubrir el gasto.
 
Él espera seguir trabajando y en un futuro estudiar alguna carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Félix is 29 years old and was able to graduate from high school.  He is married and his wife works in a school outside of their town.  They have an 8 month old daughter. No one else depends on him.

Félix works in agriculture, but he decided to be a driver and saved to buy his own car. In this way he makes trips and hauls construction material.  He is asking for a loan in order to invest in a construction project for his home.  His regular monthly income will not allow him to make the necessary purchases at one time. 

He is hoping to work and in the future to pursue a university career.

loans.use: to invest in a construction project for his home.

loans.name: Enjellushe

texts.en: Engjellushe or 'Angel' in English is back again needing your help. She wants to invest in a cooler now for the tractor that her husband uses. The season has already started for plantations.

loans.use: To invest in a cooler for the  tractor that her husband uses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate the land, purchase seeds and grow melon and watermelon

loans.name: Melina Pilar

texts.es:
Melina es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 12 años y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, atenta, de buen carácter, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘kalajahuira’ lugar donde se encuentra la tranca del mismo nombre y es un lugar de paso obligado por los conductores de transporte para salir de la ciudad, los lugareños crían ovejas y otros animales como forma de trabajo, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Melina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo hasta los hombros, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en construcción y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, huevos, refresco, aceite, papel higiénico, pilas, galletas, tarjetas de teléfono, pasta dental, etc., en su tienda de barrio de lunes a domingo en horas del día. “inicie mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, luego abrí una pequeña tienda de barrio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es una de las únicas tiendas que atiende a los transportistas que van de paso, la desventaja es que las distancias para abastecerse son largas. Su sueño es abrir un micromercado para la atención de viajeros y transportistas, ella desea abastecer su tienda con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para atender a transportistas y viajeros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Melina solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda de barrio con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para atender a transportistas yviajeros.
texts.en:
Melina is 42 years old, married and has a 12 year old daughter. Her business is selling food and basic needs items in her neighborhood store. She is a good mother, enterprising, attentive, of good character, responsible and very hard-working.

Her business is located in the ‘Kalajahuira’ area, It has a police check point there and It is the obligatory route for transport drivers to leave the city. The locals raise sheep and other animals as a way of work. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Melina is dark-skinned, long black hair down to her shoulders, dark eyes, low in stature and thin. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in construction and her daughter who studies in school. They live in a house that they constructed themselves out of brick and cement with a metal roof that has electricity, running water and sewage.

Her business is selling food and other basic items like bread, eggs, soft drinks, oil, toilet paper, batteries, cookies, phone cards, toothpaste, etc in her neighborhood store that is open from Monday to Sunday during the day. "I started selling itinerantly and later opened a small store" she comments. Her advantage is that she is one of the few stores that serve the drivers that pass by. Her disadvantage is the long distance that she has to go to stock up. Her dream is to open a mini-supermarket to serve the travelers and drivers.

She wants to stock her store with food and and basic use items to serve the drivers and passengers. This is her first loan with the institution in the 10 years she has been in this business. For these reasons Melina is requesting a loan to stock her neighborhood store with food and basic use items to serve the drivers and travelers.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store with food and basic food items to serve drivers and travelers.

loans.name: Groupement "astou"

texts.fr:
Le groupement » Astou » » rassemble des dames qui s’activent dans le commerce et qui se sont réunies afin de pouvoir bénéficier du financement octroyé par l’U-IMCEC à ce réseau de femme.
La présidente, Astou s’active dans le commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle a intégré le réseau de vente des produits à base d’aloès-Vera et a acquis une clientèle solide dans ce domaine. Mais elle ne s’en arrête pas là car elle vend aussi des produits divers, des bijoux et des produits cosmétiques. Astou est célibataire et n’a pas de charges. Les bénéfices vont augmenter la somme à reverser aux fournisseurs pour recevoir plus de marchandises. Astou veut augmenter son rang de vendeuses de produits d’aloès, elle souhaite aussi ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
The Astou group is made up of women who work in commerce and who joined together to benefit from financing through UIMCEC. 

The president, Astou, has worked in commerce for five years. She has integrated herself into the sales market of goods made from Aloe Vera, and she has acquired a solid group of customers. But she has not stopped there; she also sells cosmetics, jewelry, and other goods.

Astou is single and does not have anyone under her care. Earnings are going help her increase how much stock she buys from suppliers. She wishes to climb the ranks of Aloe-product retailers and also open a shop of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewelry, and other diverse goods

loans.name: Telolahy Francois

texts.fr:
Telolahy Francois est un jeune homme de 25 ans qui vit en concubinage. Le couple partage son logement avec la mère et la cousine de François. Ce garçon dynamique et responsable s’est lancé, dès l’âge de 21 ans, dans le démarrage de sa propre activité pour pouvoir, dans un premier temps, aider sa mère chez laquelle il est hébergé. Il a effectivement ouvert une petite épicerie devant son domicile. Son partenariat avec Vahatra a commencé il y a 3 ans et lui a permis de diversifier progressivement les produits qu’il propose à ses clients.

Son épicerie est aujourd’hui bien approvisionnée (bonbons, gâteaux, couches, cahiers et divers produits de première nécessité) mais il souhaite encore améliorer son activité et agrandir son lieu de vente. Il pense donc utiliser le prêt pour augmenter son stock et acheter une plus grande quantité de produits de première nécessité (huile, riz, sucre, savon et divers autres produits alimentaires) dans l’optique de pouvoir répondre aux besoins et à la demande de ses clients.

 Actuellement, il pense à son propre avenir et espère pouvoir prochainement construire sa maison pour être plus autonome et avoir son propre foyer avec sa concubine avec laquelle il souhaite fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Telolahy Francois is a young 25-year-old man who lives with his partner in a home with his mother and his cousin. He is dynamic and responsible. At the age of 21 he started his own business initially in order to help his mother who he lived with. He started a grocery store in front of his home.

With his partnership with Vahatra, which started three years ago, he has been able to progressively diversify the products that he sells. His store today is well stocked (candy, cakes, diapers, notebooks, and other basic goods), but he wishes to increase business and expand his shop. Therefore, he thinks he is going to use his loan to increase his stock by buying more basic products (oil, rice, sugar, soap, and other foodstuffs) so he can respond to the needs and demands of his customers.

Telolahy Francois thinks about his future and he hopes to be able to build a house so that he can be more independent. He then can have his own household with his partner and they can start a family.

loans.use: to buy basic goods, like oil, soap, and rice

loans.name: Bessie Arminda

texts.es: Bessie de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos y a la venta de minutas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de  su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos e insumos para elaborar minutas como: hielo, jaleas de sabores, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Bessie is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She works selling products by catalog and crushed ice cones. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products and supplies to make her ice cones like: ice, flavored syrups, etc all at wholesale prices and thus she can generate greater profits.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavored syrups, etc, wholesale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 25 years old. He is married with two children aged between two and five years. One of them goes to school. Daniel sells sheets, and he has been in business for the past seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy more bed sheets to sell. He will use the profits from the business to save money and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, también se dedica a la agricultura, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para elaborar el pan como harina, molde, jaleas de sabores, etc. todo por mayor y así continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is fifty-three years old. She lives in her own house with her family. She runs a bakery out of her home, and she also makes a living in agriculture. With the income she makes from her sales, she is able to cover some of the home expenses. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase necessary supplies to make bread for her bakery, like flour, baking tins, differed flavored jellies, etc. She will buy everything wholesale. This will allow her to continue her work so that she can earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking tins, flavored jellies, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis un hombre de 60 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivado y emocionado ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la Corporación Interactuar puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, un sueño que le ha sido errado pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia no le desembolsaban el préstamo. 

Con el crédito solicitado comprara un carro de comidas como el que se puede ver en la foto. 

Este crédito será de suma importancia para Luis pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente y una oportunidad de progresar como empresario.
texts.en:
Luis is a 60 year old man who is very motivated and excited about the opportunity that has presented itself in his life. Thanks to Interactuar, he can request a loan in order to start his own business selling fast foods. He has been following this dream but, because it is his first experience with credit, no one would give him a loan.

With the loan that he is requesting, he will purchase a food cart like the one that you see in the photograph. This loan will be very important to Luis because it represents the beginning of an independent life and an opportunity to progress as a businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart like the one you see in the photograph.

loans.name: Haingo Lalao

texts.fr:
Haingo Lalao est une femme de 48 ans. Elle habite avec sa fille dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe. Son mari vit à la capitale avec son fils pour raison professionnelle, il travaille dans une boucherie. La famille arrive à se retrouver une fois par mois pour partager des moments tous ensemble. Haingo a une petite boutique devant son domicile. Elle vend de la confection et des articles de beauté (vêtements, chaussures, soins pour les cheveux, maquillage). 

Cela fait 2 ans qu’elle est partenaire chez Vahatra. Les différents prêts successifs qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis de diversifier ses produits et donc de proposer à ses clients un plus large choix d’articles. Avec ce prêt, elle compte continuer à acheter de nouveaux produits (robes, jupes, shampooings) et ainsi développer son activité. Avec une partie des bénéfices du prêt précédent,  elle a déjà réussi à acheter un vélo qui lui permet notamment d’effectuer les démarches avec ses fournisseurs plus facilement.

C’est pour garantir la sécurité matérielle et financière et s’assurer de l’avenir de ses enfants, que cette mère a accepté que la famille soit divisée et éloignée géographiquement. Elle espère ainsi mettre suffisamment d’argent de côté pour leur offrir la meilleure éducation possible.
texts.en:
Haingo Lalao is a woman of 48. She lives with her daughter in the urban area of Antsirabe. Her husband lives in the capital with their son for professional reasons; he works in a butcher shop. The family manage to get together once a month to spend some time reunited. Haingo has a little boutique in front of her house. She sells ready-made clothing and cosmetics (clothing, shoes, hair care products and make-up.) 

Haingo has been a partner of Vahatra for two years now. The successive loans she has obtained have permitted her to diversify her merchandise and thus offer her clientele a wider choice of items. With this loan she intends to continue buying new products (dresses, skirts, shampoo) and develop her business in that way. 

With part of the profit from the preceding loan, she succeeded in buying a bicycle, which permits her in particular to run errands to her suppliers more easily. This mother accepts to have her family divided and at a distance geographically, in order to guarantee their material and financial security and ensure the future of her children. She hopes that she can save enough money to be able to offer them the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dresses, skirts, and pullovers

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta  qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang, au centre, et qui porte un foulard blanc, est membre d’un groupe d’agriculteurs,tous membres de myAgro,vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sicoro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, elle-même âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants, dont l’un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. Fanta a été bercée dans le monde agricole depuis toute petite, et pratique cette activité depuis plus de 48 ans.  Fanta  cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle depuis 30 ans, pour sa valeur vivrière, l’arachide étant directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation ; de plus Fanta explique que les champs d'arachides se trouve à proximité du village, ce qui facilite ses déplacements. Fanta doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés comme le manque de matériels agricoles. Fanta  entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison des engrais de qualité fournis par myAgro, ce qui lui a permis d’augmenter son revenu l’année dernière. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d’engrais pour la culture d'arachide sur son exploitation de 0, 125 hectare. Fanta espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements et planifie d’assurer par la suite les futures frais de mariage de ses fils.
texts.en:
Fanta, who is seated in the middle of the front row with a white scarf, is part of a group of farmers who are members of myAgro and who live and work in Sicoro, south of Bamako in Mali. Fanta is 55 yard old, married, and has six children, of whom one goes to school. She was introduced to farming at a young age and has worked in this domain for more than 48 years. 

For the past 30 years, she has grown groundnuts on her piece of land, because it is a food that can be eaten directly by the family or it can be used as a sauce base in other meals. Moreover, Fanta explains that groundnut fields are found close to the village, which facilitates the harvest.

As a farmer, Fanta must face difficulties, such as the lack of agricultural materials. Fanta has been with myAgro for two years and joined again because of the quality fertilizer they provided. This allowed her to increase her earnings last year. 

This year, Fanta makes payments to buy myAgro fertilizer to grow groundnuts on her .125 hectares of land.

Fanta hopes to be able to increase her yields, which will help her to ensure the future marriage costs of her sons.

loans.use: to buy myAgro fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Candelaria Elizabeth

texts.es: Candelaria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicada en el merado municipal y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa interior para damas y asi tener mejores ingresos para tener una meor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Candelaria is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her mother.  She works selling underwear and has been in this business for several years.  Her business is located in the main city market and she has established customers.  With what she obtains from her sales she is able to manage household expenses.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy more bras and underwear for women and thus obtain better income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase intimate apparel for women

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, donde vende una variedad de productos como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc.  tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has had a small store located in her home for several years. Here, she sells a variety of products like snacks, sodas, staple grains, coffee, soaps, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc. 

She has many customers due to her great prices. She requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise in bulk since this is her only source of income. This way, she will be able to earn more money and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sodas, staple grains, coffee, soaps, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Crisusto

texts.es:
Crisusto es un hombre de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 12 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 8 y 6 años, y trabaja como agricultor.
Él es buen padre, comprensivo, paciente, fuerte, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘Chapare’ una localidad campesina turística donde existen hoteles con piscina, hostales, alojamientos y residenciales con vista a los ríos, para disfrutar de los parques ecológicos como El Parque Machia, el Puerto San Francisco, el Parque Nacional Carrasco, el Parque Ecoturístico La Jungla y otras atracciones naturales que son parte exuberante del
Crisusto es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben desplazarse con baldes hasta llegar al rio que queda a 10 minutos de distancia caminando. Su actividad es la producción de banana de exportación, que se produce durante casi todo el año, actividad que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, cuidando la cosecha y cortando la maleza constantemente porque arruina el sembradío, las ventas las realiza por mayor y por cosecha a clientes fijos que le pagan por adelantado. “me traslade a vivir a este lugar para trabajar la tierra porque me comentaron que se vendía toda la cosecha…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que la venta se realiza por cosecha entera, la desventaja es que la mayoría de los hogares no cuenta con servicios básicos. Su sueño es acceder a agua potable desde su hogar, él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia goce de buena salud. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Crisusto solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
Crisusto is a 44 year old man who lives with his wife. They have a 12 year old boy and two daughters ages 8 and 6.  He works as a farmer.  He is a good father, understanding, patient, strong, optimistic, responsible and hard-working.  His work is done in the rural tourist village of Chapare.  In the town one can find hotels with pools, hostels, inns and residences with views of the river. People come to enjoy the ecological parks in the area such as Machia Park, the Port of San Francisco, Carrasco National Park, and the Ecotourist Park The Jungle.  

Crisusto has brown skin, brown eyes, black short hair, is short, and has a thin figure.  He mother tongue is Quechua and he speaks it at home and also speaks Spanish in the community and for work.  He does his work along with his wife, and his children study in school.  They live in their own home made out of wood with an aluminum roof.  The home has power, but not water.  To get water they have to take buckets to the river which is 10 minutes away on foot.  He works growing bananas for export, and they are grown year round.  He works every day of the week, caring for his crop and cutting the weeds constantly because they ruin the crop.  He sells in bulk to fixed clients who pay him in advance.  He notes: "I moved to live in this place in order to work the land because they told me that you could sell your whole harvest."  The advantage of his work is that he can sell his entire crop, but the disadvantage is that the majority of the homes do not have basic services like running water.  His dream is to bring running water to his home. He would like to bring running water to his kitchen, bath, and laundry room so that his family can have better health.  This is his first loan with Kiva's field partner and he has been working in agriculture for 10 years.  

For this reason Crisusto is asking for a loan in order to make a running water connection for his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that his family can improve their health.

loans.use: to bring running water connections to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that his family can improve their health.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como: perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, cremas, etc. y tambien ropa su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  She works selling products for personal use such as perfumes, lotions, deodorants, cremes, as well as clothing.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers due to the variety of products that she sells.  With what she earns from her business she is able to pay for household living expenses.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more products in bulk in order to continue with her work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more products in bulk such as perfumes, deodorants, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 48 years old, married and has two children, ages 2 and 21 and both in school. She owns a mini market and has been in business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cakes, milk and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her family's welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more cakes, milk and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en: Asasio is a 48-year-old hardworking man who lives in Kasese Uganda. He is married with eight children, four of whom attend school. He sells brews and soft drinks in order to earn a living. He has been in that business for 10 years. Additionally he practices commercial farming to increase his income. He has a dream of expanding his business into wholesale. Asasio is faced with the challenge of market competition. He is requesting a loan to buy spirits, beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Wilberforce
