texts.en: Wilberforce used the previous loan to buy equipment to start another salon. He is in the beauty salon business, the business he started with the hope of earning an income. He is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinder the progress of his business. However, he hopes to expand his business to new areas in order to fetch more income. Wilberforce has asked for a loan to help him buy mirrors, chairs, a charging system and solar panels for his salon.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, chairs, a charging system and solar panels for his salon.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra is a 34-year-old nurse doing midwifery and earning a salary. She is a married woman with three children who all go to school in Kasese, Uganda. She has a dream of building a residential house for her family and improving the livelihood of her children. Barbra is faced with the challenge of long distance between home and her work place so sometimes she has to incur high transport costs. She wants money to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand and pay for labor for her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand and pay for labor for her residential house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a poultry house

loans.name: Angelica De Jesus

texts.es:
Angelica, una campesina muy amorosa y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos solamente, trabaja con la leche de las vacas; es tanta la admiración y respeto por los animales que prefiere que mueran por vejez antes de tener que sacrificarles para conseguir una rentabilidad por su carne. 

Es madre de 4 hijos, trabaja con ellos enseñándoles la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 

Pensando en su vivienda y en sus hijos la señora Angélica quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera por lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el total del dinero para la compra de la vaca. 

Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de ella y sus hijos. 

Sueña con tener una finca con mucho ganado rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica, a very loving farmer with a great passion for nature, works with animals, but she does not just butcher and sell them.  She works with dairy cattle. Because of the respect and admiration that she has for the animals, she prefers that they die of old age than from being slaughtered for their meat. 

She is the mother of 4 children and she works with them to teach them passion for the countryside, to love nature, and to love animals. With her home and children in mind, Angelica would like to expand her business, so she has saved some money in order to buy a dairy cow, but she needs a loan in order to have the full balance of money to purchase the cow.

This cow will give her more milk production, guaranteeing an stable financial life for her and her children. She dreams of having a farm with many cattle surrounding her and helping to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre de 4 hijos pero solo uno vive con ella y los demás con su papá. 

Dinora se dedica a vender ropa, anteriormente vendía en los buses productos como agua, jugos sodas, fue así como adquirió experiencia, además le ayuda a su madre a vender pescado seco, el lugar donde ella sale a vender la ropa  está a 3 km de su casa y se va a pie.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar blusas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, ropa para niños y otros para continuar con su negocio.
 

Ella espera contar con otra persona que le ayude a vender y algún día tener un local fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora is 32 years old and studied through the sixth grade.  She has four children but only one still lives with her.  The rest live with their father. 

Dinora works selling clothing.  She used to work selling water, juices and sodas on local buses, and that is how she gained experience.  In addition, her mother helps her sell dried fish.  The place where she goes to make sales is about 3 kilometers from her house and she goes on foot. 

She needs a loan in order to purchase blouses, underwear for women and men, and clothing for children in order to continue her business. 

She is hoping to find another person to help her with sales and some day to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, underwear for women and men, and clothing for children in order to continue her business.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo, un hombre de 45 años, vive en el municipio de Medellín, una ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este individuo de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de comprar un negocio de distribuidora de insumos para comidas rápidas para el cual trabaja como empleado.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Gustavo podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra del negocio.

Colabora a un hombre emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Gustavo, a 45 year old man, lives in Medellin, a city where there are few opportunities to get ahead and commercial competition is strong. He is business-minded and has great desires to get ahead. He would like to purchase a business that distributes supplies for fast food restaurants. He is already an employee of this business.

With the assistance of a loan, Gustavo will be able to achieve his dream of being independent and he will be able to generate his own income, which he will use to pay for household expenses. He will invest the money in the purchase of the business.

Collaborate with this entrepreneurial, creative-minded man with big dreams!

loans.use: to purchase a distribution business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old. She is married and lives in Telavi district with her husband and mother-in-law.

Irma has beehives with bee colonies and produces honey to sell as well as for family use. She is a lecturer at a local university. The family owns agricultural land where they grow vegetables.

This time Irma wants to grow watermelon and needs money for seeds. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase watermelon seeds and will grow them. She will sell the harvested watermelon locally at a good price.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 9 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira junto con su esposa e hijos. El siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura y a la comercialización de granos básicos. Lleva aproximadamente 26 años de cultivar café y esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona en grano en oro. Esta solicitando el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 10,000 y lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para darle asistencia a su finca de café. Con esta inversión espera tener mejor cultivo y lograr mayor producción de café. Su plan es mantener esta actividad para poder ayudar a sus hijos menores con sus proyectos y arreglar su casa.
texts.en: Francisco is 60 years old, is married, and has 9 children.  He lives in the village of the town of Gracias Lempira together with his wife and children.  He has always worked in agriculture and growing basic grains.  He has approximately 26 years of experience growing and selling coffee in the local market. He is asking for a third loan in order to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and feed to help with his coffee crop.  With this investment he hopes to improve his crop and to increase his coffee production.  His plan is to maintain this activity in order to help his younger children with their products and in order to improve their home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed to help with his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 31 years old, married and has four children, ages 2 to 10, with three in school. He owns a retail shop and has been in business for the past six years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan, he would like to buy items, such as biscuits and salt, to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, he aims to earn at least 400,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more items, such as biscuits and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en: Fortunee is 31 years old. She is married with three children aged between four and nine years old. They all go to school. She owns a mini market and she has been doing business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bread, juice and milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more bread, juice and milk to sell.

loans.name: Consolation

texts.en: Consolation is 32 years old, married and has three children, ages 1 to 18 years. She offers a mobile money service and has been in business for the past three years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to expand her mobile money business. The profits from the business will used to buy a piece of land. In the future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month

loans.use: To expand her mobile money business.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 36 years old, married and has three children, ages 8 to 15 years. All go to school. She owns a restaurant and has been in business for eight years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt and other items for her business. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 400,000 RWF per month

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt and other items for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis has eight children attending school, is married and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He trades in cocoa garden harvests, mainly hiring and selling the harvests and earns additional income in the form of commission as a middle man. He started the business 29 years ago and is now challenged by increasing transport costs and limited capital. He hopes to have more cocoa gardens in the future to harvest big and achieve big profits. Francis has requested a loan to acquire more cocoa gardens for hiring and harvesting to sell.

loans.use: to acquire more cocoa gardens for hiring and harvesting to sell.

loans.name: Tiyumtaba - Kakpagyli Group

texts.en:
Zenabu is a 50-year-old businesswoman from Kakpagyili in the Northern region of Ghana. Zenabu is married and has six children. Zenabu is the individual pictured fourth from the right among members sitting.
	
Zenabu is a member of a rice processing group that has been in business for 15 years. The name of the group is ‘Tiyumtaba - Kakpagyli’. Zenabu earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on more improved ways of processing par-boiled rice in their rice processing business so they can always produce premium quality for the Ghanaian market.

Zenabu and ‘Tiyumtaba - Kakpagyli’ have asked for a loan of GHS 9,500. Her share of the loan is GHS 500 which would help her to buy paddy rice for processing. With this loan, Zenabu would earn more income enabling her to repay the loan and support her children with school fees and educational materials and their health care.

Zenabu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice for processing.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo el cual le ayuda para solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y cal para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria, 46 years old, lives in her own home with her mother. She makes a living from the production and sale of tortillas in her residence. For 15 years she has made a living from this work, which helps her to pay some home expenses. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase corn and lime to be able to continue with her work and so make a better income.

loans.use: to purchase corn and lime.

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 29 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de coles, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y su hija.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de José Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Jose is a humble and hard-working farmer who is 29 years old, who as a child learned all about farm work, thanks to his father’s teachings.

Currently, he has cabbage crops, whose harvests are gathered and sold in the market in the village where he resides. This generates sufficient resources to bring home the daily bread and to pay for his wife and daughter’s basic necessities.

He motivated himself to request the loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of agricultural supplies wholesale (compost, pesticide, and fertilizer). This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and improving the productivity of the next crop, which will benefit the income that he receives for each sale.

Jose expresses that his greatest desire is to continue struggling to create economic stability and to provide better living conditions and well-being to his family.

Jose’s crop will be able to be maintained and he will come out ahead with your help!

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies wholesale (compost, pesticide, and fertilizer).

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, ella no siguió sus estudios por dedicarse a trabajar, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian y el otro por el momento no.

Blanca tiene una tienda en la cual vende productos de la canasta básica, vende antojitos, enchiladas, pasteles y hace pan, ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace muchos años años y lo aprendió de su madre, continuó haciéndolo porque es un negocio rentable con el cual ella obtiene buenas ganancias y lleva el sustento diario a su familia.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más productos como arroz, azúcar, café, leche, consomés, etc. para su tienda.

Ella sueña con tener los recursos necesarios para el estudio de sus hijos, también sueña con tener una tienda fuerte y seguir vendiendo antojitos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old.  She studied until the seventh grade, but did not continue her studies in order to devote herself to work.  She is in a relationship and her partner is a farmer.  She has three children, two are in school, the third for the moment is not.

Blanca has a store in which she sells staple goods.  She sells snacks, enchiladas, pastries, and makes bread.  She has devoted herself to this business for many years and she learned it from her mother.  She continued to do so because it is a profitable business in which she obtains good profits and provides daily sustenance for her family.  

She needs this loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, coffee, milk, soup, etc. for her store.  

She dreams of having the necessary resources for the schooling of her children.  She also dreams of having a strong store and to continue selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, sugar, coffee, milk, soup, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en: Marie Claire is the group leader, aged 28. She is married with four children aged between two and ten years old, three of whom go to school. The group is called Duterimbere, which means “Vision” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change for a better future. She sells food stuffs and has been doing business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Kulinoli Din Viela - Tampion Group

texts.en:
Fati is a 45-year-old business woman from Tampion in the Northern region of Ghana. Fati is married and has four children. She is the individual pictured raising her hand among the members squatting.

Fati is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for many years. The name of the group is ‘Kulinoli Din Viela - Tampion’. Fati earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on more improved ways of extracting shea butter in the shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the Ghanaian market and for export markets.

Fati and ‘Kulinoli Din Viela - Tampion’ have asked for a loan of GHS 9,300. Her share of the loan is GHS 300 which will help her to buy shea nuts for processing. With this loan, Fati would earn more income so as to repay this loan and support her children with school fees and educational materials.

Fati thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing

loans.name: Wilson Dario

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona soñadora, trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación de zapatos, un negocio que aprendió empíricamente y adopto por necesidad económica ya que no lograba emplearse, pero con su negocio encontró prosperidad, poco a poco progresa, genera los recursos para atender las necesidades de su familia que la conforma su pareja y sus dos hijos.
Su idea para este año es poder diversificar su oferta lo cual no ha podido lograr al no encontrar clientes que estén dispuestos a comprar su producto, es por ello que se capacito, miro ejemplos de calzado de otras partes y ahora trata de asemejarlos y adecuar la moda colombiana a lo que vio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para fabricar calzado, y aspira a tener buenos contratos para iniciar un proyecto para su familia que es comprar una vivienda, la ira pagando por cuotas, pero es mejor pagar la casa que estar pagando arriendo.
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working dreamer. He makes a living from the production of shoes, a business that he learned empirically and he adopted because of economic necessity since he was not able to find work. However, with this business he found prosperity. Little by little it progresses. It generates the resources necessary to attend to the necessities of his family, which is made up of his spouse and two children.

His idea for this year is to be able to diversify his supply, which he has not been able to do due to not finding customers who are disposed to purchasing his product. It is because of this that he taught himself. He looked at examples of footwear from other places and now tries to simulate them and adapt the Colombian fashion to what he saw.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials to produce footwear, and he aspires to having good contracts to initiate a project for his family, which is to purchase a home. He will purchase it in installments, but it is better to pay for a house than to pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase materials for footwear production.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es una agricultora muy habilidosa con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de plátano que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos por los cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlos adelante.

Ella desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de plátano, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarle a sus hijos un buen futuro!
texts.en:
Gloria is a very able farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture. She has an innate talent for working in teams and a great entrepreneurial mind.

She has a plantain crop, which she tends to every day, from the very early hours of the morning. She currently lives with her husband and 4 children, for whom she has always strived to get them ahead.

She wishes to give her crop a boost and earn a better income from it, which is why she is requesting financial help to invest in agricultural inputs such as pesticides, compost, and plantain seeds. The loan will give her the opportunity to have a better quality product.

Her greatest dream is to have her own home and to provide her children with a good future!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides, compost, and plantain seeds.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Santiago es un joven que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales como jornalero.

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.
 El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Agricultural work is one of the most difficult jobs nowadays because of how much effort one must make in order to progress, but Santiago is a young man who has never given up despite the weather or the circumstances that may happen. He is always prepared to obtain income for his family.

Santiago gets up first thing in the morning to travel to different farms in order to fulfill his job duties as a day laborer. He alternates his time with selling milk that he obtains from his own cows.

Santiago wants to increase his working capital in order to support his businesses. The reason he is requesting this loan is so he can invest in the purchase of a dairy cow which will give a good boost to his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, se dedica a vender carne, hueso y otros derivados de res desde hace más de 25 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo con un horario de nueve de la mañana a dos de la tarde, aprendió a desarrollar esta actividad desde que tenía 20 años de edad con la ayuda de sus padres, Teresa vive con dos hijos y tiene dos más que ya son independientes.
Comprará reses para el destazo, le será de utilidad para mantenerse trabajando y cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes, espera que sus clientes continúen prefiriendo sus productos para generar los ingresos que necesita e ir subsistiendo con su familia.
Los objetivos que Teresa tiene con el crédito son obtener mejores utilidades y no tener problemas para cancelarlo.
texts.en:
Teresa has made her living selling meat, bones, and other cattle derivatives for more than 25 years. She works from Monday to Sunday, from nine in the morning to two in the afternoon. She learned this business when she was 20 years old, with the help of her parents. Teresa lives with two children and has two more who are already independent.

She will buy cattle for butchering, which will be useful for her to continue working and meeting her customers' demand. She hopes that her customers continue to prefer her products, so that she can earn the income she needs to continue supporting her family.

Teresa's goals with the loan are to increase her profits and to pay it back without problems.

loans.use: to buy cattle for butchering, which will be useful for her to continue working and meeting her customers' demands.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amparo desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando una vaca lechera que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es madre responsable y amorosa con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposo quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Amparo has spent her time on activities in the field such as agriculture and animal husbandry, activities that her father taught her so that she could get ahead in life.

Today, her primary activity is agriculture and ranching. Her goal is to increase her capital by buying a dairy cow that will allow her to stock up and generate better earnings. That is why she is applying for a loan.

She is a responsible and loving mother with her children. She lives on a farm with them and her husband, who has been her greatest company.

She dreams of being able to give her children a quality education so that in the future, they can fend for themselves and be independent.

Everyday she tends to her business and makes sure to do things very well. She knows that with the help of the Corporación Interactuar, she will be able to go far.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Winnie

texts.en:
At only 20 years of age, Winnie is busy juggling her business and her three-year-old daughter.

Winnie is a carpenter. She makes household furniture on order. Being a young girl in a male dominated industry means that Winnie has to work extra hard and create more unique pieces in order to succeed.

She is asking for a loan to buy new equipment as well as replace some old ones. These include planes, a coping saw, and planks. She says with new equipment she will increase productivity as well as improve the quality of her pieces.

Winnie hopes to one day create employment by owning a workshop that manufactures and supplies furniture across the entire nation.

loans.use: to buy a coping saw, smoothing plane, planks, and furniture trimming braid.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica, de 19 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida al lado de su familia.

Ella se desempeña como confeccionista de distintas prendas en contratación con terceros tales como camisetas y ropa interior.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para el apoyo con los gastos en su hogar.

Es una joven emprendedora y muy disciplinada, siempre en busca de oportunidades para progresar y mejorar como empresaria.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar una maquina recubridora que le permita mejorar su nivel de producción y poder aumentar sus ventas.

De esta forma podría solventar todos sus gastos y podría tener esa vida plena que tanto ha soñado.
texts.en:
Yesica is 19 years old and is very clear about what she wants in life.  She decided to finish her studies to move forward and have a good life together with her family.

She works as a seamstress making different clothing items, like t-shirts and underwear, on contract from third parties.  She started doing this work because she wanted the necessary resources to meet her household expenses.  She is an enterprising and disciplined young person who is always in search of opportunities to move forward and improve her business.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase a coverstitch machine, which will allow her to improve her level of production and be able to increase her sales.  This will allow her to meet all of her expenses and have the full life that she has dreamed of.

loans.use: to purchase a coverstitch machine to improve her level of production.

loans.name: Datien

texts.en:
Datien is 45 years old. He is married with 2 children who are 1 and 8 years old. One of them goes to school. 

He owns a bar and he has been in business for the past 12 years, while his wife is a business woman. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. 

In future, he aims to earn at least 500,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 25 years old. She is married with one child who is 3 years old. 

She sells local drinks from sorghum and she has been in business for the past 2 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

In future, she wishes to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es:
Marta, con 42 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, ofrece cosméticos, accesorios, ropa, perfumes, entre otros y con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante los tres años que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, dedicada y comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, shampoo, tratamientos capilares) para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. 

De esta manera, Marta podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeños hijos, brindándoles una estabilidad económica favorable para darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Marta, 42, is the mother of 2 children. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. Marta currently sells merchandise and products by catalog. She sells cosmetics, accessories, clothes, and perfume, among other things. She has managed to generate income and contribute to her household during the past 3 years that she has carried out this activity.

Marta is a woman who is enterprising, who has a vision, and who is dedicated and committed to her family and her job. She is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to improve. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale merchandise (perfume, body lotion, cosmetics, shampoo, hair treatments) to take advantage of the discounts they have and to offer more variety to meet the tastes and needs of her customers and thus have a better profit margin from sales. Thus, Marta will move forward toward fulfilling her primary goal which is to expand her business and improve the quality of life of her two small children, providing favorable economic stability in order to give them the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (perfume, body lotion, cosmetics, shampoo, hair treatments).

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has two children. She has her own business.

Galina sells women's outerwear. She brings good quality clothes from Turkey and Poland. Galina is an intelligent and hardworking person. She has regular customers. Galina is able to maintain her business on the same level in spite of the crisis in Ukraine.

Galina is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to purchase women's clothes for the spring season. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of outerwear and serve more clients.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes for the spring season

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru: Сановбар 22 летняя молодая жительница района Шахритус. Она вышла замуж, но ее муж уехал на заработки в Российской Федерации. Он должен прокормить своих родителей и жену. Сановбар на данный момент находится в положении. Она старается не выполнять тяжелую работу и оберечь своего будущего ребенка. Сановбар хочет найти еще один источник дохода для семьи на случаи, если его мужа ожидает не удача на его работе, и он будет вынужден вернуться. Она выбрала животноводческую деятельность. Так как она беременная, в работе на скотном дворе ей помогают родители мужа. Сановбар надеется увеличить поголовья скотин, чтобы увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности, потому что перевод денег от мужа сократились. На куплю несколько голов скотин ей не хватает денег и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Sanovbar is a 22-year-old young resident of the Shahrituz district. She got married, but her husband went to work in the Russian Federation. He has to support his parents and wife. Sanovbar is currently pregnant. She tries not to do difficult work and protect her future child. Sanovbar wants to find another source of income for the family in case her husband has issues with his work and has to return home. She chose animal husbandry. Because she is pregnant, her parents-in-law help her with the work at the livestock yard. Sanovbar hopes to increase her livestock headcount in order to increase the income from the animal husbandry business because the money wires from her husband have decreased. She does not have enough money to buy several heads of livestock, and she requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and income

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 26 years old. 

She sells foodstuffs and she has been in business for the past 1 year. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava and Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

In future, she wishes to earn at least 400,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 43 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование-среднее. С 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одного теленка. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 9 коров, 20 овец. На 2,25 Га она выращивает люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Baktygul is 43 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture - animal husbandry and farming since 1994, when she started this business with a purchase of one calf. Her current monthly income amounts up to 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baktygul's hard work, today she has a good farm, containing 9 cows and 20 sheep. She grows alfalfa for the farm consumption on 2.25 hectares of land. To continue developing her business, Baktygul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and also making repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 50-year old married mother of three children. One of her children is working and the others are still attending school. She has been working from home for 15 years, selling homemade food, in order to help her family to meet the needs of life and live in a good way.

Today, Mariam is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business inventory so that she can offer the best product to her customers and therefore increase her income. She is very happy and optimistic that she will sell all of her products and expand her business area. She hopes that, in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her business inventory so that she can offer the best product to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: William Humberto

texts.es:
William es un fabricador de 35 años de edad, trabaja con una persona vive solo y no tiene hijos, su actividad económica es la fabricación de uniformes de dotación, es un proceso muy manual y por ende de mucha calidad, pues estos uniformes están sometidos un entorno donde una ropa normal se dañaría con facilidad.
Dicho negocio lo  empezó a realizar gracias a un vecino pero es independiente desde el año 2007 y hoy 2015 sigue en pie y motivado con mejorar, con buscar más contratos, contratar personal, comprar vivienda, viajar, tiene múltiples proyectos que hacen que se le dibuje una sonrisa en el rostro de solo imaginárselo.
William quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de tela, como se puede ver en la foto esta es de un mayor grosor y es de muy buena calidad, por lo que su costo es un poco más alto.
texts.en: William is a 35 year old maker of clothes. He works with another person. He lives alone and does not have children. His work is sewing work uniforms. It is a manual process and therefore, of very high quality, because these uniforms are subject to an environment that can damage normal clothes very easily. He started such business thanks to a neighbor, but he has been independent since 2007. Now, in 2015, he keeps on working and is motivated to improve, find more contracts, hire personnel, buy a house, travel. He has multiple projects that bring a smile to his face just by imagining them. William wants to request a loan to buy fabric. As one can see on the picture, this fabric is thicker and of very good quality, and this is why it is more expensive.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make work uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 12 young pigs and materials to build and start his pig farm

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia earns a living through retailing various seafood such as shells and seaweed. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Olivia recently applied for a loan to purchase additional sticks and "amakan" (bamboo mats) for walling. She is now on her way to repairing her house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sticks and "amakan" for walling to repair her house

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky is single. He busies himself by selling health products and food supplements. He is able to support his parents with their daily needs and contribute to the education of his two siblings. Ricky has a dealership selling health products and food supplements and wants to expand his business to purchase more inventory to sell. He has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding and applied for a loan of PHP 5,000. He is happy to earn an income of PHP 2,000 per month. He hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional natural medicines

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo wants to fulfill his dreams by completing a college degree. He religiously pays attention to making good grades every semester. For another school year, Romeo lacks funds to pay for his school fees. Romeo has big dreams to help his family and his siblings as well,. That's the reason why he works hard for his education.

loans.use: to pay school fees and tuition

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is a hard-working and diligent mother. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren.  Dominga is engaged in a snack vending business selling rice cakes. Her business is doing well and she doubles her time perfecting her own rice cake recipe.  Dominga has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family.  Dominga has taken out another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes to serve more customers and be able to accept orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales to continuously benefit her family, especially her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry has developed a talent for cooking. She has her own unique recipe and she is known for her quality cooking and her variety of recipes to serve the demand of her clients. This has kept her business going for more than five years now. Income from her restaurant supports the studies of her one graduating son. Recently, Cherry requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant. Cherry hopes to expand her business by displaying in more recipe for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Santos Erodita

texts.es:
Santos de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como seguridad, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 ya se acompañó, otro es maestro y la menor se encuentra estudiando.

Santos se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también siembra una pequeña parcela de maíz, además sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura ya que sus padres eran jornaleros, su esposo le ayuda en el trabajo y lo hacen de 7:00 am a 12:00 md.
  
El crédito lo necesita para comprar madera y tejas para terminar de reparar el techo de su casa, así vera su casa más bonita y en mejores condiciones para vivir ella y su familia. 

Su sueño es que su hija termine de estudiar y verla un día graduarse como maestra.
texts.en: Santos is 57 years old. She studied up to sixth grade. She has a domestic partner who works as a security guard. She has 3 children: one of them has a spouse already, the other one is a teacher and the youngest daughter is studying. Santos works in domestic chores, but she also grows a small parcel of corn. Also, her children help her financially. She has 10 years working in agriculture, because her parents were daily laborers. Her husband helps her with work and they work from 7:00 am to 12:00 noon. She needs the loan to buy wood and tiles to finish repairing the roof of her house. This way, her house will be prettier and in better conditions for her and her family to live in. Her dream is that her daughter finishes her studies and to see her graduate as a teacher one day.

loans.use: to buy wood and tiles to finish repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old. She is married with six children who are between two and 12 years old. Five of them go to school. She sells clothes, and she has been in this business for the past 12 years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 26 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-среднее. Наргиза на протяжении 6 лет занимается торговлей сельскохозяйственной продукцией - зерновыми культурами, семенами, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Наргиза знает чего хочет и старается добиваться всего своими силами. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности на сегодняшний день в обороте есть товар на сумму 50,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Наргиза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продукции для увеличения товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Наргиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nargiza is 26 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. Nargiza has been involved in sales of agricultural products, such as cereal crops and seeds, for 6 years, having started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Nargiza knows what she wants and tries to achieve everything with her own efforts. Thanks to careful work and responsibility, today she has a goods turnover of 50,000 som (KGS). Her family's monthly profit amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Nargiza requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy products in order to increase her goods turnover. Nargiza plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural crops and seeds in order to increase her goods turnover

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 52 years old. He is married with three children aged between 23 and 33 years; two of them go to school.

He sells cattle skins and has been in business for the past 16 years, while his wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan, he would like to buy more cattle skins to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle skins to sell.

loans.name: Wisdom Quarry Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person standing on the left-hand side of the photo is Magdaline. She is a member of Wisdom Quarry Self Help Group. Magdaline is married and she and her husband are blessed with four children.

Her economic activity is potatoes and vegetable farming. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer that will help boost her farming. She hopes this will increase and improve crop yield and thus result in a bountiful harvest. This will lead to more income to meet her family's needs such as school fees and food.
Magdaline is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will boost farming.

loans.name: Marjorrie

texts.en:
Mother of three, Marjorrie owns and operates Xtreme iLash Studio (http://www.ilash-studio.com/) in Chula Vista, located just south of San Diego.  Her business consists of lash artists trained by Xtreme Lashes®, a global leader in eyelash extensions. 

Xtreme Lashes® sells products only to licensed professionals of the beauty or medical industry; they carry only top-of-the-line faux mink eyelash extensions, and manufacture hypoallergenic medical-grade adhesives in the USA at an FDA-registered facility. 

Majorrie’s goal is not only to provide a unique, customized look for each client, but also to ensure care to the natural lashes in order to obtain longer, thicker, fuller lashes indefinitely.

Military wife Marjorrie has a consistent clientele and excellent reviews on Yelp.com.  She is very professional and clients may easily book appointments online. For being less than one year in business in a rented space, Marjorrie is doing very well and is becoming known in the industry locally.

Marjorrie will use her Kiva loan to improve her location, purchase additional treatment beds, and attend a training for a new treatment she would like to offer called Volulash. 

Marjorrie has a passion for making people feel beautiful and she thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to improve her location, purchase additional treatment beds, and attend training for a new treatment

loans.name: Las Rosas De Pabeya Group

texts.en:
“Las Rosas de Pabeya” or “The Roses of Pabeya” is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located Nahualá, Guatemala. Nearly the entire population of the municipality is made up of ethnic K'iche' Maya who speak the K'iche' language. The population of the township is estimated to be between 50,000-85,000 with approximately 10% living in the actual town. 

The ladies of this group have successfully completed a loan cycle, funded by KIVA investors, and were able to sustain or expand their small businesses. They are requesting another loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors. For this upcoming loan cycle, three of the members are new to the group and quite excited about injecting new capital into their businesses and generating additional income.

Pascuala is the Secretary of the Trust Bank and is a prime example of the positive impact of the Friendship Bridge's “Microcredit Plus Program”. She is a young 22-year-old woman who only had limited elementary school education because of the lack of resources in her family. Along with her nine siblings, Pascuala had a limited vision of her future, dreams and goals. 

Pascuala's business is traditional textile production and she sells the unique and beautiful heavy blouses called “huipiles” and belts called “fajas” that are often filled with intricately woven designs and embroidery. With her loan, she now has a local stand where all her textile treasures are displayed for potential customers. Pascuala will use this new loan to buy various kind of thread and produce more textiles. She sells three days each week and she is expanding her business. She would like to offer a larger variety of “huipiles” and “fajas” and expand her own custom designs.

Pascuala is a successful businesswoman, not only because of the loan, but also because she has acquired new knowledge about practical topics such as effective business practices. including budgeting, pricing, marketing, accounting and customer service. She shares knowledge about health, hygiene, women’s rights and violence against women with her family. She also learns about empowerment, self-esteem and realizing goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy thread to produce textiles

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI,la socia sigue  dedicándose a su negocio de salón de belleza, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue elaborando diferentes tipos de peinados,cortes,tintes entre otros, la socia desea seguir trabajando para así continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de tientes, secadoras, peines entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the community bank Yahuar Maqui. She is continuing to run her beauty salon business. She is grateful for the loan that she has been offered and promises to make the repayments on time. Gloria is doing well with her business and enjoying it thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She is still creating various hairstyles, cuts, dyes, and other things. She wants to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy dyes, driers, combs, etc.

loans.use: to buy dyes, driers, combs, etc.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI; él socio continua dedicándose a su negocio de artesanía como en la elaboración de chompas de alpaca, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua vendiendo su mercadería  a su clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de lanas de colores entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank Yahuar Maqui. He continues to run his craft business making alpaca sweaters. He is grateful for the loan that he has been offered and promises to make the repayments on time. He is continuing to sell his merchandise to his customers, who give him orders. He wants to keep working this way so that he can keep supporting his family.
He is requesting a loan to buy colored wool and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy colored wool and other supplies.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia has considerably prepared for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Aloran. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took out a loan.  Dionesia hopes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita, 60 years old, is married and has four children. She lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. Lita is been a farmer for 25 years, growing palay (unhusked rice) and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Lita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lita hopes to harvest more palay and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is now trying to cultivate her farm and plant fruit-bearing trees to earn an income from her backyard gardening. She presented her proposal for a loan of PHP 18,000 to Paglaum MPC to finance the project to buy fruit-bearing seedlings. Concepcion is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy fruit-bearing seedlings

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en: Olympia has a coconut farm in Rizalina, Rizal, Philippines, and it is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Olympia makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently borrowed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings. Olympia wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor to plow land and hole and plant seedlings

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogen is 51 years old. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 16 years. All of them go to school.

He holds metals, and he has been in business for the past eight years, while his wife is a businesswoman. He is with his wife in the picture.

With the loan, he would like to buy more metals to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy metals to sell.

In the future, he aims to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more metals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and to buy farm inputs, so as to improve her family's living standards through milk sales and improved farm production.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de cebolla el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de El Santuario.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Victor is a veteran with a lot of experience in the fields.
He is humble and straightforward, has a great way with people, and has the energy to grow any crop.
He has land where he grows onions and works every day to sell his crop in the market square in El Santuario.
Thanks to his years of experience and the instruction that his parents gave him since he was a child, he is well able to work and advise the other farmers in the area when they need help in their work.
He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides. This will give him business capital and significantly improve his harvests, which will help him to face his greatest challenge, the changeable climate, which affects his harvest. 
He has great faith in his business and high hopes for the caring people who support the farm workers of Colombia, as does the Corporacíon Interactuar.
Support a humble farmer to be successful in his fields with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 6m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is a small dairy farmer. She owns cows and sheep and cultivates pumpkins as well as a large variety of beans on her plot of land including kidney beans, fava beans and others. She decided to invest in her biodigester in order to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers she used to buy, which are unsustainable external inputs in her daily activities. Through the biodigester, she will be able to close the natural cycle on her farm, transforming her animals' manure into biogas and nutrient-rich fertilizer. This will in turn improve her productivity as her crops' yield will increase in a sustainable way, and reduce her operating costs. In addition, the manure will no longer contaminate underground water sources, and she will not rely on fossil fuels anymore. As the biogas will be directly connected to the cook stove, Fausta will eliminate wood for cooking from her kitchen, which was damaging her health as she was inhaling the toxic smoke on a daily basis. With her savings, she wants to invest in improving her current milking machine and build a better infrastructure for her livestock.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is an entrepreneur at heart. While he works nights at a local bakery, Juvenal has a booth at the Escondido Swap Meet, where he sells clothing every Sunday. He restarted his business last year after recovering from an injury he suffered while at work.  He was out of work and decided this was the perfect time to pursue his dream of owning a clothing business

Juvenal comes from a family of merchants. At a young age, he started helping his father with the business of selling women's clothing. His uncles did the same thing in Mexico.  He would like to grow his business and sell more men's clothing in addition to t-shirts. He mostly sells women's pants, blouses, sweaters, and leggings.  

Juvenal really enjoys being at the swap meet every Sunday, so that he can talk to his customers and sell his clothing. He likes interacting with people and providing merchandise to them. He wants to grow his business slowly.

He purchases his inventory from a wholesaler in Los Angeles and needs the Kiva loan to purchase inventory to sell at the swap meet.  Everything he makes gets reinvested in the business. He is excited to restart his business and hopefully he will become one of the most successful booths at the swap meet.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell at the swap meet.

loans.name: Mujeres De Xebaquit Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Xebaquit,” is made up of eleven women from a small rural community, Xebaquit, in the department El Quiche, in the western highlands of Guatemala. Over 90 percent of the population of Xebaquit suffers from poverty, with a high percentage of the population considered extremely poor. Due to the lack of economic opportunity in the region, many supplement their small subsistence farming by commuting to nearby cities to find business opportunities.

Francisca is a twenty-eight-year-old mother of four children, all under the age of ten. Every day of the week, both she and her husband commute to Totonicapan from their small community to sell cell phone accessories. Traveling to Totonicapan allows them to access cell phone accessory suppliers with wholesale prices, as well as a larger client base. For two years, Francisca has built her business, establishing her inventory and gaining knowledge about which products are most popular and have the highest rates of return.

Due to her hard work, her three children who are in school have had the opportunity to study and achieve a higher level of education than their mother. By reaching a higher level of education, her children have the chance to break the cycle of poverty.

As Francisca continues building business experience and capital, she looks forward to securing a more consistent and stable income. She hopes to achieve this possibility through the purchase of a small storefront, giving potential clients a regular place to find her.

Francisca is applying for a loan with Friendship Bridge to buy the necessary inventory to update her products and compete with the changing market. With this loan, Francisca hopes to continue building her experience and create a more profitable and sustainable business.

Beyond providing her children with the education they need to build a better future for themselves, Francisca hopes to improve her quality of life by renovating their small house. With the support of Kiva investors, Francisca will have the opportunity to continue developing her business in order to generate consistent and stable income that will give her children the chance to succeed.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for choosing to support Francisca and the hardworking women of her Trust Bank.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, por el impacto positivo que ha tenido en el uso de créditos, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo financiamiento que le será de utilidad para comprar telas, botones, hilos, blondas, perlas, etc., y de esa manera seguir trabajado y atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes.
Gracias al crédito anterior su negocio es más rentable, tienen nuevos clientes, ha disminuido sus deudas y tiene en mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana has experienced a positive impact from the use of her loans. She decided to request a new loan that will be used for purchasing fabrics, buttons, thread, lace, gems, and other materials so that she can continue working and providing good service to her customers.

Thanks to her previous loan, Ana’s business became more stable. She acquired new customers, lowered her debts, and enjoys a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, thread, lace, gems, and other materials.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 33 years old and lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is married with one infant-age child. Marivic has an "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy stock for her business. Marivic has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marivic hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anelio

texts.en:
Anelio is 54 years old. He is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and one child. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Anelio wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Trivenia

texts.en:
Trivenia, age 68, is happy tending her little store. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Trivenia keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Trivenia believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Trivenia has reached her fourth year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested", she said.  She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from that, she can afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia es sonriente, alegre, muy trabajadora, simpática persona que día a día trabaja 8 horas en su negocio de salsamentaría donde ofrece antojos, pasa bocas, jugos, frituras, snakcs y algunos abarrotes.
Ella no tiene hijos por lo que se quiere dedicar su tiempo de lleno a mejorar su negocio, agrandarlo, tener clientes nuevos, lograr ganar a la competencia, generar empleo, cumplir sus sueños uno de ellos que es comprar vivienda, razones suficientes para buscar una ayuda que encontró en la corporación Interactuar y quedo maravillada con lo que le contaron acerca del proyecto Kiva, donde personas de todo el mundo pueden leer su historia, y apoyarla para que su negocio crezca, sea más rentable y estable en el tiempo.
Ella quiere solicitar un apoyo para comprar surtido de refrescos, mecatos, dulces, frutas y el resto en abarrotes.
Ella de ante mano les agradece por leer un poco de ella.
texts.en:
Nidia is a smiley, happy, very hardworking, likable person who works 8 hours every day in her general store where she sells snacks, juices, fritters, and some groceries.
She does not have children, so she devotes her time to improving her business, growing it, gaining new customers, becoming competitive, generating employment, and achieving her dreams, one of which is to buy her own home. These are good reasons why she sought help from Corporacíon Interactuar and has been amazed by what she has been told about Kiva - that people from all around the world can read her story and help her so that her business grows and becomes more profitable and stable over time.
She wants to request support to stock-up on sodas, pastries, candy, fruits, and other groceries.
She thanks you in advance for having read a little about her.

loans.use: to buy potato chips, sodas, candy, and fruit to make tasty and exotic juices.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores, a sus 37 años de edad, es madre de tres pequeños hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo, Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora en una tienda de abarrotes, la misma que hoy en día es de su propiedad, pues el antiguo jefe le brindó la oportunidad de comprarla y pasar de ser empleada a propietaria de su unidad productiva. 

Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado rural.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor Como carne y legumbres, así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda. 

Dolores, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando la calidad de vida y ofrecer un mejor bienestar y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
37 year old Dolores is a mother with three little children who she is putting her efforts into raising. During her working life, she has been employed to work in a grocer store which today belongs to her. The old boss gave her the opportunity to buy the store and move from being an employee to being the proprietor of her own business. 
She works there on her own everyday, generating the income she needs to cover the basic household expenses. 
Her tenacity, vision, perseverance, and optimism have enabled her to overcome many obstacles that she has faced, especially the considerable competition in this business sector. However, she has handled the competition and has made the most of her business' advantages and has ample experience in the rural market.
She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as meat and vegetables wholesale so that her store is well-stocked and can meet the demands of her customers. 
With the dream of growing her business, Dolores wants to make sure that her store is well positioned for success and has the capital to grow and endure over time, improving her children's quality of life and offering them greater well being and a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat and vegetables  wholesale so that her business will be well-stocked.

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es:
Luz Mariela es una mujer de 60 años de edad, ella es separada y vive sola en su hogar el cual mantiene con la ayuda de su negocio de confección a terceros apoyada de una empleada al cual trata como a la hija que no pudo tener.
Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, y su pasión la lleva a trabajar 6 o 7 días a la semana de 10 a 12 horas dependiendo del volumen del trabajo.
Ella depende únicamente de su trabajo por eso lo cuida y valora cada pedido que le llega, por ello busca la manera de siempre tener surtido e implementos para cuando toquen su puerta ofreciéndole un trabajo ella pueda decir si lo tomo.
Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas e insumos, aspirando a que estos sean suficientes para generar una excelente satisfacción del cliente y solo le queda trabajar duro para seguir en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luz Mariela is a 60-year-old woman.  She is separated and lives on her own in her house which she maintains with the help of her business of sewing clothing for third parties.  She relies on an employee who she treats like the daughter that she couldn't have.

She began her work because she enjoys it and she is in a vocation that allows her to work independently.  Her passion has led her to work 6 or 7 days a week for 10 to 12 hours depending on the volume of work.

She depends solely on this work and thus she is careful with and values every order that she gets.  She is looking for a way to always have supplies and implements so that when there is someone at her door offering her work she can say, “Yes, I will take it.”

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and supplies, hoping that these will be sufficient to generate excellent satisfaction from her clients and that all that will be left for her then is to work hard so that she can continue in this market.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies for making her own line of clothing

loans.name: Mary Queen Of Peace Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a 39-year-old trader from Assin Fosu in the Central Region of Ghana. She is a member and representative of Mary Queen of Peace Group. She is married with three children with the ages of 16, 7, and 3 years old. All her children are in school.

Gladys trades in men’s and ladies’ clothing. She has good repayment records with her past eight microloan cycles with the field partner. Gladys wants to expand her business within the next three years so that she can have varieties of designer clothing to increase sales and cash flow to make more profit.

Gladys needs working capital support to enable her to take advantage of the discount of wholesale price. She will use the profit to expand the business. She plans to support her husband with part of her business profit to see their children through their education.

Gladys thanks all her microlenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio de 74 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,  se casó y es padre de 3 hijos los cuales ya son independientes pues están casados y viven aparte, por lo tanto  en su casa vive solo con su esposa.

Demetrio se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, después él se independizó y siguió dedicándose a lo mismo, la  parcela donde siembra sus cultivos está cerca de su casa y se le hace fácil transportarse al lugar.

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar mano de obra para realizar las actividades agrícolas.

Él espera seguir trabajando con esta institución y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
74-year old Demetrio didn’t have the chance to go to school. He got married and has three children, all of whom are adults. They are married and live independently, so Demetrio and his wife live alone in their house.

He has earned his living as a farmer for the whole of his life. He learned how to farm from his father, then worked independently. The land where he grows his crops is near his house, and it’s easy to get there.

Now Demetrio needs a loan to pay laborers to work his land. He hopes to continue working with this institution and provide his wife with better living conditions.

loans.use: pay laborers to work his land

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito, a father of four, is 57 years old. From Liloy, in the Philippines, Pablito joined PMPC in order to access its programs and services. 

He has requested a new loan to buy merchandise for his store. Pablito deeply hopes that his efforts will continue to benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Pamfila

texts.en:
Pamfila, who is married to a tailor, is known in their neighborhood for being a good health worker. A member of PMPC, she is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

Pamfila hopes to live comfortably in a decent house. She has applied for a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase bags of cement and loads of sand to finish the wall of her house. 

Pamfila hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that her loan request has been given priority as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to finish the wall of her house.

loans.name: Victorino Antonio

texts.es:
Victorino tiene 48 años de edad, estudió hasta  6° grado, es casado y padre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian, uno de 11 años estudia  5° grado y el otro de 14 años estudia 8° grado, en su casa vive solo con su esposa y sus hijos.

Victorino se dedica a la crianza de pollos, tiene una granja desde hace 5 años, también tiene una pequeña tiende de productos de primera calidad y un molino, todo esto lo tiene en su casa por lo cual no es necesario salir a otros lugares a trabajar.

Él necesita el crédito para ampliar el techo de su granja de pollos y también poner techo para el molino.

Él sueña con mejorar su tienda, que le genere mayores ganancias y sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Victorino is 48 years old. He went to school until the 6th grade. He is married, and is the father of 2 children, who are in school. One child is 11 years old and in 5th grade, and the other is 14 years old and in 8th grade. He lives alone in his house, with his wife and his children. 

Victorino makes a living raising chickens. He has had a farm for 5 years. He also has a small premium products store, and a mill. He has all these things in his house, so it is not necessary to go other places to work. 

He needs a loan to expand the roof of his chicken farm, and also to put a roof on his mill.

His dream is to improve his store, so it will generate higher profits, and to raise his children to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to expand the roof of his chicken farm, and to put a roof on the mill.

loans.name: Costureras Clarenas Group

texts.en:
The ladies of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Costureras Clareñas” are requesting their second loan from KIVA to strengthen and expand their small businesses.

Marta is a 26-year-old member of the group who has a primary school education. She has two children who have already begun school. Along with her family, Marta has a small workshop where various sizes of pants for children are sewn. Each week, the family delivers many dozen pants to the bustling market. Marta is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase an industrial sewing machine to increase production to meet additional demand.

Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer meets with the women and shares information about the world around them and within them. Using stories, role-playing, pictures and drawings, the ladies learn about self-esteem, empowerment and women’s rights. They learn to care for their families with information about hygiene, health, and the use of medicinal plants. They also acquire new business tools including budgeting, accounting and marketing.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your generosity in funding these loans. It is truly appreciated. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the near future on Marta and her friends in the Trust Bank.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to increase production to meet additional demand.

loans.name: Gracelfe

texts.en:
Gracelfe is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 31 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Liloy. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 4,000 per month. 

Recently, Gracelfe accessed a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to renovate and expand her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to renovate and expand her house

loans.name: Jorge Adrian

texts.es:
