Jorge es un barbero de 34 años de edad, es soltero y procurar por generar ingresos para llevar el alimento a su mesa y a su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad que es su fuente de inspiración para levantarse cada día y afrontar cada día de trabajo con una sonrisa pues lo justicia.
Aprendió empíricamente en su infancia y con años de práctica perfección su técnica, pero solo desde el año 2012 se decidió a montar su propio negocio.
Las principales dificultades que presenta el señor Jorge son la fuerte competencia y la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como son líquidos para la irritación, espuma para afeitar, cuchillas, tinturas, máquinas de afeitar, pitilleras, etc.
Con el préstamo podrá volverse fuerte en varios puntos de su empresa, teniendo como resultado la sostenibilidad de su negocio, ser más competitivo, diversificar la oferta de productos, mejorar su punto de venta.
texts.en:
34-year old Jorge is a barber. He is single and supports his 4-year old daughter with the money he earns. She is the reason why he gets up every day and has a smile on his face when he goes to work.

He learned to cut hair early on and with years of practice he has perfected his skills. However, it was only in 2012 that he decided to open his own business. Most of Jorge’s problems stem from the strong competition and lack of funds to invest in his business. 

He is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as soothing lotions, shaving cream, razor blades, dyes, razors, cigarette cases etc. The money will allow him to strengthen his business making it more sustainable, competitive, with a more diverse range of products, and improved facilities.

loans.use: buy soothing lotions, shaving foam, razor blades, dyes, razors

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda desde hace 16 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victor is 56 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He has had a store located in his home for sixteen years. He has many customers, especially his neighbors. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with his sales. He is seeking a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic staples, drinks, snacks, pastries etc. in order to be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic staples, drinks, snacks, pastries etc.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: In 2010, Virgilio learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Virgilio tried his luck doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. Virgilio borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give his farming income a big boost. Virgilio looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could access financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Maribeth has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken out several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase three additional piglets and pay for bags of feed and animal vitamins. Maribeth wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  three additional piglets and pay for bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs. Eliza is a widow and lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She applied for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and supporting her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic merchandise like sugar, oil, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Enor

texts.es:
Al hablar de Enor se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Lorica donde convive con su familia por la cual ha luchado para darles una vida digna.

El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de equinos y tiene plena fe en su negocio.
Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar caballos, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su negocio.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario y puede contar en pleno con el apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
When talking about Enor, it's easy to see he's a hardworking and obliging man who does everything for the benefit and well-being of his family.  He lives in a modest house in the town of Lorica with his family, for whom he strives to give a decent life.  He's a hardworking and persevering man who loves his family.

He earns a living buying and selling horses, and he has complete confidence in his business.  He's requesting a loan to buy horses.  He also wants to improve his business.

Enor hopes to be able to find help from people who are supportive of him and to have the full support of Interactuar corporation.

loans.use: to buy horses and to improve his business

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 43 года, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У Анары среднее образование, она много лет проработала в швейном цехе.  С 1999 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова с теленком, 4 лошади и 15 овец. На 1,20 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Совокупный ежемесячный доход Анары около 15,500 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологическичистого молока. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Anara is 43 and married with two sons. She has a high school education and has been working in a sewing workshop for many years. She has also been working in farming since 1999 as her primary source of income. She has a cow with a calf, four horses and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 1.2 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her total monthly income is about 15,500.

In order to further develop her business, Anara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGs to purchase two cows to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell. She plans to use profits from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en zona rural del municipio de Tierra Alta.
Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.
Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 3 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.
Trabaja con sus hijos durante 6 horas todos los días.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio además comprara cerdos para la cría.
Ella guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Luz is a very nice person, and she always has a smile for the customers who visit her grocery store, which is in a rural zone in the municipality of Tierra Alta.

Thanks to her charisma and good humor, she has been able to win the hearts and recognition of the people in the sector, who always prefer to visit her store to purchase their products.

Every day she works to give a good quality of life to her three children, for whom she aspires to give an excellent future. She works with her children for six hours every day.

Currently, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a supply of family food basket products, such as grains, groceries, snacks, and beverages, among other items.  In this way she will give her business a significant boost. In addition, she will purchase pigs to raise.

She hopes to be able to continue with her business, and thus continue making an impact on the lives of her customers through her good service.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of family food basket products, such as grains, groceries, snacks, and beverages, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, coffee, oil and flour in larger quantities.

loans.name: Sila Palmeth

texts.es:
Sila es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus dos hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Momil. Ella es madre responsable y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Sila is a country woman with drive and perseverance. She lives with her two children on a humble farm in a rural area of Momil. She is a responsible mother and during all this time has had the courage and valor to raise her children by her own means.

She makes her living producing and raising pigs. She has been in this business for one year with the aim of obtaining the needed resources to maintain her family. She works every day as her pigs need cleaning, food and constant monitoring to develop correctly and later sale.

She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and food for her pigs giving her the opportunity to have better feed piglets and in better condition for consumption. She dreams of seeing her children becoming professionals with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and food for her pigs.

loans.name: Arledys Luz

texts.es:
Arledys es una madre muy responsable de sus hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas además cría cerdos y los vende.
 
Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas y cerdos para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y carne y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Arledys también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Arledys is woman who takes very good care of her children.  She has gone through a lot of adversity in her life but she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.  Some time ago she started a business selling eggs laid by her chickens.  She also raises and sells hogs.  She dreams of seeing her business grow and she knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar and from the people that support her business, she will be able to do it.  

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase more chickens and hogs so that she can increase her egg and pork production capability in order to meet the demand of her customers.  This way, she will be able to increase her sales considerably, allowing her business to reemerge and for her to get ahead. Arledys also hopes to expand her business so that she can use all of her resources to get ahead and provide her children with a financially stable future.

loans.use: purchase more chickens and hogs to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” está conformada por 7 socias responsables y trabajadoras. Victoria de 46 años es viuda con 02 hijos dependientes. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de sopa de gallina. El deseo de Victoria es de poder terminar de construir su casa .Solicitó el crédito para la compra de gallinas, fideos cebolla y huevo. El grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Victoria  se encuentra de pie, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The "Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo" (Jesus Christ is My Role Model) communal bank is made up of 7 responsible and hardworking members.  

Victoria, 46, is widowed and has 2 children under her care.  She currently works selling chicken soup.  Victoria's dream is to be able to finish building her house.  She is seeking a loan to purchase chickens, noodles, onions, and eggs.  

The "Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo" group is grateful for those who have made this loan possible and they are committed to continuing with their work.  In the picture, Victoria is standing, she is the third from the left and is dressed in a black shirt.

loans.use: purchase chickens, noodles, onions and eggs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 58 years old and married with seven children. The family lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Veronica has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of her big family.

Since she wants to generate more income, Veronica joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. She has now applied for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale.

She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a plain housewife. She busies herself caring for her ornamental plants and earns a meager income from her hobby.

Now she plans to utilize her space, starting a little store and earning additional income, enabling her to meet her family's needs.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. Rosario is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to buy construction materials such as sand and bags of cement for her store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and bags of cement for her store.

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yorladys es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 1 año es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días durante 9 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando mecato, dulces, chocolatinas, galletería, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Yorladys manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Yorladys is a hardworking, organized and determined woman who is devoted to her family and passionate about her work.  For the past year, she has worked as an independent business woman.  She has a store located in the center of the city where she works everyday for 9 hours.  She is fortunate to not have much competition and she is well known throughout the city.  

With the support of this loan, she will be able to strengthen her inventory but purchasing snacks, candy, chocolate, and cookies to add more variety to her offerings and increase her sales.  Yorladys states that her biggest challenge is continuing to strengthen and prove her business so that she can make it more profitable and have the financial ability to purchase her own home where she can enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: purchase snacks, candy, chocolates, and cookies.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Ее зовут Сурайё, ей 31 год. Она добрая и мягкосердечная женщина. Сурайё замужем и мать двоих детей. Детям 6 и 5 года. Ее муж работает в Российской Федерации. Она сама дома занимается животноводством. Сурайё хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить доходность от бизнеса. Для нее сейчас главное поддержат животноводческую деятельность, потому, что переводы денег от мужа сократились. Сурайё надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны, чтобы купить несколько голов скотин и увеличить поголовья. Она заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Meet Surayo.  She is 31 years old and a gentle and kind-hearted woman.  She is married and the mother of two children, ages 6 and 5.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Surayo herself makes a living raising livestock at home.  She wants to expand her activity and increase the income she makes from her business.  Her main goal right now is to maintain her animal husbandry activity because the money transfers from her husband have decreased.  Surayo is hoping to receive your support, so that she can buy a few head of livestock and increase the size of her herd.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and expand her activity.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer de 27 años de edad, ella vive junto con su pareja con la que tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un negocio que su esposo le ayudo a construir con madera, pero ahora quiere progresar, transcender, y llevar su negocio a otro nivel de lo que normalmente de ven en turbo.
Solicita un préstamo para hacer una remodelación total de su tienda, comprara vitrinas, estanterías, y un surtido muy completo de productos de la canasta familiar, esperando que el resultado del prestamos sea la consolidación de un autoservicio que no solo será muy gratificante para la empresaria, si no que será de gran ayuda en la zona de uraba.
texts.en:
Adriana, age 27, lives with her life partner.  They have a ten year old daughter.  She sells groceries at a business that her husband helped her build from wood.  However, she now wants to progress, transcend, and take her business to another level than what is normally seen in Turbo.

She is requesting a loan to completely remodel her store.  She will buy display cases, shelves, and a complete stock of basic needs products.  She is hoping that the result of the loan will be the incorporation of a self-service, which will not only be gratifying to the businesswoman, but it will also be a big help in the Uruba area.

loans.use: to buy display cases, shelves, and a complete stock of basic needs products to convert her business into a self-service.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is heading into the next cropping season. He wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. He wants to have enough supply of rice fertilizer and herbicides. He also needs a new knapsack sprayer, for which he applied for a loan from the Cooperative.

Epifanio hopes to save enough for the purchase of a rice thresher to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and herbicides and pay for a new knapsack sprayer.

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She religiously pays attention to making a good mark for every semester she entered.

For another school year, Jovielyn is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees.

Jovielyn has big dreams to help her family, and for her siblings as well. This is the reason why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 52 years of age and a resident of Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is a widow with five children.

Melanie has had a little fishing business from which to earn a living. She is one of the wholesaler buyers of fish in the area. With this business, she has met many challenges, but she realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged.

Melanie works hard in selling her fish to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy her fish. With her savings, she welcomes the idea of expanding her business.

Recently, she requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more stock of fish for selling. She feels assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future.

Melanie smiles at the thought of seeing all her children get their own diplomas and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for selling.

loans.name: Karla Yesenia

texts.es: Karla de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hijo, ella posee un comedor y venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, frijoles, tomates, pollo, carne, verduras, arroz, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Karla, age 34, lives in her own house with her mother and her son.  She has an eatery and a business selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas].  Her business is located close to her house in a heavily traveled area.  She has had the business for several years, and she has a lot of customers.  With what she gets from her sales she manages to get ahead in her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], soft cheese, corn, beans, tomatoes, chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice, etc.  She will buy everything in bulk in order to be able to continue with her sales and to, in this way, have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], soft cheese, corn, beans, tomatoes, chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa America

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermano, ella se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de piñatas desde hace 15 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las piñatas como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
52-year old Rosa lives in her own house with her brother. She has earned her living making and selling piñatas for 15 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With the money she earns she manages to cover household expenses.

Now Rosa is seeking a loan to buy the materials she needs for making piñatas: paper of different colours, glue, wire, newspaper etc. Then she will be able to earn more money and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy paper of different colours, glue, wire, newspaper etc. to make piñatas

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 61 год, в разводе, есть сын. Она ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 31 год назад. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На арендованном участке мерою 1,50 Га она выращивает картофель, люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Zamira is 61 years old, divorced, and she has one son.  As a mean to provide her family with its main source of income, she is running her own business, which she started 31 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows, ten sheep and two horses on her farm.  She also grows potatoes, alfalfa and barley for resale on 1.5 hectare of leased land.  She makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient to provide a decent living for her family.  In order to further grow her farming business, Zamira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows and consequently increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her numbers of domestic animals and to save enough money to build a barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase the size of her herd and improve her income.

loans.name: Victor Iganacio

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 30 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Víctor, 30, is a loving father and a farmer.  As his income wasn't enough to cover the household expenses, he started working as a day laborer on other farms in his free time raising and selling pigs.  He plans to improve his family's living conditions because, as the head of the household, he's responsible for all the expenses.  There's not a lot of capital left to invest in his business.

That's why he needs a loan to buy pigs to fatten and concentrated feed.  He'll be able to improve his sales and motivate his small business, making it more attractive to customers because he'll have more pigs for sale.

Víctor's main dream is to be able to earn a good income so his family has everything they need, unlike in his own life, which affected him a lot.  That's why he works tirelessly for his children and his wife.

Support a farmworker from the Colombian countryside who has big dreams for his family!

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed for his farm

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair.

loans.name: Nancy Evelyn

texts.es: Nancy de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carteras, bolsos, entre otras cosas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Nancy esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: hilos de colores, telas de varios estampados, zippers, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old. She lives in her own home with her three sons. She makes and sells wallets and purses, among other things. She has been doing this for the past three years, and she has many clients thanks to the quality of her products. 

With the money she earns through her sales, Nancy is able to cover her household expenses. She requests a loan to purchase supplies such as: thread in various colors, fabric with various patterns on it, zippers, etc. She will purchase all of these materials in bulk, and in this way she will be able to continue with her work which earns her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase materials in bulk such as colored string, patterned fabric and zippers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is a businesswoman from the village of Motibot, Sindangan. She is 51 years old and married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Marivic is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Marivic continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una comerciante de 44 años de edad, vende productos como lo son cigarrillos, dulces, chocolates, gomas de mascar, snacks, frituras en bolsa, su surtido es todo lo que se puede ver en la foto, pero con este negocio casero genera el sustento para su hijo de 13 años de edad, y paga las cuentas del hogar.
Su mayor preocupación es ser suficiente para cubrir tantos gastos ya que es madre cabeza de familia puesto que su esposo falleció.
Ella no quiere decaer y muchos menos inspirar tristeza por eso monto su negocio y ahora pide un apoyo con el cual se compromete a pagarlo cumplidamente y lo usara para la compra de una vitrina y mayor surtido para ir convirtiendo su venta informal en una tienda de abarrotes que es su gran objetivo, promete trabajar mucho para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is 44 years old. She is a saleswoman who sells product such as cigarettes, sweets, chocolates, chewing gum, snacks and chips. You can see all of the items she carries in the photo. She counts on this home-run business to sustain her 13-year-old son and pay the bills. Luz Dary is the head of the household because her husband passed away, and her greatest concern is that she doesn't make enough to cover all of their expenses. 

She doesn't want to make people feel bad or inspire pity, and for this reason she launched her business. She now requests support, which she promises to pay back on time. She will use the loan to purchase a display case and to increase her stock, in order to convert her informal business into a convenience store. This is her primary goal, and she promises to work a great deal in order to achieve it.

loans.use: to establish a convenience store.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale, she is working on swine production. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn, a hardworking woman, has a snack-vending business in Ozamiz. She is very diligent and she works as twice as she could to provide for her family.  She is married and has three kids. Merlyn has applied for membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. Merlyn is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cake because she wants to display her food snacks in any canteen and eatery in the area to generate more income. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 20,000 and is thankful for financing for her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cake.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for kitchen tools, food packaging (boxes, bags, plastic wrap, foil, etc.), various stocks of ingredients, cooling racks, baking dishes and other materials needed in baking.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
She is Zenaida. She has been operating her own tailoring business for more than 15 years, and she makes good earnings from it. She was also able to support all of her three children, who are now working and helping her to provide for their daily needs. She dreams of becoming successful someday and she is determined to further improve her business and their lives.

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional clothing products and tailoring supplies. These include more ready-to-wear items like clothes for men, women and children and supplies like threads, zippers, sleeve heads, buttons, needles and many other items. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Every week, she meets with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing products and tailoring supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is managing her eatery business in Ozamiz. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she took a loan for an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to buy various materials needed in her sewing business. From her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Now, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed for sewing rugs to sell. Her round, palm-sized cloths are useful for cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters, so they are major housekeeping and cleaning item and are changed constantly to ensure a bacteria-free cloth.

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her because her income from selling rugs is a big help for their daily sustenance.

Jenneth hopes to sustain and grow her business. She dreams of a better future for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials she needs for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Gina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lolita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to her customers.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magadalena es una habitante de la zona de turbo, una zona de agricultores y criadores de animales, ella se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollos, una de sus principales ventajas es que es de turbo que para su conocimiento es el mayor puerto de Colombia y llegan personas de muchos lugares buscando productos, ella aprovecha y ofrece sus pollos criollos que son muy buscados en el mercado, por su sabor y nutritivas propiedades.
Aprovechando su lugar de vivienda ella quiere solicitar un préstamo que destinara en la compra de pollos y su respectivo alimento, los engordara y posteriormente cuando sea el momento los venderá.
Ella es una humilde mujer que le sonríe mucho a la vida tiene este negocio con el único propósito de poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The port of Turbo is the largest in Colombia, and the city and surrounding area has many farmers and ranchers.
 
Magdalena, a humble woman who is usually smiling, is one of the farmers and ranchers in Turbo. She makes a living raising chickens to sell to the many people who come to Turbo, and demand for her flavorful and nutritious chickens at the market is high.  

Magdalena wants to apply for a loan so that she can take advantage of her location, using the loan funds to purchase chickens and feed. She'll raise the birds and then sell them when they're mature and have the best flavor. 

Raising and selling her flock is Magdalena's only source income and the funds to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed, taking advantage of her location near Colombia's main port.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар 30 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Нилуфар среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 7 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Нилуфар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров. На арендованном участке мерою 3,0 ГА и собственном - 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу и рис для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нилуфар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nilufar is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income and which she started seven years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has five cows on her farm.  She also grows corn and rice for resale on three hectares of leased land and one hectare of her own land.  She makes a total monthly income of up to 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and prepare her land.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her numbers of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and to prepare her land for spring farm work.

loans.name: Jorge Asuncion

texts.es: Jorge de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 20 años, y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmayos y redes para continuar con la pesca y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old.  He lives in a house he owns with his wife and their two children.  He has worked as a traditional fisherman for twenty years.  He sells his products in the outskirts of the area where he lives.  With the money he earns from his sales, he is able to meet his household expenses.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase trammel nets and fishing nets to continue fishing and have increased income.

loans.use: to purchase trammel nets and fishing nets.

loans.name: Emilybeth

texts.en: Emilybeth earns a living managing a beauty salon. It offers services like manicure, pedicure, hair cutting and other hair treatment services. She is 36 years old and a widow with 3 kids. She is now well-known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and is able to save from it. Her services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 4,000 per month. She is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for hair treatment and foot spa services. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in a few months. In her two previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Emilybeth is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for hair treatment and foot spa services.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is a hardworking mother of five children. She has engaged in fish selling for 17 years, as one of her sources of income.  Her husband is a contractual carpenter. Her previous loan was used to add working capital in fish selling and to pay her loan in Paglaum religiously. Now, Dionesia avails another loan which she will use to pay tuition and graduation fees of her daughter. She is very happy seeing her daughter finish her studies, and hopes that her daughter can find a better job.

loans.use: to pay tuition and graduation fees of her daughter.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael, 29, is single and a resident of Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. He has been in this business for two years. The computer business is a primary source of income, which helps support his two siblings. He became a member of Paglaum MPC in 2014. Recently, Michael decided to apply for a loan to buy additional two units of computers with printers to increase his income with more inventory and programs. In the future, he hopes to save more for emergencies and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy two units of computers with printers.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
This is Ruel, age 51 and a resident of Parañaque City, Philippines. He is a widower, and his two children help him provide for their everyday needs. Ruel is working hard to support his youngest child’s educational expenses.

Ruel is an air conditioner technician and has been offering air conditioning services for six years now. They provide services like installations, maintenance, ductworks, ventilation, design and refrigeration. His regular customers are his neighbors and people in their local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 a week.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. He will be utilizing the loan to add to his current revolving funds used for the business. He will buy equipment, materials, and other supplies he needs to improve his services.

Ruel dreams of expanding his business and becoming better-known in the community. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment, materials and other supplies he needs for his air conditioning business.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 67 years old, married and a resident of Bunawan, Calamba, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have five children. Starting with capitalization of 2,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her grandchildren finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic commodities for a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
Maria Nenita is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Her store earnings helped meet her daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, canned goods, instant noodles, and toiletries that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Maria Nenita dreams of having a bigger General Store. She prays that their quality of life will improve. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Lily has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of personal products to resell.

Lily has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 41 years old. She is married with eight children, three of whom are in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Elena has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 55 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Alma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Milagros is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Emperatriz works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane. Emperatriz is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of plastic ware, perfume, body lotion and other personal items to sell for her personal products business.

Emperatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic ware, perfume, body lotion and other personal items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to retail.

loans.name: Florilyn

texts.en:
Florilyn is a 50-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines and she is married to Eloy. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Florilyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like undergarments, perfume, detergents, toothpaste and other products needed in her business. 

Florilyn dreams to expand her business more and hopes to improve their present financial status. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like undergarments, perfume, detergents, toothpaste and other products of the like.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Her name is Bernadette, 33, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, married to Nerson, an OFW, and has one child. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child. 

Bernadette has a direct-selling business. She sells natural organic drinks. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and health-conscious. They are learning to take natural drinks to support their well-being for the love of their family. Aside from natural drinks, she also sells processed frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy natural coffee and natural juice powder to meet the advanced order of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives, friends and the local community. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help cover her child's education and their daily sustenance.

Bernadette aims to grow her business so she can give her child a college education. She prays for a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for natural organic drinks and frozen processed foods as well to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like slippers, pants, and other ready to wear clothing.

Teresita has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Teresita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, pants, and other ready to wear clothing.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a ice candy business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ana is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy milk, sugar, and coconut for her ice candy business.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and coconut for her ice candy business.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Alita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre libre, alegre, fresco, rumbero, disfruta de una buena cerveza con sus amigos, de un buen baile, es una persona humilde que trabaja independientemente en le venta  de alimentos que el mismo genera y vende por encargo.
No tiene hijos, su única preocupación son sus padres, llevarles alimentos, medicamentos, tenerlos bien que no pasen necesidades y sobretodo felices.
Tomas se encuentra trabajo fuertemente para poder constituir un local, un proyecto que todavía se le demora ya que con lo que tiene ahora no podría cubrir los gastos de arrendamiento o no tendría como comprar el espacio.
Él quiere solicitar un préstamo inicialmente para aumentar su producción todo el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y queso, una vez que estabilice las ventas por el aumento de producción.
Su proyecto a largo plazo será comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a free, happy, fresh, fun-loving man who likes to enjoy a beer with his friends and a good dance.  He is a humble person who works independently selling food that he makes and sells by order.  He does not have children.  His only concern is his parents, who he brings food and medicines so that they stay well, don't lack any necessities, and most importantly, are happy.  

Tomas works hard to be able to build a shop, a project that he has put off since everything he has now will not cover the cost of a rental and he would not be able to buy the space.

He wants to request a loan to increase his production, so he will invest the money in the purchase of fish and cheese.  Once his sales stabilize, his production will increase.

His long term project will be to purchase his own home.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cheese to make traditional dishes from his region.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan es un joven campesino de 28 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de platano, cultivos que atiende todos los días, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y asi mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Juan, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a young farmer, age 28, who is hardworking and humble.  

He learned how to do all the work associated with farming when he was very young, thanks to the lessons of his parents.  This has allowed him to make progress, and today he owns plantain crops that he tends every day.  Additionally, he works as a day-laborer on different farms in the region, as with this, he supplements the income with which he looks after the wellbeing of his parents who fought so hard to raise him. 

With the support of the requested loan from Interactuar, he will purchase agricultural supplies in bulk, such as compost, pesticide, fertilizer, and other items.  With this, he will continue caring for his crops and have a better and more productive harvest, thus improving his income when he sells his produce.

Juan, with his enterprising spirit, strength, and tenacity, wants to keep fighting to achieve the dream of having his own farm where he could cultivate a much greater variety of produce, and thus improve the profitability of the business, guaranteeing financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in bulk, such as compost, pesticide, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for the operating expenses of her funeral parlor and to buy supplies and materials needed. Her earnings helped meet their daily living expense. Aside from her funeral parlor she also has a junk shop.

She is now requesting for a 51,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the overhead expenses of her funeral parlor and partly to pay for the maintenance of her truck which is being used to gather and transport scrap materials for her junk shop. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rebecca dreams of having a bigger funeral parlor for better service and for her junk shop to grow to be able to save for her old age. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses of her funeral parlor and pay for the maintenance of her truck.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from Taguig City. She has been an active member of CCT since 2009 and she has already acquired several loans to make good profit from her business. She is a widow and she is determined to work harder, even in her old age, because she wants to give her family a good life in the future.

Ofelia owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams come to happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste, or even an ice tube. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future.

Ofelia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to pay the maintenance costs of her apartment. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to the maintenance costs of her rental apartment. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Nimfa wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to continue help support their daily needs and expenditures. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 50, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Ariel and they are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs and expenses.  

Marilyn operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric and other tailoring materials needed in her business. 

Marilyn hopes to build her own shop so she can accommodate more customers and accept bulk orders. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fabric and tailoring materials she needs to continue operating her business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Jona works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.  Jona is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Ludevina

texts.en:
Ludevina is 54 years old and married with four children. Ludevina works very hard to provide for them.

Ludevina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ludevina has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Ludevina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Leonalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell to customers.

Leonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Josephine has a general store business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack food, noodles, and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for three years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Rizalee

texts.en:
Maria Rizalee works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maria Rizalee requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers and other groceries.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Maria Rizalee would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 29 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Ritchel works very hard to provide for them.

Ritchel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ritchel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer de 55 años de edad ella vive sola, no tiene hijos, es independiente y tiene su negocio de venta de mercancía ambulante, ella vende estuches y carcasas para celulares, cosméticos, accesorios, estuches para control, pilas de repuestos, juguetes, bolsos, etc. 
Dicho negocio le ha representado casi todo en su vida, ella antes era empleada pero por desacuerdos con su jefe llego a tomar la decisión de emprender su propio camino y hoy en día a pesar de ser una mujer que aparenta mucha rigidez, seriedad, postura, es tierna y muy amable pero ante todo muy correcta.
Ella quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, es por ello que busca optimizar la forma de operar en su negocio, diversificar su oferta, aumentar sus clientes y lo hará solicitando un préstamo para la compra de surtido, su idea es diversificar su oferta de juguetes y comprar algunos femeninos pues siempre se ha inclinado por los masculinos. Con esto espera atraer al público de las princesas y que esto le genere buena rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 55 year old woman who lives independently on her own and doesn't have any children. She  has a business selling merchandise by foot. She sells boxes and cases for cell phones, cosmetics, accessories and remote controls; as well as batteries, toys, bags, etc. She has been in the sales business for nearly her whole life. She used to work for someone else, but because she disagreed with her boss she decided to start her own business. Today, although she is a woman whose posture suggests that she is rigid and serious and proper above all, she is also very sweet and kind.

Luz Marina wants to improve the condition of her home, and for this reason she wants to make her business run as optimally as possible by diversifying her products and gaining more customers. She has requested a loan to purchase items for her store. The idea is to diversify the types of toys she offers and to purchase toys for girls because she has always sold primarily toys for boys. With this, she hopes to attract the "princesses" of the public and to make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase toys for children.

loans.name: Bebsie

texts.en:
Bebsie is 58 years old, and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Bebsie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Bebsie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Bebsie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Bebsie would like to save enough money to  expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 50 years old, and married with three children.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

Nemia has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nemia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is 45 years old, and married with four children.

Nancita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nancita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nancita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is a married woman with seven children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdesita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lourdesita requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Lourdesita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lourdesita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for an 8,000 PHP loan which she will use buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, canned goods, and toiletries which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Luzviminda dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es un orgulloso integrante de las fuerzas públicas de Colombia, es un hombre responsable, trabajador, entregado, hábil e inteligente; siempre dispuesto a ayudar a su comunidad.

Es padre soltero y siempre tiene presente que el producto de sus esfuerzos debe ser reflejado en el bienestar de su único hijo.

El solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado porcino el cual criara y levantara para posteriormente venderlo y de esta forma tener los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento y la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños.

Apoya a este hombre carismático que con su valor intentara sacar adelante a su familia y prestara su mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jorge is a proud member of the Colombian Government Forces. He is a responsible, hardworking, dedicated, skillful, and intelligent man, who is always willing to help his community.

He is a single father, and he is always mindful that the result of his efforts must be reflected in the wellbeing of his only son.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of pigs, which he will raise to sell later. In this way, he will have the income necessary for his support and for his son’s education, which is one of his biggest dreams.

Support this charismatic man who bravely strives to raise his family, and give his best service.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a first-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. He is a married man with six children.

He operates a retail shop in Kirinya Kitto-Bweyogerere and also resides there. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy items like sugar, corn flour, soap, toiletries, batteries, and beverages that are in demand by his customers, in order to increase his sales and profit from his retail shop.
