He is very grateful for the support that Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to him. He hopes to make more money since he is sure the loan will increase his sales, and because he is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 43 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fe has a beauty product retail business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other beauty products to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 64 years old, and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Mila has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Mila would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes, especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her extended family.  She has made a living making and selling tortillas for 5 years.  She has a lot of clients, especially her neighbors, and uses her earnings to pay for some of the household expenses.  

Maria is applying for a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime, to continue her work in order to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 43 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Geraldine has a personal products business in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other personal care products to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for two years. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Erica Yesenia

texts.es:
Hoy Érica se siente feliz alegre, ella está cumpliendo no un sueño si no una meta de tener por fin un local comercial donde poner su puesto de comidas rápidas, ella antes tradicionalmente vendía sus productos en la calle con su puesto de comidas, pero como lo ven el foto está en proceso de mejoras locativas para pasar al siguiente nivel de consolidación de su negocio.
Por ende solicita un préstamo para terminar de realizar las reformas como lo son pintura, compra de mesas, sillas, manteles, implementos e iluminación.
texts.en:
Today Érica is happy because she is making not her dream, but her goal of finally having a commercial locale where she can sell her fast food come true.  She used to sell her products in the street with her food stall. As can be seen in the photo, she is in the process of making improvements on the locale to go to the next level of consolidating her business.

Therefore, she is asking for a loan to finish the improvements by buying paint, tables, tablecloths, utensils and lighting.

loans.use: to buy paints, tables, chairs, tablecloths and utensils.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer soltera de 37 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, inicio el negocio por una necesidad económica y tomo algunas clases para lograr una mejor cercanía con el cliente.
Ella al no tener éxito para emplearse opto por esta actividad que ha encontrado muy rentable en gran parte gracias a su labor de venta, ella trabaja las horas necesarias para sacar un sueldo que le permita pagar sus deudas.
Gladis solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido, la razone s que esto funciona por pedidos y ella la pedir en grandes cantidades y pagar de inmediato tendrá un descuento y dicho descuenta aumentara su capital ganado por la venta de productos.
Su idea es mejorar y no quedarse con la venta de catálogos solamente, ahorrar dinero y consolidar un almacén de venta de productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Gladis is a single 37-year-old woman who makes a living selling merchandise from catalogs.  She started this business out of economic necessity and she took some classes to achieve a better relationship with her customers.  Seeing that she wasn't able to get a job, she chose this activity that she has found very profitable, due in large part to her sales work.  She works the necessary hours to bring in wages that allow her to pay her debts.  

Gladis is applying for a loan to buy supplies, because her business operates based on orders that she makes in large quantities, and if she pays for them immediately she will have a discount that will increase her profits from selling products.  She intends to improve and not make a living only from catalog sales, and to save money and establish a grocery store selling personal care products.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a big order that she is making in her business selling catalog products

loans.name: Lua Helida

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Helida, tiene 39 años de edad, una hija adolescente de 19 años y se dedica a ejercer la profesión de distribuidora de dulces, chocolates, gomas de mascar, antojos en general, inicio su negocio en el año 2012, dicho año significo progreso pues al separarse de su marido se le paso mucho por la mente como iba a hacer para sostenerse y pagar las cuentas pues antes se dividía los gastos con él.
Su perseverancia, sus ganas de trabajar, de progresar junto con su hija la han llevado a tener buenos resultados y quiere seguir encaminada por esta buena senda en donde espera poder montar un gran almacén con empleados y pedidos para todo el país.
La mayor dificultad de Luz Helida son realizar los largos desplazamientos pues como valor agregado ella lleva cada pedido hasta la puerta del cliente sin cobrar un costo adicional.
Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de dulces en grandes cantidades y solo le queda el pensamiento y compromiso de trabajar fuertemente para lograr sus sueños y en un futuro poder comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
This is Luz Helida. She is 39 years old. She has a 19 year old daughter. She distributes candies, chocolates, chewing gum, and general snacks. She started her business in 2012. That year meant progress because when she separated from her husband, she thought a lot about how she was going to support herself and pay the bills, because before she would split the bills with him. 

Her perseverance and her eagerness to work and to progress with her daughter have led to her having good results. She wants to keep going down this goods path where she hopes to open a great store with employees and orders throughout the country.  

Luz Helida's biggest difficulty is transportation. As added value, she delivers orders to her customers' doors with no additional charge. She wants to ask for a loan to buy a variety of candies in large quantities. She just has the plan and the commitment to work hard to make her dreams come true and in the future buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy candies in large quantities. She has a distribution center located in her house and she does home deliveries.

loans.name: Florie

texts.en: While Florie (or 'Goldy' in English) wants to thank you for the previous financial help, now she needs your help again to buy items for her bar-café.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for her lilttle bar-café

loans.name: Carmen Otilia

texts.es: Carmen vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Carmen esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in her own home with her daughter, and she has owned a small store located in her home for 2 years.  She has a lot of clients because of the variety of products and the good prices that she offers.  She uses her earning from sales to go about paying her household expenses. 

Carmen is applying for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other product, in order to make a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other products

loans.name: Doney Asmed

texts.es:
Doney es un admirable hombre de 44 años de edad, como se puede ver en la foto por un accidente quedo en sillas de ruedas pero este increíble hombre no se rinde y trabaja diariamente para poder mantener su hogar, se dedica a la venta de películas ambulantemente, inicio el negocio pro necesidad económica y ya que por el accidente no podía ejercer su trabajo anterior.
Su mayor dificultad no es su imposibilidad para caminar para él eso no es excusa para no trabajar, su mayor problema es con las personas de espacio público quienes no lo dejan trabajar por ocupar un sendero peatonal, pero a pesar de que sabe esto, este negocio es todo lo que tiene y con lo que quiere seguir para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Su sueño es comprar vivienda y por este trabaja diariamente 12 horas, es un hombre que no se rinde y ahora pide un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido de películas en general, una “ventaja” que tiene es que las personas se compadecen un poco por su inmovilidad y le compran.
texts.en:
Doney is an admirable man of 44, and as you can see in the photo he is in a wheelchair because of an accident, but this incredible man did not give in and works daily to be able to maintain his home.  He makes a living as a traveling movie salesman, and he started this business out of economic necessity since he was no longer able to do the work he did before because of the accident.

His biggest difficulty is his inability to walk, but for him that's not an excuse to stop working.  His biggest obstacle is that the people in the public space don't allow him to work because he is occupying a pedestrian path.  Even though he knows this, this business is all that he has and he wants to continue with it to support his household.

His dream is to buy a house and he is working 12 hours a day towards that goal.  He is a man who doesn't give up and presently he is asking for economic support to buy supplies of movies in general.  One of his "advantages" is that people buy from him because they are somewhat sympathetic to his immobility.

loans.use: to buy stocks of DVD and Blu-Ray videos.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 34 years old and married with three children. With all children currently in school, Analou works very hard to provide for them.

Analou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, coffee and cereal to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Analou would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, coffee and cereal to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is 51 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lourdes has a business selling fish in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Arriane

texts.en:
Arriane is 28 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Arriane has a general store business in the Philippines. Arriane requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Arriane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arriane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of bamboo business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing and selling recycled materials. Delia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell to customers.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is a repeat borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is a single man with one child who is in school. 

Festo is a business man who operates both wholesale and retail shops at Bunga-Kawuku trading center along Gaba Road and resides in the same place. He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings to add stock into the business.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to him.

loans.use: add stock to his wholesale and retail businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilisers.

loans.name: Kyambura Bakyara Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Zamu, aged 56 years old, is a member of Kyambura Bakyara Tukwatanise group. She is married with three children. She receives income from her children to supplement her monthly earnings. 

As part of the group, Zamu has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more dried coffee from villages. She does business from Kyambura, Kichwamba, in the Rubirizi district, and her clients are coffee traders. She is faced with the challenge of bad weather, especially drought, but is ready to succeed through her hard work. With her loan money, she is determined to boost her business and achieve her long term dreams. 

The group promises UGAFODE MDI and Kiva lenders that they will repay their loan. Zamu thanks UGAFODE MDI for being a good bank to save with and also one that identifies with the needs of the rural community. She hopes to buy another piece of land eventually.

loans.use: to buy coffee to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is a married man with six children.

Ali is a herbalist and owns rentals in Nalukolongo, a suburb in Kampala four kilometers from the city centre. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to boost his business.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have always have offered to him.

loans.use: to improve his business.

loans.name: Bumu Development Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is a single mother with three children who lives in Massajja.

Ruth sells fruits. Fruits have recently been scarce because of the dry season which increased the prices. She has been prompted to borrow money to meet the demand. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to boost her business.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her and fellow group members.

The seventh person on the extreme left is the UGAFODE credit officer, not part of the group.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena, a 50-year-old villager from northern Albania, is requesting from you a loan in the amount of 300,000 Albanian Lek to buy olive/plum/peach seedlings for planting. 

Prena is a married mother of two, and agriculture is the only source of income for her family. Up until recently, she used to plant only veggies and grains, but now she wants to focus mostly on orchards. “I’m aware that it will take about three years for seedlings to grow and start producing fruits. So, I will still keep planting veggies and grains until then, but will have a smaller income than before. My 25-year-old son who works for a pay of $300/month will help out financially as well,” said Prena to the branch assistant who interviewed her.

loans.use: to buy olive, plum and peach seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from working in a general store. Marilou is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 38-year-old married woman with four school-aged children who works very hard to provide for them.

Angel has  run a general store for 13 years  and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stock items to sell in her general store.

She sells soft-drinks, cereals, snack foods, canned goods, candies, and sugar. 

In the future, Angel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock items.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with nine children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 3 years  and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from food vending.

Nenita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, chips, etc.

Maribel has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa (palm) roofing and food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income selling sea cucumber. Agnes is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing nets for her  business.

Agnes has sustained her business  through 10 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, three attend school.

She has earned a living growing flowers for 3 years and is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer, flowers, and plastic bags.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, flowers, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 46-year-old married woman with six children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 26 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, spices, eggs, and noodles.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income operating a restaurant and  selling vegetables.

Lilia aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, spices, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Felicitas is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers.

Felicitas has been farming corn and vegetables for five years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Elsuida

texts.en:
Elsuida has two adorable children who are 2 and 6 years old.  They help feed the chickens early in the morning.

Elsuida is a 39-year-old  married woman who focuses on agriculture as the only source of income for the family. She has three cows, two pigs, and 20 chickens. She owns a small plot of land to  plant feed for her animals  and vegetables for the family. She does the labor and also cares for her mother-in-law who has been paralyzed for a very long time.

She seeks your help to purchase a license for a recently built  bar-café in the village. The loan will be used to pay for the license.

loans.use: to purchase a license for a recently built bar-cafe in the village.

loans.name: Ylli

texts.en:
Ylli ( ‘Star’ in English), is a 39-year-old married villager with a 2-year-old daughter. He was assigned as a caretaker for his sick sister and also recycles scrap plastic and pepper bottles to earn roughly $200/month. In addition to this, he grows vegetables and grows cherry, figs,  and grapes. He needs your financial help to pay for the land’s documents.

Kindly note that about 20 years ago, with the collapse of the previous regime, all the agricultural land in Albania that was taken from every land owner in 1945 and was considered government properties. It was assigned back to every household who had contributed in those cooperatives previously and were living in the villages. This caused thousands of conflicts everywhere in the country and lives were lost.  The so-called new land owners were told that the land was theirs and they used it, but they were never given the documents. It is said now that this government will take care of this; but that remains to be seen.

loans.use: to pay for the documents of the agricultural land.

loans.name: Nyagika '2011' Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Florence. She describes herself as ambitious and is a member of Nyagika 2011 Group. She is a 54-year- old married woman with 5 children.

She grows cabbage, kale, and potatoes and also operates a grocery store. She is borrowing a loan to purchase vegetables for the grocery business. She says this will help her to  support her family, provide decent clothing, and pay school fees for her children. 

Florence is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions, meat, potatoes etc in order to cook dishes for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store and requests  8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell.

She  earns additional income selling peanuts.

Gina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods .

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 28 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Richelle has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Fe is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to  purchase more ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Ligaya has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Shirly

Shirly has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for seven years, and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

Emelita is 55 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and to buy a new variety of rice seeds.

Emelita has been farming rice for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Didith

texts.en:
Didith is 44 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, egg, soap, etc.

Didith has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from furniture making.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Rosemarie has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from direct seling Avon and Natashia products and from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Precious Rose

texts.en:
Precious Rose is a 22-year old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is a single parent of a 2-year old. Precious Rose is the youngest in her  family. Her father is a vegetable vendor, while her mother is a housewife. Their total monthly family income of PHP5,000 ($113) is short in providing for their basic needs. This lack motivates Precious Rose to find means to help the family have more income, which is why she's happy to have successfully passed BagoSphere's 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping her family, Precious Rose dreams of becoming a successful call center agent for a prestigious BPO company and to help her family. 

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Precious Rose have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 33-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bacolod City. She is married to Gelvis John, who works as a salesman. They have three children aged 11, 9 and 6; two are in elementary school. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 8,000 ($181USD). Michelle has long seen the need to help her husband, but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of BagoSphere that could lead to a call center job. 

Now that she has passed BagoSphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Michelle starts earning, she can help provide for her family’s basic needs and then save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Willan

texts.es:
Willan es un hombre de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 14 años, y trabaja como agricultor.
Él es buen padre, paciente, constante, atento, generoso, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘Chapare’ una localidad rural donde la mayor parte del año existen persistentes lluvias y olas de calor, la agricultura se centra en la producción de frutas y verduras, como; banano, palmitos, yuca, y la milenaria hoja de coca.
Willan es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que efectúa. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben caminar 10 minutos hasta el rio para recoger agua en baldes y recipientes. Su actividad es la producción de madera para exportación, su producción cuenta con árboles de madera fina como; teca y serebo para uso en ebanistería y madera corriente para construcción. La extracción de la madera se realiza con manejo sostenible, por cada árbol que corta se plantan 2, las especies más populares son; Cedro, Roble sudamericano, Cedro rana, mara macho, Ipe, Almendrillo, Camaru, Garapa y muchas otras más. “la producción de madera es un trabajo a largo plazo, se debe plantar para producir y tarda alrededor de 10 años según tipo de madera…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la venta se realiza por toda su producción, la desventaja es que el campo se debe cuidar hasta la finalización de la producción. Su sueño es contar con todos los servicios básicos en su hogar, él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para brindarle a su familia una vida confortable. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Willan solicita un préstamo para realizar la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia un hogar confortable.
texts.en:
35-year-old Willan works in agriculture and lives with his spouse. They have 2 children ages 12 and 14.

He is a good father, patient, persevering, attentive, generous, responsible and very hardworking. He works in Chapre, a rural village with frequent rain storms and heat waves throughout the year. The area's agriculture centers around the production of fruits and vegetables such as bananas, palm hearts, yuccas and the millenary coca leave.

Willan has dark skin, eyes and hair, he is short and has a medium built. His mother tongue is Quechua and he also speaks Spanish. His spouse also works in agriculture and his children are in school. He lives in his own house, which was primarily built with wood and has a corrugated iron roof. He has access to electricity but must walk 10 minutes to the river to obtain water. He collects water in buckets and other containers. 

His main activity is the production of wood for export. His field has trees such as teak and serebo for use in woodwork, as well trees that provide construction wood. The wood extraction is done in a sustainable manner -- for each tree that he cuts, he plants two. The most popular species are cedar, South American oak, cedrelinga, ipe, almond, camaru, garapa and many more. "Wood production is a long term job. After a tree is planted, it can take about 10 years for it to be used for production, depending on the type of wood", he says. The advantage of his business is that he sells his production as a whole, the disadvantage is that the field must be taken care of until the end of the production. His dream is to have all of the basic services at his home. He wants to connect drinking water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry area to provide a more comfortable life to his family. This is his first loan with the institution.

loans.use: to connect drinking water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell at her business.
She has been in this business for 9 years. Lourdes earns additional income from fishing.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell at her rice-vending business

Temah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Analyn

Analyn is 25 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming rice for six years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel is a 23-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. His father is a retired policeman and also has 3 tricycles for rental. His mother is a housewife. Junel has 7 siblings, his eldest sister is married and works in the mall, one brother works for a car company, and the others are still in school. Their total monthly family income is 10,000 PHP (approximately $226). 

The need to be able to help his family motivates Junel to find means to have more income. Fortunately, he qualified for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Junel aims to finish his training and help his family provide their basic needs. Junel likes to learn and through this training he wants to build his confidence to communicate with other people. 

Junel's biggest dream is to have a stable job to help his family. Your generosity in funding his loan will greatly motivate Junel to have better income in the coming months and help his family to a better, happier, and more stable life.

loans.use: to pay the tuition of a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem is a 20-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Kareem works by transferring goods for the local traders using an old rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Kareem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. Kareem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Selling food materials and other items is the sole source of income for Ali who is a 30-year-old living in Sana'a, Yemen. Despite that, he has a University education, but he couldn't find a job to take care of his family. His income now is very weak and he wants to increase it. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials and other items to expand his business. This loan will help him to attract a lot of customers and his profits as well as his income will increase. Ali will use a portion of the profits to rent a better apartment near his business to save the money that he pays daily for transportation from the house to the business.

Ali hopes to get a job that will help him to expand his business as well as to make a better future for his children.

loans.use: To purchase food materials and other items for his grocery to expand his business

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. He is living in Baku region with his lovely family. Kamran has store that sells handbags and women's shoes. Today Kamran wants to support his business and for that he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount, Kamran wants to buy more bags and shoes to sell, develop his business and increase his monthly income. Kamran says, “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for support. I’m greatly thankful to you.” Kamran wishes the best for his children and in the future, he wants help to his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy more bags and shoes and increase his monthly income. In the future, he wants to help  his children in their education.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en: Sameh is a 29-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his wife and son in a simple house. He is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transferring goods for the local traders using an old rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Sameh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. Sameh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one.

loans.name: Ali

This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. Ali appears in the photo.

loans.name: Ramez

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase women's and children's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 43-year-old hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda and she has been in the business of growing sorghum for commercial purposes. Even though she is working hard towards raising more income for her family, she is hindered by the challenge of inadequate capital. This delays her business plans, as she cannot be in a position to meet all the required items to plow her sorghum. She has asked for a loan to plow her garden for sorghum planting. In the future, Margret hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to plow her garden for sorghum planting.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en: Muhamad is married with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time a farmer growing cocoa that adds more income for him. He started the business 19 years ago but faces challenges of inadequate capital and high transport charges that hinder progress of his business. However, he has hopes of expanding his business. Muhamad has asked for a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, soap, salt, maize flour, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, soap, salt, maize flour, cooking oil and sodas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support his by parents by buying manure, irrigation equipments, pesticides and seeds to look after his crops.

loans.name: Angela Bibiana

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer de 30 años residente de una zona rural, como pueden ver en la foto es una zona de difícil acceso ya que no hay una vida y todo es lodo, ella tiene su hogar en una zona más alejada del pueblo principal.
Ella se separó de su esposo pro diferencias matrimoniales y de inmediato busco una alternativa para generar ingresos.
Quiere retomar la profesión que se dedicaba su pareja la cual es la cría de pollos, tenía su negocio en su casa pero al irse se llevó todo y ella quiere reconstruir sobre lo que quedo.
Solicita un préstamo para reconstruir su galpón de pollos, comprara 500 pollos, para ella este préstamo significa un nuevo comienzo, ser un fénix que renace de sus cenizas y buscara a toda costa triunfar y demostrar que ella tiene las capacidades para salir adelante y ser una gran empresaria.
Anímate, participa en este préstamo!
texts.en:
Ángela is 30 years old and lives in a rural area, shown in the photo. The area is difficult to access as there is only one road to the town and it is made of mud. Ángela’s home is outside of this main town.

Ángela separated from her husband and immediately began to look for new ways to earn an income.

Ángela wants to take on the same work that her ex-husband does: raising chickens. Ángela’s husband ran the business out of the couple’s home but, when he left, he took everything with him. Ángela wants to rebuild the business at her home.

Ángela is applying for a loan in order to buy 500 chickens and to rebuild her coop. This loan is a new beginning for Ángela, like a phoenix rising from the ashes who will, in spite of all the obstacles, triumph; Ángela will show that she can move forward and be a great businesswoman.

Why don’t you become a part of this loan too?

loans.use: to support her family by buying 500 chickens and repairing her chicken coop.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen es una joven muy trabajadora de 20 años de edad, ella solita con esfuerzo, ahorros y mucha creatividad monto un restaurante, su madre le ayuda en la cocina y ella se desempeña como mesera y apoya en todo lo que puede, tiene una hija de 6 meses de edad, por ella trabaja, quiere progresar, estudiar, convertirse en un referente en su pueblo de como una madre joven con ganas y sueños puede salir adelante.
Ella formo su restaurante con pocos materiales, madera, pintura y ayuda de sus parientes, con esto le dio forma a su negocio.
Carmen quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de algunos activos fijos, uno de ellos es la nevera la que tiene en el negocio es de su madre y les hace mucha falta en la casa, y lo más correcto es que su negocio tenga la suya, el resto de capital lo invertirá en surtido para preparar almuerzos, desayunos, aperitivos, una parte la destinara a comprar algunas telas las cuales tejera y hará unos lindos manteles para sus mesas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 20, is a very hard-working young woman who through her own effort, savings and much creativity established a restaurant.  Her mother helps in the kitchen and Carmen works as a waitress and helps with what she can.  She has a six-month old daughter who is her motivation.  She wants to progress, study and become a reference in her village as a young mother with determination and goals for getting ahead.

She set up the restaurant with very few materials, wood, paint and help from her relatives, giving form to her business.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy fixed assets, such as a refrigerator since the one in the restaurant belongs to her mother and is needed at home.  The business should have its own refrigerator.  The rest of the loan will be used to buy a variety of foods to make lunchs, breakfasts, and appetizers, and to buy some fabrics to make beautiful tablecloths for the tables.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for her business, a variety of foods, and fabrics to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gracias a sus ganas de progresar, su coraje, su inteligencia hoy la familia de Gladis puede tener una vida más digna, todo ello inicio en el año 2012 cuando tomo la dedición de convertirse en autónoma y monto su negocio de panadería.
Gladis quiere comprar una vivienda, mejorar su negocio, emplear más personas ya que cuenta con la ayuda de una persona. 
Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir un poco en su negocio, no lo hizo en estos 3 años de recorrido ya que estaba equilibrando su economía pero piensa que es el momento.
El préstamo lo quiere invertir en publicidad, como lo son un aviso exterior, volantes, la creación y registro de su marca, bolsas de empaques, decoración interior de su negocio, el resto lo comprara en harina y aderezos para sus panes.
Para Gladis este préstamo será muy transcendental en el crecimiento de su negocio ya que tendrá una identidad corporativa y busca generar el agrado y la confianza de consumir algún producto en su panadería.
texts.en:
Thanks to her determination in getting ahead, her courage and her intelligence, Gladis' family can lead a more dignified life.  It all began in 2012 when she decided to establish herself independently and open a bakery.

Gladis wants to buy a house, improve her business, and hire more personnel since she only has one worker.

She is requesting a loan to invest a bit in her business since she has never done so in the three years since she opened it since her economy was balanced, but now she believes it is time to request one.

The loan will be used for publicity, with outdoor signage, flyers, trademark creation and registration, wrapping bags, interior decoration; the rest will be used to buy flour and condiments for her breads.

For Gladis this loan is very important to the growth of her business which will have a corporate identity and seek to please customers and establish their loyalty for her bakery products.

loans.use: To buy publicity for her bakery,  outside signage, flyers, trademark creation and registration and supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 6,8 y 16 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a su familia apoyado en su negocio de venta de ropa la cual realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las calles de su municipio y el mercado central. Jorge desea construir un cuarto dormitorio, ya que siente que su vivienda es muy pequeña y viven en hacinamiento, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 53, lives in his own home with his partner and three children, ages 6, 8 and 16.  He is a hard-working man who makes a daily effort to provide for his family by selling clothing.  He works as a street vendor through the town and at the central market.

Jorge wants to build a bedroom because his house is very small and the family is crowded.  Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a fourth bedroom.  This will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella es soltera y cabeza de familia de dos hijos, aunque recibe la ayuda del padre de los niños, únicamente, ella siempre había querido desempeñar una actividad como independiente pero le faltaba ese apoyo y ese empuje no solo en dinero sino que la asesoren y la guíen para mitigar el riesgo de futuro cierre pro quiebra.
Ahora que se le presento la oportunidad la señora Martha está muy motivada pues con un apoyo podrá iniciar su negocio, escogió una cafetería ya que ella prepara ricos alimentos y tiene experiencia trabajando en empleos similares.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar el montaje de todo el negocio, comprara surtido de:
-	Bebidas
-	Refrescos
-	Dulces, papas en bolsa 
-	Víveres
-	Abarrotes
-	Y una nevera
Apoya a Martha en la consolidación de su negocio que ubicara en una parte de su casa ya que no cuenta con un local propio.
texts.en:
Martha, 41, is single and has two children, so she is the head of household.  However, she does receive some help from the father of the children.  She always wanted to have her own business but did not have the support nor drive, not only in money terms but also with regard to advice on how to reduce the risk of having to close because of bankruptcy.

Now that she has the opportunity, Martha is very motivated because she will have the support to start a business.  She has chosen a coffee shop where she will prepare delicious foods, as she has experience working in similar jobs.

The loan she is requesting is to buy the following for her business:

-  Beverages
-  Soft drinks
-  Sweets, bagged potato chips
-  Groceries
-  A refrigerator

Please support Martha in consolidating her business which she will establish in her home as she does not have her own shop space.

loans.use: To buy beverages, soft drinks, sweets, snacks, groceries and a refrigerator to set up a business at home.

loans.name: Katiztia Vickey

texts.es:
Katiztia, es una joven de 26 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2009, monto su negocio ofreciendo accesorios para el hogar y de miscelánea, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Trabaja sola durante 5 horas todos los días.

Katiztia se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, electrodomésticos, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Katiztia, 26, is a young woman who has worked in different jobs for some time but she always had in mind going into commerce.  So since 2009 she has been in business selling home accessories and miscellaneous goods, with a wide acceptance in this period of time.  She works alone five hours a day.  

Katiztia is known as an enterprising, kind woman with a vision and determination to get ahead.  Therefore she feels encouraged to request a loan to buy merchandise such as accessories, domestic appliances, etc., in order to give her business a better image that will attract customers.  She wants to offer them a variety of products to satisfy their demand and appeal to everyone visiting her business.  This will allow her to earn an income to continue supporting the household economy and to save so she can open other branches.  This will give her a more prosperous future and improve her family's quality of life significantly.

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise such as accessories, domestic appliances and to give her business a better image and perspective.

loans.name: Dougoufana's Group

texts.fr: Dougoufana,  au premier rang au centre sur la photo et portant un chapeau noir et assis dans une chaise, est membre d'un groupe de 10 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Kolonda, au sud de Bamako, au Mali. Dougoufana, qui est âgé de 46 ans, est dans une famille de 8 enfants. Il martèle que l'importance de l’agriculture ne connaît pas de limite. On cultive pour avoir beaucoup de rendements, a-t-il ajouté. Il a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour une nouvelle technique de semis. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Dougoufana a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champs de 0.5 hectares. A travers cet achat, Dougoufana espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements et faire de l'élevage de chèvres et de moutons afin de pouvoir aider les proches. Ainsi, la famille serait contente et satisfaite.
texts.en: Dougoufana, who is sitting in a chair in the middle of the first row in the photo and wearing a black hat, is a member of a group of ten farmers who live and work in the village of Kolonda, which lies south of Bamako in Mali. Dougoufana, who is 46 years old, lives in a family of eight children. He stresses that the significance of agriculture has no limits and adds that he farms in order to make a lot of profit. He decided to register with myAgro for a new seeding technology. In his first year with myAgro, he has bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing corn in his 0.5 hectare field. By doing this, he hopes to be able to increase his profits and start raising goats and sheep so he can help his nearest and dearest. The family will then be happy and satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: Desanges Group

texts.fr: Justine est commerçante, conseillère du groupe solidaire «Desanges», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un menuisier, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés et propriétaire d’une boutique dans le quartier central depuis 5 ans. Elle  va acheter des cartons biscuits, piles, savon Omo, huiles, sucre, farine, etc.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Justine is a trader and an advisor to the "Desanges" group; she is a customer of IMF Hekima, 36 years old, married to a carpenter and mother to four children, all of whom are at school. She began her business with funds from her husband. She sells a variety of manufactured good and has owned a shop in the central district for the past five years. She is going to buy cartons of biscuits, batteries, Omo soap powder, oils, sugar, flour, etc. In so doing, she would like to increase her capital and to be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy cartons of biscuits, batteries, Omo soap powder, oils, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Eva De Jesus

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de tamales, pupusas y papas fritas, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos. María desea reconstruir la galera de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reconstruir la galera de su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, evitando que en el próximo invierno sus pocas pertenencias se deterioren por la humedad.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old, and is a hard-working woman who makes a living from her business making and selling tamales, pupusas, and french fries.  She has done this work for 4 years, and so she can count on a good customer base that likes her products.

She wants to rebuild the roof of her home, since, as can be seen in the photo, it is damaged.  For this she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails.  By doing this, she will improve her family's quality of life, avoiding their few belongings being water-damaged during the next winter.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to rebuild the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy millet grains.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
A sus 55 años de edad Juan logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando en talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recubridora con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At 55 years of age Juan has achieved opening a sewing business where he sews for third parties and sews his own line of clothing, thanks to the experience he has had working in tailoring shops.  He works Monday through Saturday, between 9 and 11 hours daily depending on the amount of work.  He knows that it is thanks to his customers that he has good business.

He wants to expand his horizons and be able to offer work to people who need it, for which he is requesting a loan in order to buy a coverstitch machine.  With the new machine, he will be able to take in new business and increase his volume of work, giving him the opportunity to hire someone to work with him.

His dream is to continue growing and build a workshop so that one day the history will show that thanks to the Kiva contributors and lenders, and the help of Interactuar, he was able to build a great business.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine that will allow him to hire an employee and increase the number of requests he can receive.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz, de 48 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida al lado de su hijo y su esposo.

Ella se desempeña como confeccionista de distintas prendas en contratación con terceros tales como pijamas, camisetas y ropa interior.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hijo.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada, siempre en busca de oportunidades para progresar y mejorar como empresaria.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar una maquina recubridora que le permita mejorar su nivel de producción y poder aumentar sus ventas.

De esta forma podría solventar todos sus gastos y podría tener esa vida plena que tanto ha soñado.
texts.en:
Luz, at 48 years old, is very clear on what it is she wants for her life and is dedicated to getting ahead and having a good life together with her son and her husband.  She works as a seamstress making clothing by contract with third parties. She sews certain pieces such as pajamas, shirts, and undergarments.  She started this work eager to find the necessary resources to support her son.

She is a hard-working and disciplined woman, always in search of opportunities for progress and improvement as an entrepreneur.  She is requesting a loan to buy a coverstitch machine that will allow her to increase her level of production and improve her sales.  In this way she will be able cover all her expenses and have the full life she has dreamed of.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine to improve her quality level and her production time.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Carolina es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
El prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Envigado, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja sola durante 4 horas 6 días a la semana.
Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de un carro de comidas,  este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
It's thanks to the perseverance and courage of Carolina that those in her home are able to have a decent life.

She prepares and sells fast food in the community of Envigado, an occupation which she took up with the desire to earn additional income to support her family. 

Her spouse and children are the her biggest motivation to work daily and strive to be better each day.

She works alone for 4 hours, 6 days a week.

Carolina hopes to be able to propel her business forward with the purchase of a traveling food car. This boost to Carolina can come from the Corporación Interactuar and from the lenders of Kiva.

With this, she will be able to have her food available for her customers at any moment.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area in order to not lose any of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a traveling food car in order to have a more organized business and be able to move around the parks in search of better sales.

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.es: Hernán de 26 años de edad, es el propietario de una tienda desde hace 2 años,  cuando para incrementar sus ingresos decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, con la cual genera ingresos así como por ser  agente de policía desde hace 5. El  hermano de Hernán  lo ha apoyado   para sacar adelante su tienda. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, de lunes a domingos, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche,  comprando en centrales de abastos que ofrecen precios más competitivos, que lo hacen hacer una buena oferta en su mercado objeto.  Sus principales clientes son vecinos del sector, especialmente las mujeres que responden por la satisfacción alimentaria de sus familias y que día a día compran en pequeñas cantidades, de acuerdo a su presupuesto.    En la actualidad Hernán está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, bebidas, cárnicos, enlatados, lácteos etc. Con esta inversión tendrá una oferta diversificada de productos y sus ventas se impactarán, lo cual es el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Hernán, 26 years old, has been the owner of a store for 2 years when, to increase his income, he decided to undertake his own business venture, with which to generate income and also as a police officer for 5 years. Hernán's brother has supported him to get his store ahead. His makes his sales in cash and on credit, from Monday to Sunday, from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, buying at supply centers which offer more competitive prices, which allows him to make a good sale in his target market. His primary customers are his neighbors in the sector, especially the women who respond to their families' food satisfaction and who, day to day, purchase in small quantities, according to their budget. Currently, Hernán is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase groceries, snacks, drinks, meats, canned goods, dairy products, etc. With this investment, he will have a diversified offering of products and his sales will be impacted, which is the success of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, snacks, drinks, meats, canned goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Feria Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El progreso de la Feria” está conformada por 5 socias responsables y trabajadoras Jessica 31años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de útiles de aseo. El deseo de Jessica es de poder terminar de construir su casa .Solicitó el crédito para la compra de jabón, pasta dental, cepillo de diente y toallas. El grupo “EL Progreso de la Feria” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Jessica  es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo rosado a rayas.
texts.en: The El Progreso de la Feria communal bank group is made up of 5 responsible and hard-working members. Jessica, 31 years old, is separated with 2 dependent children. Currently, she works selling personal hygiene products. Jessica's desire is to be able to finish building her house. She asked for the loan to purchase soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and towels. The El Progreso de la Feria group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible and promise to continue working well. Jessica is the first on the right and is wearing a pink striped shirt.

loans.use: to purchase soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and metal to build a pila [a water storage tank] in her house.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Aurora tiene 46 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de cocinas a gas. Su mayor deseo es terminar la construcción de su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de puertas ventanas y otros materiales de construcción. Ella participa en el grupo “LAS ESTRELLITAS”. ”. El grupo agradece a  los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Aurora es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Aurora is 46 years old. She lives with her domestic partner and two dependent children. She works fixing and maintaining gas stoves. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house. She will use the loan to buy doors, windows and other building materials. She participates in the group “LAS ESTRELLITAS” (The Little Stars). ” The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for the given loan. Aurora is the second from the left in the picture.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows and building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, sand and cement to build a wall to protect his house.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Ladislao es un hombre de 56 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y trabaja como agricultor.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, fuerte, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘Chapare’ que cuenta con una amplia infraestructura hotelera y servicios turísticos, su clima es húmedo y cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 24 a 40 grados centígrados en verano, los deportes que se practican mayormente son; el rafting, canotaje, ciclismo, trekking, etc. Además cuenta con 2 parques nacionales (Isiboro Sécure – Carrasco), cuya biodiversidad contribuye a mantener el ecosistema de la Amazonía. 
Ladislao es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que efectúa. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben caminar una distancia aproximada de 10 minutos hasta el rio para recoger agua en baldes y recipientes. Su actividad es la producción de frutas y verduras de estación, las variedades de cultivos que produce, los vende a diferentes clientes, el banano es para exportación, las demás frutas y verduras son para el mercado interno y lo vende por cosecha entera. “la mayoría de los pobladores se ocupan de cuidar la tierra para vender la cosecha entera, es un trabajo mejor remunerado que vender a granel…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es que debe vivir en un lugar donde no tiene acceso a servicios básicos. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo que cuente con todos los servicios, él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para vivir en mejores condiciones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que trabaja la tierra.
Es por esos motivos que Ladislao solícita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para vivir en un hogar con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
Ladislao is a 56-year-old man who lives with his partner, without children, and works as a farmer.  

He is enterprising, independent, dependable, strong, responsible, and hard working. His work is located in Chapare, which has a wide infrastructure of hotels and tourist services. Its climate is humid and warm, with a temperature that varies during the day between 24 and 40 degrees centigrade in the summer. The most common sports that they do are rafting, canoeing, bicycling, hiking, etc. In addition, it has 2 national parks (Isiboro Sécure - Carrasco) whose biodiversity contributes to maintaining the Amazonian ecosystem. 

Ladislao has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a robust physique, and his native language is Quechua, which he speaks in this place and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business which he does. He has his life alongside his partner who works in agriculture. They live in their own house made of wood with a roof of metal sheeting and a dirt floor which has electricity. To get water, they have to walk a distance of about 10 minutes to the river to get water in buckets and containers. His work is growing fruits and vegetables in season. The variety of crops that he produces, he sells to different customers. The banana is for export, the other fruits and vegetables are for the domestic market and he sells them as a whole harvest. "The majority of the population works caring for the land to sell their harvest whole, it is better paid work than selling in bulk..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he has regular customers. The disadvantage is that he has to live in a place where there is no access to basic services. His dream is to build a brick house that has all the services. He wants to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to live in better conditions. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years he has worked the land. 

For these reasons, Ladislao asks for a loan to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to live in a home with all the conveniences.

loans.use: to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area to live in a house with all the  conveniences.

loans.name: Bughoye Thuyikolere Group

texts.en:
Peace lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a member of Bughoye Thuyikolere Group. She is aged 36, and is a married woman with seven children of whom four attend school. 

She deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize, beans, and rice. She has hopes of developing and expanding her businesses, despite the difficulty of price fluctuations of produce products. 

Peace will use the loan to buy more beans and rice to sell.

She has taken a group loan where members guarantee each other for the facility without pledging security.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira is married and has five children. She has a big and lovely family. They are living in the Baku region. 

A while ago Zemfira started  selling women's clothes at home. To support the business, she needs a loan in amount of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan, Zemfira wants to buy more clothes to sell so she can develop her business and increase her monthly income. 

Zemfira wish the best for her children, and she works hard. 

She says thanks to Kiva organization and lenders for a loan and the help. 

In the future she wants open a store and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her business; in future she wants open a store and to give a good education to her children.

loans.name: Mugusu B Abmwe Group

texts.en:
Robert is a 48-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of making and selling charcoal. He is faced with challenges of bad weather that makes his charcoal go bad and at time loses his market. However, he has future plans of building a permanent house to live well and have a good homestead. 

He has asked for a loan to buy firewood to make his charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to make charcoal to sell
